title:Cobes-3's Reduced MNK Wishlist.
description:This is a reduced wishlist that removes controller specific rolls from 48klocs voltron file. It also sorts rolls with tags to the top.


// Albedo Wing PvE first-choice roll
// auxilliary Reserves, Low-Impedence Windings, Appended Mag, Grave Robber, Field Prep, Close To Melee
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of bulkier Minor, and Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Only the second Aggressive Glaive subtype so there's not much of a comparison to make, but Albedo Wing seems to have decent stats. The range is good, so you can focus on the shield duration stat with the haft perk for major damage reduction in PvE. Although the reload speed is also poor, we can bypass that with traits, so Appended Mag ups mag size by one. In the first trait column, Grave Robber procs on glaive melees, or Field prep boosts reserves, and reload speed when crouched, and Close to Melee in the second boosts melee damage by 30% for a projectile hit. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Shield Duraction, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=580685494,1087426260,1631667848,1782407750
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=2713678205,1087426260,1631667848,1782407750
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=580685494,1087426260,2869569095,1782407750
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=2713678205,1087426260,2869569095,1782407750

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, HonedEdge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Cold Steel
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies and Champions in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. Zephyr's stats are much like any other adaptive sword, except the DSC raid-drop Bequest. But it has a trick that now other sword can do - the Cold Steel trait perk. For single target damage, the additional damage from Jagged Edge is the best choice, although Honed Edge and Tempered Edge are decent alternatives. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation for swords, but don't discount other guards that help with guarding stats as you'll be up close and will probably need the damage resistance. As your trait perk combination, both Relentless Strikes and Cold Steel proc off three hits, with the first two Cold Steel hits Stasis slowing and the third hit freezing enemies. That covers Overload and Unstoppable Champions. Throw on Radiant from a solar subclass to cover Barriers too, and you have the sword equivalent of Riptide which will freeze lock Majors with every third hit, and which you can apply Stasis subclass fragments too as well. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3650930298
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=2827049491,269888150,1749209109,3650930298
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3650930298

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, HonedEdge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Whirlwind Blade
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Zephyr's stats are much like any other adaptive sword, except the DSC raid-drop Bequest. For single target damage it doesn't really do anything that other swords don't already cover, but if you don't have one for boss damage, yet the additional damage from Jagged Edge is the best choice, although Honed Edge and Tempered Edge are decent alternatives. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation for swords, but don't discount other guards that help with guarding stats as you'll be up close and will probably need the damage resistance. For burst damage, Relentless Strikes returns ammo on every third hit and Whirlwind Blade can quickly boost damage by 30% after 10 hits. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=2827049491,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3913600130

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes, Unrelenting, Chain Reaction, Surrounded, Collective Action
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Zephyr's stats are much like any other adaptive sword, except the DSC raid-drop Bequest. For add clearing, it doesn't really do anything that other swords don't already cover, but if you don't have one yet for add clearing, the a mag boosting blade slot perk keeps you slashing for longer. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation for swords, but don't discount other guards that help with guarding stats as you'll be up close and will probably need the damage resistance. In the first trait slot, as the support perk, Tireless Blade or Relentless Strikes return ammo, or Unrelenting recovers health. In the second, you could use Chain Reaction for the explosions to help clear adds, or Surrounded or Collective Action for additional damage to help clear bulkier Minor spec and the occasional Major spec enemies. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Indebted Kindness PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Confined Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Explosive Ordnance, Lead From Gold, Surrounded
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for chunkier Minor and Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Indebted Kindness is the first ever Rocket-Assisted Frame sidearm, so there's no comparison possible. It seems to be a weird mix of sidearm and grenade launcher, which hits like a truck. Blast Radius seems to be the most impactful stat so any of the barrel perks that help boost it are viable. For similar reasons, High-Explosive Ordnance is the top choice for the mag perk. As this is a special weapon, Lead From Gold as the first trait perk should keep your ammo topped-up and Surrounded, while a bit of a risky choice maybe, boosts damage by 35% when procced to turn the truck into a juggernaut. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3381450498&perks=1478423395,1380253176,1119449540,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3381450498&perks=1844523823,1380253176,1119449540,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3381450498&perks=1441682018,1380253176,1119449540,3708227201

// Indebted Kindness PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Confined Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Explosive Ordnance, Lead From Gold, Beacon Rounds, Loose Change, Permeability
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. ??? 106909392 2420895100 1087426260 ???: First-choice PvE pick for Major Spec enemies particularly for Void Gyrfalcon Hunters in end-game content. Indebted Kindness is the first ever Rocket-Assisted Frame sidearm, so there's no comparison possible. It seems to be a weird mix of sidearm and grenade launcher, which hits like a truck. Blast Radius seems to be the most impactful stat so any of the barrel perks that help boost it are viable. For similar reasons, High-Explosive Ordnance is the top choice for the mag perk. The new-to-Season 23 Permeability trait in the second trait column means, if you're running Gyrfalcons, you can use Indebted Kindness to apply volatility at will - making this really strong against Barrier Champions as well as for add clear. You can pair this with Lead From Gold to help with ammo economy, Beacond Rounds for strong enemy tracking or Loose Change for speedy reloads, if you're using Gambler's Dodge. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Horror Story PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Accurized Rounds, Under-Over, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for anti-Barrier champions in end-game content. Horror Story has returned and become a stasis precision auto-rifle - the first of its subtype. The stats are unexceptional, as you might expect from an event weapon but there are some trait combinations to save it. Recoil direction doesn't really matter on a precision-frame weapon, and stability is less important with a more reliable recoil direction, so you can choose your pick of Handling, Range and Reload Speed from your barrel and mag perks. For use with a seasonal anti-Barrier auto-rifle mod, Under-Over in the first trait column as the support perk and Vorpal Weapon as the signature perk in the second combine together to break shields and barriers faster, if you don't already have a specialised auto-rifle. Both origin traits are more PvP-orientated, but Nadir Focus's extra range and accuracy for free is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

dimwishlist:item=177568179&perks=1482024992,3230963543,1870851715,1546637391

dimwishlist:item=177568179&perks=1840239774,3142289711,1870851715,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=177568179&perks=1482024992,3142289711,1870851715,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=177568179&perks=3250034553,3142289711,1870851715,1546637391

// Warden's Law PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Appended Mag, Tactical Mag, Enlightened Action, Perpetual Motion, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Major Spec enemies in end-game content. The reprised Warden's Law is the first of a new Heavy Burst subtype, so there's nothing to compare it against. The stats look like those of a 120 but with less range and, although the magazine looks generous, every trigger pull shoots two bullets so in reality, you'll only have 8 shots at base. Handling and Stability could both do with a bump, so Fluted Barrel is the first choice for the barrel, with Corkscrew Rifling as an alternate choice. Appended Mag adds 2 "shots", or Tactical Mag adds one, but also helps with Stability and Reload Speed. In the first trait column, as the support perk, Enlightened Action will boost both handling and reload speed just for hits so you'll get two stacks per burst, or Perpetual Motion will provide smaller bumps to stats. In the second column as the signature perk, Vorpal Weapon, particularly in combination with Lucky Pants for Hunters, can do some decent damage against Majors, but mostly for Champions, when a seasonal mod is in play - with the two shots, this should be particularly good against overloads. Recommended MW: Stability with Enlightened Action or Handling with Perpetual Motion, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec, or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Warden's Law Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Appended Mag, Tactical Mag, Enlightened Action, Perpetual Motion, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Major Spec enemies in end-game content. The reprised Warden's Law is the first of a new Heavy Burst subtype, so there's nothing to compare it against. The stats look like those of a 120 but with less range and, although the magazine looks generous, every trigger pull shoots two bullets so in reality, you'll only have 8 shots at base. Handling and Stability could both do with a bump, so Fluted Barrel is the first choice for the barrel, with Corkscrew Rifling as an alternate choice. Appended Mag adds 2 "shots", or Tactical Mag adds one, but also helps with Stability and Reload Speed. In the first trait column, as the support perk, Enlightened Action will boost both handling and reload speed just for hits so you'll get two stacks per burst, or Perpetual Motion will provide smaller bumps to stats. In the second column as the signature perk, Vorpal Weapon, particularly in combination with Lucky Pants for Hunters, can do some decent damage against Majors, but mostly for Champions, when a seasonal mod is in play - with the two shots, this should be particularly good against overloads. Recommended MW: Stability with Enlightened Action or Handling with Perpetual Motion, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec, or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

dimwishlist:item=267089201&perks=1840239774,106909392,1428297954,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=267089201&perks=4090651448,106909392,1428297954,1546637391

// Loaded Question PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game activities. Loaded Question is back, and has some interesting new combinations. Being a high-impact fusion rifle, there are only five bolts, so stability is slightly less of an issue - Fluted Barrel adds useful handling, and Hammer-Forged Rifling or Smallbore add Range as the barrel perk. There are traits which bypass reload time and work best with as large a magazine as possible, so Ionized or Enhanced Battery are the top battery choices. In the first trait slot as the support perk, Overflow doubles your magazine size just for running over a special ammo brick, or 7-8 rapid kills with another weapon overfills the magazine by up to 10 shots with Envious Assassin. Every shot in your overfilled mag, beyond it's normal limit, will trigger Reservoir Burst in the second trait slot as the signature perk, a Chain Reaction-type explosions on kills to clear adds, and +25% damage to burst down Majors and maybe the occasional boss DPS phase. Plus you can build into the Arc 3.0 blinding and jolting verb kit with an arc subclass, making this a bit of a PvE Swiss-Army Knife. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3125454907&perks=1840239774,1483536627,3643424744,1427256713

dimwishlist:item=3125454907&perks=1840239774,2680121939,3643424744,1427256713
dimwishlist:item=3125454907&perks=1482024992,2680121939,3643424744,1427256713
dimwishlist:item=3125454907&perks=1840239774,1483536627,968510818,1427256713

// Loaded Question Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game activities. Loaded Question is back, and has some interesting new combinations. Being a high-impact fusion rifle, there are only five bolts, so stability is slightly less of an issue - Fluted Barrel adds useful handling, and Hammer-Forged Rifling or Smallbore add Range as the barrel perk. There are traits which bypass reload time and work best with as large a magazine as possible, so Ionized or Enhanced Battery are the top battery choices. In the first trait slot as the support perk, Overflow doubles your magazine size just for running over a special ammo brick, or 7-8 rapid kills with another weapon overfills the magazine by up to 10 shots with Envious Assassin. Every shot in your overfilled mag, beyond it's normal limit, will trigger Reservoir Burst in the second trait slot as the signature perk, a Chain Reaction-type explosions on kills to clear adds, and +25% damage to burst down Majors and maybe the occasional boss DPS phase. Plus you can build into the Arc 3.0 blinding and jolting verb kit with an arc subclass, making this a bit of a PvE Swiss-Army Knife. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2914913838&perks=1840239774,1483536627,3643424744,1427256713

// The Messenger PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Under-Over, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for Anti-barrier Champion use in end-game activities. The reprised Messenger has a few new tricks for Season 21, which make it worth a look. Good stats across the board, except for recoil direction, which we can help out with Arrowhead Brake in the barrel slot, which takes it to a controllable 90. For use against Barrier Champions, Armor-Piercing Rounds adds 5% damage to shields and barrier, which is boosted a further 10% with Under-Over in the first trait slot as the support perk. In the second slot, the new-for-Lightfall Kinetic Tremors as the signature perk adds bonus AoE damage for 12 hits or four bursts, damaging the stunned Champion and any adds within 5m. If you're running solo content, don't forget the Alacrity origin trait to pretty much max out every stat on the board, and add 10 Aim Assist too. Recommended MW: any will work, depending on your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3796795102&perks=839105230,1968497646,1870851715,3891536761

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strike, Whirlwind Blade
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for for Majors and Bosses. No second origin trait, but Dawning Surprise helps you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so - ideal in keeping you alive in CQC. In the blade slot, Jagged Edge to maximises damage or Tempered Edge balances a bit of extra damage and ammo, for all-round utility. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation in the guard slot, to get your heavy attack up as quickly as possible. For groups and single target damage, Relentless Strikes helps with your ammo economy, while Whirldwind Blade builds up to 30% bonus damage after 10 hits - great for chunkier Minor add clear or a Major or Boss.. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=396910433&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=396910433&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3913600130

// Mechabre PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Perpetual Motion, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for building into Arc 3.0 subclasses. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Direct competitor to Occluded Finality, but with a much more reasonable 45 Zoom. You don't really need to worry about range, so look no further than Fluted Barrel to boost Handling and Stability. You want to make your reloads as fast as possible, so Flared Magwell or Tactical Mag are you mag choices. In the first trait column, Perpetual Motion boosts Reload Speed even more so that when you get your first add kill, you can reload as fast as possible to proc Jolt with Voltshot in the second column for additional damage against a Major or Boss and add clear of any Minors nearby. This is as close as you'll get to a legendary Cloudstrike. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-boss, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1280894514&perks=1840239774,3230963543,1428297954,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1280894514&perks=1840239774,106909392,1428297954,2173046394

// Mindbender's Ambition PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Lead From Gold, Auto-Loading Holster, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 34. PvE first-choice roll for solar subclasses in end-game content. Probably only necessary if you've not already got a good solar shotgun that does the same job. There's a few barrel perk options - Corkscrew Rifling or Barrel Shroud for more handling, or Smallbore for a bit more range. In the mag, Assault Mag or Tactical Mag are two solid choices. Then, in the trait columns You could use Threat Detector, Lead From Gold or Auto-Loading Holster to pair with Incandescent to use scorch and ignition to clear groups of adds or help with damage to Majors. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Taipan-4fr PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Clown Cartridge, Triple Tap, Field Prep, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for burst damage against majors and Champions in end-game content. Shapeable. An end-game LFR that you don't need to complete a Raid, Dungeon or Trials for, which works for both burst and sustained damage, especially with the Veist Stinger origin trait throwing in extra shots for free at random. A Handling barrel just makes using it snappier, and Enhanced Battery adds a shot with no downsides, to give the origin trait an extra chance to proc. For solo or against more mobile bosses, take your choice of Clown Cartridge, Triple Tap or Field Prep with Frenzy, so you don't need to worry about how close your are to the rest of your fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Defiance of Yasmin PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Barrel, Lead From Gold, Firing Line, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats, plus the lowest Zoom in class. Add Handling with the barrel, and then maximise your mag size with Extended Mag and Backup Mag together. Lead From Gold means you only have to run Power Ammo finders and scavengers so you'll have plenty of ammo for use against Majors and Champions, with the added damage from Firing Line or Vorpal Weapon. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Qullim's Terminus PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Stats For All, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for in end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. The only High-Impact Stasis LMG available as at v6.2.0.6, but comparing to other HIs, the stats are a mixed bunch. It's slow-firing, so you should be able to control the recoil with extra stability from the barrel choice. Go all-in for mag size with Extended Mag to boost the benefits from the origin perk to get you close to 100 shots without reloading. Stats for All helps with gunfell and for when you finally do need to reload, but the real joy is in the Swiss-Army knife benefits of Killing Tally - three kills gets you a 30% damage buff with no time limit for the rest of the huge magazine or until stowed - better than either Firing Line or Focused Fury can offer - good for ripping through Minor adds, burst damage against Majors or even sustained damage against Bosses. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1321506184&perks=1392496348,2420895100,1583705720,557221067

dimwishlist:item=1321506184&perks=1840239774,2420895100,1583705720,557221067

// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Triple Tap, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, and in particular for melee-heavy playstyles. For endgame content, Triple Tap keeps the bullets coming, and Surrounded provides a huge boost to CQC damage, complimenting the origin perk, and will help with damage against champions when the mod is in town. Unfortunately, Danger Zone has been lost in its re-issued format, so there's no complementary trait in the last column. You'll be swapping back and forth, so go for a handling barrel. Obviously Blinding Grenades in the mag, and then Auto-Loading Holster to reload while you're mopping up your blinded enemies with your Energy weapon. // Retold Tale PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Slideshot, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Still worth looking at, even without an origin perk, with the update 4.1.5 buff to pellet shotguns. For boss damage, Full Choke keeps pellets together, Tactical Mag maximises magazine size with some additional useful buffs too, or Assault Mag allows for a quicker follow up shot if you miss a pellet with your first. The Slideshot gets you reloads on the fly and One-Two Punch is still good for major and boss damage - if you can get close enough!  Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-major, pve-boss, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Retold Tale PvE backup roll
// Full Choke, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Slideshot, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE backup roll for end-game content. Still worth looking at, even without an origin perk, with the update 4.1.5 buff to pellet shotguns. For boss damage, Full Choke keeps pellets together; Appended or Extended Mag only give the same mag sized as Tactical Mag, but Slideshot gets you reloads on the fly and One-Two Punch is still good for major and boss damage - if you can get close enough! // Crux Termination IV PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Impact Casing, Envious Assassin, Reconstruction, Clown Cartridge, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major or Boss spec enemies in end-game content. As an aggressive RL, Crux Termination IV is in the highest damage category of rocket launchers, along with adaptive-frames, and has the highest velocity in its peer group to boot. You can look on the low blast radius as an advantage for boss fights, as you can get a bit closer without being killing yourself in the explosion. There's no Field Prep option, so you start off with 1 in the mag and 7 reserves, with one more rocket for each chest ammo reserve mod. Go for the highest velocity you can with the barrel perk and then, for boss damage, Impact Casing is always the best option. In the first trait column, you could look at Envious Assassin - up to three in the tube after 11 kills with other weapons. Alternatively Reconstruction passively provides 2 in the tube over the course of 8s, or Clown Cartridge does the same on a manual reload. For major or boss damage, Explosive Light provides up to 6 shots with +25% damage. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Crux Termination IV PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Impact Casing, Envious Assassin, Reconstruction, Clown Cartridge, Bipod
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors or sustained damage against Boss spec enemies in end-game content. As an aggressive RL, Crux Termination IV is in the highest damage category of rocket launchers, along with adaptive-frames, and has the highest velocity in its peer group to boot. You can look on the low blast radius as an advantage for boss fights, as you can get a bit closer without being killing yourself in the explosion. With one eye on Bipod as the second column trait, as there's no Field Prep option, you'll start off with 2 in the mag and 12 reserves, with one more rocket for each chest ammo reserve mod. Go for the highest velocity you can with the barrel perk and then, for boss damage, Impact Casing is always the best option. In the first trait column, you could look at Envious Assassin - up to five in the tube after 11 kills with other weapons. Alternatively Reconstruction passively provides 4 in the tube at the rate of one every 4s, or Clown Cartridge provides 3 or 4 after a manual reload. For burst and sustained Boss damage, Bipod just about breaks even with 25% less damage and slower reloads, but faster firing and more reserve ammo. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Uzume RR4 PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Appended Mag, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Fourth Time's The Charm, Clown Cartridge, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Uzume RR4 has very nice stats in it's subfamily, but the 50 zoom is either a blessing or a curse, depending on your viewpoint. Either way this is only worth keeping if you don't have a decent solar sniper, or it's better than the one you're replacing. The recoil direction of 75 is vertical, but if you're firing repeatedly at a crit spot it's still a good idea to control it with a boost to recoil direction or additional stability from your barrel perk. Handling is always nice to have too. Appended Mag gets you an extra shot - you can also use Alloy Mag or Flared Magwell to boost reload speed as your mag perk instead. In the first trait column as the support park, Fourth Time's The Charm or Clown Cartridge are pretty much tied - if you can reliably hit crits, FttC might get you an extra shot more reliably before reloading. In the second as the signature perk, Vorpal Weapon is the best of the bunch for a permanently-on +15% against Major Spec and Boss Spec enemies. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Double-Edged Answer PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Burst Guard, Balanced Guard, Cross Counter, Counterattack
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies, or Boss spec enemies with short damage windows in end-game content. Double-Edged Answer has awful base stats and a huge perk pool so, if you are looking for a roll, reset your Vanguard reputation a few times first. Jagged Edge provides the most damage as a Blade perk, but decimates your ammo, so Honed Edge and Tempered Edge might be attractive alternatives. For this roll, you'll be looking to block damage, so a Guard perk like Burst Guard or Balanced Guard works best. This is the only sword dropping in S23 with the combination of Flash Counter and Counterattack - get in close to a tanky enemy to bait them into a melee/slam attack, and then the combination of weaken and bonus damage provides +80% damage for 2s, and +20% for the next two, which should be enough time to put a serious dent in their health bar. Nadir Focus could be an interesting mini-Eager Edge - each light attack increases lunge distance, if you want some fun. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Boss, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Retrofuturist PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Auto-Loading Holster, Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies in end-game content. Unfortunately, Retrofuturist is distinctly meh, so it's only worth hanging onto a roll if it fills a hole in your vault, and even then you'll have to reset your Crucible rank a few times to stand a decent chance of the roll you're after. As a Lightweight shotgun, you do get the +20 mobility and +6.25% movement speed and, for some reason, it has a base mags size of 7, but that's where the praise ends. If you're hanging onto one, try a barrel perk that adds Handling, although a bit of range and stability doesn't hurt either. Assault Mag and Tactical Mag are the best mag perk choices, but Appended Mag or Light Mag aren't bad. For burst damage against majors, the trait combination of Auto-Loading Holster and Trench Barrel is decent enough. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Retrofuturist PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Pugilist, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies in end-game content. Unfortunately, Retrofuturist is distinctly meh, so it's only worth hanging onto a roll if it fills a hole in your vault, and even then you'll have to reset your Crucible rank a few times to stand a decent chance of the roll you're after. As a Lightweight shotgun, you do get the +20 mobility and +6.25% movement speed and, for some reason, it has a base mags size of 7, but that's where the praise ends. If you're hanging onto one, try a barrel perk that adds Handling, although a bit of range and stability doesn't hurt either. Assault Mag and Tactical Mag are the best mag perk choices, but Appended Mag or Light Mag aren't bad. For burst damage against majors, there's the well-established trait combination of Pugilist, to recover melee energy and Swashbuckler for up to a +33% damage boost after a melee kill. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Supercluster PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Fourth Time's the Charm, Reconstruction, Thread Detector, Lead From Gold, Surrounded, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for fallback damage against Boss spec in end-game content. Shapeable. Supercluster is the first Strand pinpoint slug shotgun, and the good news is it has very competitive stats. The bad news is that they're not as great as they were a few years ago for boss DPS, but you might want to keep one just in case, if you don't have a slug shotty already. Use the barrel perk to boost range and the mag perk to improve its utility - your preference between Assault Mag or Tactical Mag, or Appended Mag. If you're looking for a backup DPS weapon, then a reloading perk in the first trait column - Fourth Time's The Charm, Reconstruction, Threat Detector, or Lead From Gold for you ammo economy are all possible. For a damage boosting perk in the second trait slot, choose between Surrounded, if you're likely to be in CQC with extra adds, or Vorpal Weapon for a reliable 15% boost to damage against Majors and Bosses. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Retold Tale PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Barrel Shroud, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Light Mag, Appended Mag, Lead from Gold, Slideshot, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage to Major Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for melee builds. Retold Tale has okay stats compared to other precision frame shotguns and the trait pool is weighted towards PvP, but there's still some nice combinations here. First, for the barrel perk, Full Choke keeps the pellet spread tighter, or Barrel Shroud, Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling all add useful stats and for the mag slot while Tactical Mag or Assault Mag are the top two choices, Light Mag or Appended Mag aren't bad alternatives. If you don't already have a One-Two Punch Shotgun, then this can work - Lead From Gold to keep your ammo topped off, or Slideshot for instant slide reloads in the first trait column to support One-Two Punch in the second to pair with an aggressive melee-focussed build for burst damage against Majors, including stunned Champions. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Albedo Wing PvE first-choice roll
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content with an arc subclass. Only the second Aggressive Glaive subtype so there's not much of a comparison to make, but Albedo Wing seems to have decent stats. The range is good, so you can focus on the shield duration stat with the haft perk for major damage reduction in PvE. The reload speed is poor, and Light Mag is the only perk that helps. In the first trait column, Clown Cartridge can overflow the magazine on reload to 5 or 6, and there are plenty of arc grenades the glaive melee doesn't count unfortunately, to proc the second stack of Golden Tricorn with for a 50% damage boost for 10s. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Shield Duraction, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=580685494,679225683,2284787283,2610012052

// Glacioclasm PvE first-choice roll
Full Bore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Full Bore, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Extended Battery, Controlled Burst
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec or Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Grab Glacioclasm while you can - unusually, for a world-drop weapon it has great stats as a High-Impact fusion rifle. Only firing five bolts, it's a bit more controllable than faster-firing subtypes, so spec into range with the barrel perk. In the battery perk slot, you're aiming to get as many shots as possible, with Ionized or Extended Battery. For the first trait perk, there's really only one to consider, and that's Overflow to instantly double your battery size for picking up ammo. Combine that with Controlled Burst in the second trait slot for DPS that'll hold up as a burst damage weapon against Majors or a backup weapon for boss damage phases. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Shield Diraction, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Glacioclasm PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore, Smallbore, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel, Ionized Battery, Extended Battery, Overflow, Controlled Burst
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against crowds of Minor adds or Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Grab Glacioclasm while you can - unusually, for a world-drop weapon it has great stats as a High-Impact fusion rifle. Only firing five bolts, it's a bit more controllable than faster-firing subtypes, so spec into range with the barrel perk. In the battery perk slot, you're aiming to get as many shots as possible, with Ionized or Extended Battery. For the first trait perk, there's really only one to consider, and that's Overflow to instantly double your battery size for picking up ammo. Combine that with Controlled Burst in the second trait slot for 10% faster charge time and 20% bonus damage DPS that'll hold up as a burst damage weapon against Majors or a backup weapon for boss damage phases. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Glacioclasm PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore, Smallbore, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel, Ionized Battery, Extended Battery, Overflow, Reservoir Burst
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against crowds of Minor adds or Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Grab Glacioclasm while you can - unusually, for a world-drop weapon it has great stats as a High-Impact fusion rifle. Only firing five bolts, it's a bit more controllable than faster-firing subtypes, so spec into range with the barrel perk, although don't be put off by pretty much any barrel. In the battery perk slot, you're aiming to get as many shots as possible, with Ionized or Extended Battery. For the first trait perk, there's really only one to consider, and that's Overflow to instantly double your battery size for picking up ammo. Combine that with Reservoir Burst - which works for all overflowed rounds in the battery - to both burst down Majors with 25% bonus damage and help crowd control groups of adds with exploding corpses. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Avalanche PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Flared Magwell, Stats For All, One For All
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing chunkier Minor Spec, and Major Spec enemies in end-game content. The stats are okay overall - there are a could of surprises with 90 Aim Assist and 19 Zoom, which are a lot higher than its peers - but unfortunately Avalanche has the lowest ammo reserves of any adaptive which limits its usefulness. If you already have a decent solar LMG, then you can pass. If you don't, Arrowhead Brake cleans up the recoil direction to 100, or Smallbore or Fluted Barrel boost useful stats as the barrel perk. Then, Appended Mag, Extended Mag or Flared Magwell can all work as mag perks. Finally, the SOFA Stats/ One For All traint combination layers on more useful stats and a chunky 35% damage boost for 10s when procced. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, HonedEdge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Surrounded
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Zephyr's stats are much like any other adaptive sword, except the DSC raid-drop Bequest. For single target damage it doesn't really do anything that other swords don't already cover, but if you don't have one yet for boss damage, the additional damage from Jagged Edge is the best choice, although Honed Edge and Tempered Edge are decent alternatives. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation for swords, but don't discount other guards that help with guarding stats as you'll be up close and will probably need the damage resistance. For burst damage, Relentless Strikes returns ammo on every third hit and Surrounded boosts damage by 35% if there are enemies nearby - this can be useful in crowded boss fights. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=2827049491,269888150,1749209109,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3708227201

// originally found at https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep90-warlords-ruin-weapons.txt

@title:Season 23 Warlord's Ruin weapons
@description:New weapons dropping from the Warlord's Ruin dungeon, with the Sundering origin trait

// Vengeful Whisper PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Slice, Precision Instrument
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for support against Major and Boss spec enemies in end-game content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Vengeful Whisper is no exception - even going as far as an extra point of zoom over other precision bows. This also has traits appearing in non-standard columns to make for some unique rolls. As with every bow, the aim is to reduce draw time first, and improve accuracy second - Elastic String does the first job and Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching does the second. The combination of Slice in the first trait column and Precision Instrument in the second could make for an interesting combination to apply Sever to majors and bosses from range - even when they're immune to damage - to reduce their damage output by 40% for 10s or 15s with Thread of Continuity effectively a 40% DR for the whole fireteam as well as doing decent, for a primary weapon, damage with the boost from Precision Instrument. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=839344841&perks=2801223209,3827198035,923806249,555281244
dimwishlist:item=839344841&perks=2801223209,3429800428,923806249,555281244

// Naeem's Lance PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Reconstruction, Slice
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for against Major or Boss Spec enemies, particularly with Strand subcalsses, in end-game content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Naeem's Lance is no exception, having pretty good overall stats. It's the first Rapid-fire Sniper so, as is common for most snipers, Handling is a crucial stat but, as this is a rapid-fire frame, you'll also need to tidy up the recoil direction, so Arrowhead Brake is the barrel perk choice, taking the stat to a manageable 84. As the mag perk, Tactical Mag is the best option, as it boosts stability a bit too, and gives the same rounds in the mag seven as Appended and Extended Mag, but either of those work too. For the first trait, Reconstruction doubles your mag size passively, while Slice in the second trait makes this possibly the best special weapon to pair with a Bait and Switch heavy weapon - reducing the Severed target's damage output by 40% for 10s 15s with Thread of Continuity if you're using a Strand subclass - an effective additional 40% DR for your whole fireteam. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Indebted Kindness PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Confined Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Explosive Ordnance, Impulse Amplifier, Loose Change, Voltshot
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Major Spec enemies particularly for Arc subclasses in end-game content. Indebted Kindness is the first ever Rocket-Assisted Frame sidearm, so there's no comparison possible. It seems to be a weird mix of sidearm and grenade launcher, which hits like a truck. Blast Radius seems to be the most impactful stat so any of the barrel perks that help boost it are viable. For similar reasons, High-Explosive Ordnance is the top choice for the mag perk. Voltshot, as the second trait perk, should make it easy to apply Jolt to a target and help clear adds quickly, but relies on a fast reload - Impulse Amplifier as the first trait perk helps all the time or, after your first application of Voltshot, Loose Change boosts reload speed by 50. Throw on other fragments like Spark of Beacons for additional blinding to suppress adds, or Ions/Discharge to feed your abilities and this could be a top choice for crowd control. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Dragoncult Sickle PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Slice, Surrounded, Whirlwind Blade
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Major and Boss Spec enemies particularly for Strand subclasses in end-game content. This is the first new Caster-Frame sword we've seen in some time, and the first Strand one. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Dragoncult Sickle is no exception, having pretty good overall stats - both Impact and Ammo Capacity are higher than its peers. The advantage you have with caster frames is that you can hit from range with the heavy attack, but the ammo cost as at v7.3.0.3 is still a little high. On the other hand, you can use it for major or boss damage - the standard Jagged Edge for the extra damage and Swordmaster's Guard for the Blade and Guard perks still apply. The new-to-Season-23 Slice as the first trait perk gives this an ability to sever a major or a boss, reducing its outgoing damage by 40% for 10s or 15s with Thread of Continuity, which can be a lifesaver in a CQC fight. In the second trait column as the signature perk, you could go for Surrounded, if you know there will be adds around to boost damage by 40%, or Whirlwind Blade if there aren't. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Mechabre PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Keep Away, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Mechabre it's so obviously a pun on Macabre, so let's just pronounce it Mech-ah-bruh is reportedly excellent in PvP, but like all aggressive snipers it struggles to find a role in PvE. One thing you could do is use it to apply jolt to beefier targets at a distance. As with most snipers, look for a handling-boosting barrel perk. Building towards the end, Flared Magwell gives the biggest boost to reload speed out of the magazine perks, with Tactical Mag a decent alternative. Keep Away in the first trait column as the support perk boosts reload speed by a further 30, as well as boosting range and accuracy all of which, with a reload Masterwork, can get the reload speed up to 85. Get one kill against an add, reload and then Voltshot in the second column as the signature perk can apply jolt to your next target from a safe distance for burst and AoE damage. The Search Party origin trait is more PvP-orientated, but faster ADS speed is always nice to have. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Acosmic PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Smart Drift Control, Spike Grenades, Field Prep, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. If you weren't around to shape your own Regnant, and don't have a decently-rolled Explosive Light grenade launcher, Acosmic named after one of the two Hindu aspects of god; to be acosmic is to deny the objective reality of the temporal world - transcendental in a world-negating sense, according to Merriam-Webster is a void rapid-fire frame GL, with the intrinsic 20% faster reload when its magazine is empty, and is a viable option. Use the barrel perk to get shots to the target as fast as possible, and Spike Grenades adds 13.3% to total damage for a direct hit in the magazine slot. In the first column, for the support trait perk, saves a reserves perk on your chest and significantly boosts reload when you crouch. Explosive Light is the second column as the signature perk adds +52.5% to total damage for up to six shots for great burst damage, as well as boosting the blast radius to 100 - great against Majors surrounded by minor adds. The Nadir Focus origin trait boosts your shot velocity further, which is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Swordbreaker PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Pugilist, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for melee builds and burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. Swordbreaker is back as a strand shotgun, has good stats - particularly the ones that matter most - and like all lightweights offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed. In the barrel perk slot, Full Choke improves pellet spread which is important for later. For the mag perk, Tactical Mag increases the magazine by one and boosts reload speed or Assault Mag improves rate-of-fire. To make the most of the Cursed Thrall origin trait, which synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active, Pugilist is an obvious choice in the first trait column as the support perk, regenerating melee energy on weapon kills. In the second column as the signature perk, One-Two Punch is great for burst damage against a major or a champion, or even the occasional boss for melee-based builds. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Swordbreaker PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Subsistence, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. Swordbreaker is back as a strand shotgun, has good stats - particularly the ones that matter most - and like all lightweights offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed. As with most shotguns, Handling matters most, so Barrel Shroud or Cockscrew Rifling both offer bumps as the barrel park. For the mag perk, Assault Mag improves rate-of-fire or Tactical Mag increases the magazine by one and boosts reload speed. With a shotgun, you're going to be in CQC to proc Threat Detector as the first trait column support perk, to boost reload speed and handling or you could use Subsistence to continually reload your magazine as you get kills, if you're using this more for add-clear rather than single-target damage. The same CQC condition will proc Surrounded for a +40% 47% on Enhanced Surrounded boost to damage to help clear the most subborn Minor and Major enemies, and help with the occasional Boss. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Barrel and Mag re-shapeable. Swordbreaker is back as a strand shotgun, has good stats - particularly the ones that matter most - and like all lightweights offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed. As with most shotguns, Handling matters most, so Barrel Shroud or Cockscrew Rifling both offer bumps as the barrel park. For the mag perk, Assault Mag improves rate-of-fire or Tactical Mag increases the magazine by one and boosts reload speed. With a shotgun, you're going to be in CQC to proc Threat Detector as the first trait column support perk, to boost reload speed and handling or you could use Subsistence to continually reload your magazine as you get kills, if you're using this more for add-clear rather than single-target damage. The same CQC condition will proc Surrounded for a +40% 47% on Enhanced Surrounded boost to damage to help clear the most subborn Minor and Major enemies, and help with the occasional Boss. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Swordbreaker Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Subsistence, Sword Logic
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Barrel and Mag re-shapeable. Swordbreaker is back as a strand shotgun, has good stats - particularly the ones that matter most - and like all lightweights offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed. As with most shotguns, Handling matters most, so Barrel Shroud or Cockscrew Rifling both offer bumps as the barrel park. For the mag perk, Assault Mag improves rate-of-fire or Tactical Mag increases the magazine by one and boosts reload speed. With a shotgun, you're going to be in CQC to proc Threat Detector as the first trait column support perk, to boost reload speed and handling or you could use Subsistence to continually reload your magazine as you get kills, if you're using this more for add-clear rather than single-target damage. In the second column, as the signature perk, the new-to-season-22 Sword Logic could be interesting on a shotgun - you should be able to proc a lower stack pretty easily, and use the damage boost to help activate the higher stacks. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Song of Ir Yût PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Bait-and-Switch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies and sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. There's a lot of competition in the arc LMGs, and Song of Ir Yût has lower than average stats but saves itself with some nice trait perk combinations. Handling makes most weapons feel better - Fluted Barrel adds the most, but Arrowhead Brake also helps max out the recoil direction in the barrel perk slot. Maximise your magazine size with Extended Mag or Appended Mag as the perk, and then in the first column as the support perk, you can then make the most of this with Rewind Rounds or Reconstruction so you can essentially keep firing til you run out of ammo. With this set-up, you can use Bait-and-Switch as the second column signature perk for 10s of +35% damage, which is great for shorter boss damage phases think Caretaker in Vow. Maybe not so useful with this roll, but the Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Deadpan Delivery PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Overflow, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major or Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Decent stats in comparison with its peers. So if you're a Lethal Current Hunter in the market for a shotgun to pair with your melee, Deadpan Delivery is a very decent choice. For a One-Two Punch roll, start with Full Choke, to make hitting all your pellets a little easier. Tactical Mag increases the magazine to a maximum of 5 which is the same as Appended and Extended Mags. Then, as the first trait column support perk, there's no Grave Robber unfortunately, but Overflow doubles your magazine size for picking up ammo, which gives you 10 shots before you'll have to reload unless you pickup another ammo brick. Finally, One-Two Punch in the second column as the signature perk boosts your powered melee damage by a hefty 40%. You probably won't get much use out of the Nadir Focus Origin Trait, which adds range and accuracy on repeated hits, but it is nice to have anyway. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Deadpan Delivery PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Overflow, Trench Barrel, Frenzy, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major enemies in end-game content. Decent stats in comparison with its peers. If you're looking for an arc shotgun, Deadpan Delivery is a very decent choice. Start with a barrel perk that boosts handling - Barrel Shroud or Corkscrew Rifling both help a little - and Assault Mag improves the low rate of fire. In the first trait column as the support perk, Overflow doubles your magazine size for just picking up an ammo brick and then in the second column signature perk slot, to passively boost damage for end-game use you could use Trench Barrel, Frenzy or Collective Action. You probably won't get much use out of the Nadir Focus Origin Trait, which adds range and accuracy on repeated hits, but it is nice to have anyway. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Nox Perennial V PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Liquid Coils, Ionised Battery, Accelerated Coils, Envious Assassin, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major enemies and sustained damage against Bosses in end-game content. In case you're wondering, the name translates as "enduring" or "recurring" night - Nox Perennial is the first high-impact fusion rifle and, although the stats aren't top notch, this roll is worth watching for, for Majors and Boss phases for when you're running Tractor Cannon, say. As with all high-impacts, the handling is terrible - Arrowhead Brake adds a moderate amount as well as taking the recoil direction to 95, but Fluted Barrel and Corkscrew Rifling are decent alternatives. You could go in a couple of different directions with the battery perk - Ionic Battery adds two shots don't worry about the reload speed penalty, we can deal with that later, or Accelerated Coils ups the first rate, but Liquid Coils is probably the top choice - again we'll use a trait to reduce the charge time from three business days to something more usable. In the first trait column as the support perk, Envious Assassin can boost the battery to 15 charges with 14 rapid kills with other weapons, while Controlled Burst adds 20% damage while reducing charge time for hitting all your bolts. The Wild Card origin trait is great for PvE - the occasional drop of Telesto-like "Experimental submunitions" on a kill for a bit of free additional damage. Recommended MW: Charge Time or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Psi Hermetic V PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, Tactical Mag, Enlightened Action, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Stasis synergy and add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The name's a bit confusing - Psi Ψ is the 23rd letter in the Greek Alphabet, and Hermetic can mean something that's occult or mysterious and difficult to understand, relating to the legendary alchemist Hermes Trismegistus, tightly sealed, immune to external influence, or solitary like a hermit, so your guess is as good as anyone's. Anyway, this is a Stasis High Impact pulse rifle with decent stats. Look for something that helps with recoil direction, handling, stability or a mix as the barrel perk, and add range with Accurized Rounds or the useful gunfeel boosts of Tactical Mag. The traits are a bit PvP focussed - Enlightened Action is the best of the first column support perks, for big boosts to handling and reload speed with just two 3-bullet bursts. For Stasis synergy, Headstone generates a crystal on a crit kill, to use to proc your subclass fragments. The Wild Card origin trait is great for PvE - the occasional drop of Telesto-like "Experimental submunitions" on a kill for a bit of free additional damage. Recommended MW: Charge Time or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Psi Hermetic V PvE first-choice roll

//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The name's a bit confusing - Psi Ψ is the 23rd letter in the Greek Alphabet, and Hermetic can mean something that's occult or mysterious and difficult to understand, relating to the legendary alchemist Hermes Trismegistus, tightly sealed, immune to external influence, or solitary like a hermit, so your guess is as good as anyone's. Anyway, this is a Stasis High Impact pulse rifle with decent stats. Look for something that helps with recoil direction, handling, stability or a mix as the barrel perk, and add range with Accurized Rounds or the useful gunfeel boosts of Tactical Mag. The traits are a bit PvP focussed - Enlightened Action is the best of the first column support perks, for big boosts to handling and reload speed with just two 3-bullet bursts. While it's a bit more difficult to get Stasis ability kills for the second +50% damage stack to take down Majors, Golden Tricorn is still a great choice for the second column trait as the signature perk. The Wild Card origin trait is great for PvE - the occasional drop of Telesto-like "Experimental submunitions" on a kill for a bit of free additional damage.
