// Psi Hermetic V PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Accurized Rounds, Heating Up, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The name's a bit confusing - Psi Ψ is the 23rd letter in the Greek Alphabet, and Hermetic can mean something that's occult or mysterious and difficult to understand, relating to the legendary alchemist Hermes Trismegistus, tightly sealed, immune to external influence, or solitary like a hermit, so your guess is as good as anyone's. Anyway, this is a Stasis High Impact pulse rifle with decent stats. Boost range with your barrel and magazine perks - Full Bore or Hammer-Forged Rifling and Accurized Rounds adds up to 3.62m of ADS range. In the first trait column as the support perk, Heating up will straighten up the recoil direction and add stability, while Frenzy in the second column as the signature perk adds 15% damage and maximises handling and reload speed. The Wild Card origin trait is great for PvE - the occasional drop of Telesto-like "Experimental submunitions" on a kill for a bit of free additional damage. Recommended MW: Charge Time or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=358788212&perks=202670084,3142289711,1570042021,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=358788212&perks=3250034553,3142289711,1570042021,4104185692

// Luna Regolith III PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Triple Tap, Clown Cartridge, Field Prep, Explosive Rounds, Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Named after the unconsolidated debris that covers the moon's surface, the first thing to say is that, if you already have a decently rolled Aggressive Sniper Rifle in the hope that they get a touch of love in a future balance pass, you can move along as there's nothing to see here. The stats are weak in a currently as at v7.2.0.3 weak subtype, but if you're looking for a more easily obtained weapon, it's still very usable. It's a Vanguard weapon, so there is a huge trait pool - if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. As with all Sniper Rifles, Handling is king - there should be time between shots for the reticule to settle, so you don't need so much stability, making Fluted Barrel the top choice, with Arrowhead Brake, and Corkscrew Rifling as alternates. Tactical Mag gets you four in the mag, which is the same as Appended or Extended, so is the top choice there although Extended Mag + Backup Mag does get you to 5 total. In the first trait column as your support perk, you can make an argument for Triple Tap or Clown Cartridge, both of which can get you to 5 shots without reload with a base mag of 4, or 7/8 shots if the base mag is 5. Alternatively, Field Prep speeds up reloads and boosts reserve ammo. In the second trait column, as your signature perk, Explosive Payload is the best option for additional damage for solo play, or Firing Line works in a fireteam. While it's not a game-changer, the origin trait's Wild Card submunitions can be fun to help damage nearby adds on a kill. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod only with Extended Mag. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Semiotician PvE first-choiceroll
// Quick Launch, Impact Casing, Field Prep, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 76 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4UoXFYD3DbunDEKIGDiriX?si=1957400d9e024ed5 with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies, or burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. If you're interested, a Semiotician is someone who studies semiotics - symbols and meanings think Tom Hanks' "Symbologist" character in the Da Vinci Code. While High Impact rocket launchers aren't optimum for damage - doing 10% less damage than adaptives and aggressives - this is still the best Strand RL cvailable as at season 21, with great stats at base. If you're using this against a boss, velocity is more impart and than blast radius, so Quick Launch is your best barrel perk choice, and Impact Casing in the mag adds a little extra damage it all helps!. For your boss damage roll, enhanced Field Prep as the first trait column support park boosts the reload speed but, more importantly, is the equivalent of two reserve mods so you only need one to get to the maximum of 10. Enhanced Explosive Light as the second column signature perk gives you 7 rockets with a 25% damage boost for the low, low costs of just picking up orbs - good for both burst and sustained damage. Whether you find the Head Rush origin trait useful will depend on how often you crouch and get up again - if you do, the additional handling and reload speed is useful, if not game-changing. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// A Distant Pull PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Overflow, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors and sustained damage against Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. As at S21, A Distant Pull is the only non-raid kinetic rapid-fire sniper rifle. As you might expect, it comes with lower stats but it's still usable if you can fill the gaps. Fluted Barrel and Tactical Mag fill out Handling, Stability, Reload Speed and also max out the magazine size to 7. Overflow is laughably good on a special weapon, as a first trait column support park, doubling the magazine size just for picking up an ammo brick, even when stowed. Explosive Payload gives you a 30% passive damage boost, plus flinch, so is easily the best second column trait choice for your signature perk. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Until Its Return PvE first-choice roll
// Rifled Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Surrounded, Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. Backup PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. Shapeable. Until Its Return has decent stats in comparison to other kinetic slot rapid-fire shotguns and some reliable trait combinations. You can essentially ignore stability, handling and reload speed with the right traits, so you're left with range choices for the barrel, but Tactical Mag gets you to the maximum of 8 rounds, so there's no point looking at Appended or Extended Mag. In the first trait column as the support perk, Threat Detector at two stacks maxes handling and reload speed, and increases stability to around 80 and Surrounded in the second column as the signature perk boosts damage by 40% +47% for the enhanced version. Alternatively, Trench Barrel boosts damage by 50% for three shots after a melee hit. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Major, Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Thin Precipice PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Flash Counter, Counterattack
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage to Majors in end-game content. Shapeable. Thin Precipice is the first Strand sword, and is the fan-favourite vortex spin-to-win frame to boot. As with all swords, Jagged Edge is the usual choice for the blade for its increased damage and Swordmaster's Guard to reduce the time it takes for your heavy attack to charge, although you might want to look at Burst Guard or Heavy Guard to help tank damage. Against a Major that's just about to stomp, bring up your block to us Flash Counter in the first trait column as the support park, to suppress and weaken them for 4s, and then you'll have a couple of seconds with a 50% damage bonus for your heavy spin attack, with Counterattack in the second column as the signature perk. // The Supremacy PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Bair and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against majors in end-game activities. Shapeable. The Supremacy has decent in-band stats by comparison with other kinetic slot rapid-fire snipers. Putting out shots at pace needs some additional control with the barrel perk, but you also need handling if you're swapping between weapons, so Arrowhead Brake or Fluted Barrel are your best choices. Appended Mag gets you to the maximum of 7 in the mag without needing to use Extended Mag. As your first trait column support perk for burst damage, Enhanced Rewind Rounds refills 70% of the hits landed to the magazine from reserves when it's empty, or Lead from Gold is excellent for ammo economy. Bait and Switch as the second slot signature perk adds 35% dame when procced - excellent for burst damage against majors and champions when you don't want to waste power ammo, or if you're running Tractor Cannon and need a damage option. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Techeun Force PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Break, Liquid Coils, Rewind Rounds, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against majors and sustained damage against bosses in end-game activities. Shapeable. Techeun Force however Saint Kabr pronounces it... is reprised in a new, highly desirable perk set. I say set, it's really just one perk in particular. The stats to start are pretty good, although the recoil direction needs some attention, so Arrowhead Brake will take that to a controllable 90. For a damage roll, Liquid Coils is the obvious choice - don't worry, we'll get around the charge time penalty later. In the first trait slot, as the support perk, Rewind Rounds means you should be able to keep shooting until the battery is empty - you need a minimum of two shots in the mag to proc it, but then it reloads 2 shots from reserves. Finally, as the signature perk in the second trait slot, the new-for-S21 Controlled Burst drops your charge time by 10% and increases damage by 20% just for hitting all your bolts, making this great for burst and sustained damage. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Techeun Force PvE first-choice roll

The stats to start are pretty good, although the recoil direction needs some attention, so Arrowhead Brake will take that to a controllable 90. For a damage roll, Liquid Coils is the obvious choice - don't worry, we'll get around the charge time penalty later. In the first trait slot, as the support perk, Reconstruction overfills your magazine to double its capacity, or Envious Assassin can add up to nine shots to the battery with seven rapid kills. Finally, as the signature perk in the second trait slot, the new-for-S21 Controlled Burst drops your charge time by 10% and increases damage by 20% just for hitting all your bolts, making this great for burst and sustained damage. // Techeun Force PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Enhanced Battery, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Envious Assassin, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against majors and sustained damage against bosses in end-game activities. Shapeable. Techeun Force however Saint Kabr pronounces it... is reprised looking good. The stats to start are pretty good, although the recoil direction needs some attention, so Arrowhead Brake will take that to a controllable 90. Enhanced Battery then takes you to the maximum battery size. If you've not already got an arc-based Golden Tricorn fusion rifle, then look for Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction or Envious Assassin in the first trait slot as your support perk, to help with your uptime, and then Golden Tricorn is great for a reliable 15% refreshable damage bump up that goes up to a chunky 50% with an arc ability kill. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3591141932&perks=839105230,2680121939,3418782618,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=3591141932&perks=839105230,2680121939,1523832109,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=3591141932&perks=839105230,2680121939,968510818,2610012052

// Apex Predator PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Impact Casing, Reconstruction, Demolitionist, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. Backup PvE pick for burst damage against majors and sustained damage against bosses in end-game activities. Shapeable. Apex Predator has gone from the insta-shard class when it dropped, to pretty much the best rocket launcher option for putting out damage. Even though the stats are only middling, and you can't get to 10 shots - the maximum is 9, with two reserve mods, it's already in the highest subfamily for damage along with Aggressives, and is the best craftable rocket launcher in the game, as at S21. For an unguided rocket, Velocity is usually the play for the barrel perk - Hard Launch and Quick Launch are the two best options, depending on whether you want better Velocity or a combination of Velocity and Handling. Impact Casing adds 2.2% multiplicative damage in the magazine perk slot. In the first trait column as the support perk, you can have a choice of Reconstruction to passively overfill the barrel with 2 shots, or Demolitionist for the instant reload when throwing a grenade and the extra damage from the grenade as well. Enhanced Explosive Light lets you shoot seven rockets with a 25% damage boost, just for picking up orbs. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Velocity or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Compass Rose PvE first-choice roll
// Corkscrew Rifling, Barrel Shroud, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Lead From Gold, Grave Robber, Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 72 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5vRI9hBynq3jq712XCu7oc?si=c87cbb8036254e4a with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ???  ???: First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies in end-game content. First thing to say, if you already have a rapid hit or lightweight Trench Barrel shotgun then just shard this. If you haven't, then Compass Rose can be your stopgap until you do. The stats are a bit of a mixed bag, but Handling is usually the play with shotguns anyway, so Corkscrew Rifling or Barrel Shroud improve that, as well as other useful gunfeel stats, and Assault Mag increases your rate of fire, and hence DPS, or Tactical Mag takes the mag size to six to let you get two full bursts of three shots off without reloading, and then helps with reload speed. Grave Robber can be useful, if you're near a crowd of minors to keep Trench Barrel procced, but if you're doing damage against a single target it's not much use, so Lead From Gold is more reliably useful. The Dream Works origin trait is useful in a fireteam to get the occasional overflowed magazine in a firefight too. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Compass Rose PvE first-choice roll
// Corkscrew Rifling, Barrel Shroud, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Lead From Gold, Grave Robber, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 72 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5vRI9hBynq3jq712XCu7oc?si=c87cbb8036254e4a with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ???  ???: First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a solar subclass. First thing to say, if you already have a rapid hit or lightweight Incandescent shotgun then just shard this. If you haven't, then Compass Rose can be your stopgap until you do. The stats are a bit of a mixed bag, but Handling is usually the play with shotguns anyway, so Corkscrew Rifling or Barrel Shroud improve that, as well as other useful gunfeel stats, and Assault Mag increases your rate of fire, and hence DPS, or Tactical Mag takes the mag size to six and helps with reload speed. Grave Robber can be useful for reloads, as you'll likely be in CQC, or Lead From Gold is top-tier to help with your ammo economy. Incandescent is great for crowd control, particularly if you're on a solar subclass and can use your fragments to enhance the 3.0 verbs. The Dream Works origin trait is useful in a fireteam to get the occasional overflowed magazine in a firefight too. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Crowning Duologue PvE first-choice roll
// Confined Launch, Impact Casing, Alloy Casing, Field Prep Envious Assassin, Cluster Bombs
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 72 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5vRI9hBynq3jq712XCu7oc?si=c87cbb8036254e4a with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ???  ???: First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. It's difficult to know what role Precision rocket launchers are suppose to fill as at season 21. they do have the intrinsic tracking, but to 21% less damage than the adaptive and aggressive subfamilies, and can't ever compete with the blast radius of high-impacts for add clear. If you are going to use it, play into the tracking, and reduce the velocity so if an enemy jinks, it has as much time as possible to adjust with Confined Launch. Impact Casing adds some extra impact damage in the mag perk slot, or Alloy Casing provides faster reloads. Field Prep helps massively with ammo reserves - without it it you'll need three ammo reserve chest mods to get to 10 rockets, but with it you'll only need one. In the second trait column Envious Assassin can get you an extra shot in the mag with just one kill from another weapon, or if you can get to 11 rapid kills, you can load three, or you can use the small blast radius as a benefit to concentrate Cluster Bombs on your target for extra damage. The Dream Works origin trait is useful in a fireteam to get the occasional overflowed magazine in a firefight too. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Loaded Question PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game activities. Loaded Question is back, and has some interesting new combinations. Being a high-impact fusion rifle, there are only five bolts, so stability is slightly less of an issue - Fluted Barrel adds useful handling, and Hammer-Forged Rifling or Smallbore add Range as the barrel perk. There are traits which bypass reload time and work best with as large a magazine as possible, so Ionized or Enhanced Battery are the top battery choices. In the first trait slot as the support perk, Overflow doubles your magazine size just for running over a special ammo brick, or 7-8 rapid kills with another weapon overfills the magazine by up to 10 shots with Envious Assassin. Every shot in your overfilled mag, beyond it's normal limit, can be used with Controlled Burst - hit all the bolts to get +20% to damage and 10% reduced charge time to burst down Majors and maybe for the occasional boss DPS phase. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// BrayTech Osprey PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Hard Launch, Impact Casing, Field Prep, Bipod
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities. High-Impact Rocket Launchers are meant for add-clear - they have the highest blast radius stat of the subfamilies and do middling damage - 10% less than Adaptives or Aggressives. And saying that, BrayTech Osprey has the worst stats in its subfamily. But there might be an interesting roll for burst damage worth looking at anyway. Increase the velocity stat with the barrel and masterwork - Quick Launch and Hard Launch are the best options, and Impact Casing adds 2.2% multiplicative damage. In the first trait column as the support perk, for burst damage against Majors or sustained damage against a Boss, Field Prep for the extra reserves, which means you only have to run two reserves mods for the maximum number of rockets, and have the reload speed boost when crouched. In the second trait slot as the signature perk, Bipod could be very interesting - two in the mag, even with the loss of damage being offset by less need to reload. Maybe one to keep, just in case. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Taraxippos PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Fourth Time's The Charm, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Arrowhead Brake in the barrel takes it to a manageable 84. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed and an extra shot for Tac Mag. Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk adds 30% damage with no falloff, and is useful when Scouts are the seasonal anti-Overload Champion mod, only needing two shots to disrupt. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-champion, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Nessa's Oblation PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Assault Mag, Reconstruction, Fourth Time's the Charm, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon, Focused Fury

First-choice PvE roll for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still deal decent damage when the occasion demands. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Assault Mag increases RPM to 70 to increase your damage output. As your first trait column support perk, Reconstruction or Fourth Time's The Charm both work to extend the magazine during a damage window and, for your second column signature perk, take your choice of Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon or Focused Fury to boost damage output with. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. // Nessa's Oblation PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Demolitionist, Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy against Majors in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still deal decent damage when the occasion demands. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Tactical Mag boosts your mag size, stability and reload speed, so is a bit of a no-brainer for the magazine perk. As your first trait column support perk, Demolitionist means grenades remember, it's 20% grenade energy for special weapon kills, which means you should have an easy way to proc Paracausal Affinity for 20% bonus damage for 6s to clear beefier Minors, and Majors. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=1482024992,106909392,3523296417,3215448563
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=4090651448,106909392,3523296417,3215448563
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=839105230,106909392,3523296417,3215448563
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=1840239774,106909392,3523296417,3215448563

// Nessa's Oblation PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Void subclass synergy in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still be effective to control beefier minors, and majors. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Tactical Mag boosts your mag size, stability and reload speed, so is a bit of a no-brainer for the magazine perk. It's unusual to be able to roll two Void perks, so the opportunity to roll Repulsor Brace in the first trait column as your support perk, for damage reduction void overshields, and Destabilizing Rounds as your signature perk in the second to spread volatility on a kill is difficult to pass up. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=1482024992,106909392,776531651,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=4090651448,106909392,776531651,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=839105230,106909392,776531651,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=135029084&perks=1840239774,106909392,776531651,2048641572

// Nessa's Oblation Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Assault Mag, Reconstruction, Fourth Time's the Charm, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still deal decent damage when the occasion demands. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Assault Mag increases RPM to 70 to increase your damage output. As your first trait column support perk, Reconstruction or Fourth Time's The Charm both work to extend the magazine during a damage window and, for your second column signature perk, take your choice of Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon or Focused Fury to boost damage output with. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Nessa's Oblation Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Demolitionist, Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy against Majors in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still deal decent damage when the occasion demands. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Tactical Mag boosts your mag size, stability and reload speed, so is a bit of a no-brainer for the magazine perk. As your first trait column support perk, Demolitionist means grenades remember, it's 20% grenade energy for special weapon kills, which means you should have an easy way to proc Paracausal Affinity for 20% bonus damage for 6s to clear beefier Minors, and Majors. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Nessa's Oblation Adept PvE backup roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Appended Mag, Demolitionist, Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE roll for Light subclass synergy against Majors in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still deal decent damage when the occasion demands. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Appended Mag adds a shot, which is always a good thing, as your magazine perk. As your first trait column support perk, Demolitionist means grenades remember, it's 20% grenade energy for special weapon kills, which means you should have an easy way to proc Paracausal Affinity for 20% bonus damage for 6s to clear beefier Minors, and Majors. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Acasia's Dejection PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk can both take advantage of the higher damage stacks of Target Lock as your second column signature perk, turning this into a legendary solar Coldheart. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Acasia's Dejection PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk both give you greater uptime for Paracausal Affinity's 20% damage boost after a kill from any Light damage source as the second column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

First-choice PvE roll for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk can both take advantage of the higher damage stacks of Target Lock as your second column signature perk, turning this into a legendary solar Coldheart. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. // Acasia's Dejection Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk both give you greater uptime for Paracausal Affinity's 20% damage boost after a kill from any Light damage source as the second column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Harsh Language PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, High-Velocity Rounds, Envious Assassin, Field Prep, Threat Detector, Stats for All, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy and burst damage to Majors in end-game content. The reprised Harsh Language is only the second void wave-frame grenade launcher. Lower stats that Deafening Whisper although the range of stats is pretty compressed - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. You start out with 100 blast radius - not that it makes any difference as it's the dump stat for wave frame GLs - so you can use the barrel and mag perks for velocity and handling. Quick Launch is ideal, and Smart Drift Control works as a good alternate, and out of the two choices, High-Velocity Rounds is the mag perk to choose. In the first trait column Envious Assassin can give you up to three shots in the barrel for killing adds with your primary or power weapon, but Field Prep, Threat Detector or Stats for All are all worth considering as a support perk. Void subclasses provide a great toolkit to trigger the second stack of Golden Tricorn for 50% bonus damage, in the second trait column for your signature perk. Recommended MW: Handling or Velocity, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Hand in Hand PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Slideshot, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for sustained damage to Bosses and Majors in end-game content. The reprised Hand in Hand is the only non-endgame arc aggressive shotgun currently as at v7.0.0.6 in game but, as usual for a world drop, the stats are on the low side - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. Building towards One-Two Punch as your signature perk, Full Choke aids pellet spread, as you'll need to hit your target with all of them. Then Tactical Mag adds an extra extra shot and a bonuses to reload speed and stability which admittedly, you'll not need so much. As your support perk in the first trait column, Slideshot is normally regarded as a PvP-flavoured perk but bypasses the reload to keep the magazine full for One-Two Punch in the second trait column. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Hand in Hand PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Slideshot, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage to Majors in end-game content. The reprised Hand in Hand is the only non-endgame arc aggressive shotgun currently as at v7.0.0.6 in game but, as usual for a world drop, the stats are on the low side - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. Handling is the standard play for shotguns, so Barrel Shroud or Corkscrew Rifling are your best choices. Assault Mag brings your RPM up to 60 and also boosts stability - maybe not so essential with a slower firing shottie, but still nice. As your support perk in the first trait column, Slideshot is normally regarded as a PvP-flavoured perk but bypasses the reload to keep the magazine full, and you can take advantage of the arc toolkit to proc the second stack of Golden Tricorn as your signature perk in the second trait column to boost damage by 50%, as well as proccing useful arc verbs, like Blinding with Spark of Beacons. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Nasreddin PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, 
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for damage to Bosses in end-game content. First thing to say about the reprised Nasreddin named for a legendary trickster figure in Muslin folklore is that if you already have a decent arc sword, you can give this a miss, as there's nothing that really makes it stand out except, maybe, for a slightly higher base Impact stat, and the new Devrim Kay VIII Foundry origin trait which should make the heavy attack rechage rate a little faster, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. For newer Guardians, the usual recommendations of Jagged Edge as the blade perk for additinal damage, Swordmaster's Guard for the guard perk to get the heavy attack up as fast as possible. Then Relentless Strikes as your support perk in the first trait column, which works well to return ammo against all enemies, and either Whirlwind Blade or Surrounded, to boost damage, for your signature perk in the second. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking, a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. Envious Assassin overflows the magazine from primary and special weapon skills so you can take full advantage of the Enhanced Explosive Light's extra stack of damage over the standard version and have a magazine capable of using all seven stacks before reloading! Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking, a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. If you looking for a fun add-clear weapon for bulkier minors, with an eye towards Incandescent as your signature perk in the second trait slot, then maximise your Blast Radius with your barrel and mag perks, and masterwork - Volatile Launch or Confined Launch with High-Explosive Ordnance. Envious Assassin overflows the magazine from primary and special weapon kills, or Field Prep adds bonus reserves and reload speed as you options for your support park in the first trait column. Both add utility to Incandescent, and you can add Ember of Ashes for more scorch stacks and faster ignitions. // Royal Executioner PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Envious Assassin, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage in end-game activities. Shapeable. Season 20's solar adaptive fusion rifle has okayish stats, with the Noble Deeds origin perk helping with a boost to handling and reload speed when procced. Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk makes the recoil much easier to control, taking the Recoil Direction from 58 to 88. Particle Repeater is an option to control the bolts, but Accelerated Coils is the better play - you'll be killing red bars even with the slight reduction in damage and you'll appreciate the faster charge time. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling, for more snappiness and Reload Speed, so fits in really well. Envious Assassin is the stand out support perk in the first trait column - overflow the magazine with primary and power weapon kills, and this is the only non-Raid fusion rifle that you can do that with. Every overflowed shot will then do 25% bonus damage with Reservoir Burst as your second trait column, signature perk, as well as making enemies explode, making this great for both add-clearing groups of minors and burst damage against majors. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-major, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Caretaker PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Flash Counter, Surrounded, One For All
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Majors and Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. This is maybe our first non-Raid sword with significantly different stats - the Charge Rate is 60, by comparison with every other adaptive sword's 20 except DSC's Bequest, and the Noble Deeds origin perk boosts the charge rate further for buffing Guardians around you. As with most swords, go for as much impact damage as possible, so Jagged Edge as your blade plus the inevitable Impact Masterwork. Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. For your support park in the first trait column, Relentless Strikes don't require a kill to return ammo, so is best for chunkier adds and Majors, although Flash Counter's weaken effect is also worth considering. Majors are usually accompanied by minors, so Surrounded especially when enhanced or One for All as signature perks in the second trait column can both work well when you need to do damage up close. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-major, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Tripwire Canary PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts or the Veist Stinger will provide the occasional fast reload and draw. The Lightweight frame provides +20 mobility and 6.25% boost to movement, which is always useful. As with all bows, get the draw time as low as possible with Elastic String, and then recover the lost accuracy with Fiberglass Arrow Shaft. For end-game content, in the first trait column, Archer's Tempo rewards crit hits with even faster draw time. Explosive Head not only adds bonus damage passively, but also disrupts overload Champions in fewer hits, when the mod is around. // Path of Least Resistance PvE first-choice roll

An arc legendary trace rifle to complete the energy set. Stats are a bit of a mixed bag, but there are a few interesting rolls, and at least now you can collect them all! Pump up stability as high as it will go to keep your shots on target. // Judgment of Kelgorath PvE first-choice roll
// Auxilliary Reserves, Appended Mag, Overflow, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts but will be more use for a glaive than Hakke Breach Armaments. JoK is a new subtype for Season 19 - a slower, but harder hitting slashy shooty stick than we're used to. You're going to be in CQC, where projectile speed governed by range isn't quite as important, so the shield can be quite useful to survive in a crowd. Use your haft to improve charge time and shield duration, and take the extra shot from Appended Mag Extended Mag gives you no more shots so isn't worth it. In the first trait column, Overflow on a Special or Power weapon is just so good - more than double your magazine size and it bypasses the low reload speed just for picking up a brick! Pair that with the newly buffed Surrounded for a ridiculous 40% 47% for the Enhanced version bonus to projectile damage for just for being near three enemies. MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Judgment of Kelgorath PvE first-choice roll
// Auxilliary Reserves, Appended Mag, Overflow, Unstoppable Force
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts but will be more use for a glaive than Hakke Breach Armaments. JoK is a new subtype for Season 19 - a slower, but harder hitting slashy shooty stick than we're used to. You're going to be in CQC, where projectile speed governed by range isn't quite as important, so the shield can be quite useful to survive in a crowd. Use your haft to improve charge time and shield duration, and take the extra shot from Appended Mag Extended Mag gives you no more shots so isn't worth it. In the first trait column, Overflow on a Special or Power weapon is just so good - more than double your magazine size and it bypasses the low reload speed just for picking up a brick! Unstoppable Force then gives a 30% damage bonus to projectiles for blocking with your shield, letting you tank damage and take on beefier adds and Majors. // Retrofit Escapade PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Field Prep, Fourth Time's the Charm, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, although Suros Synergy's flinch reduction in reload is useful in a firefight too so take your pick. This is better in every stat than the only other rapid fire LMG - Shattered Cypher - and there are a few ways you can go with a weapon build. You'll need to control your fire with short bursts - so, to make it easier, tighten up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake. For damage against a single target, you want your magazine as large as it will go, so look for Extended or Appended. Then extend the magazine with Fourth Time's the Charm, or improve your ammo reserves and reload with Field Prep in the first trait column to give Target Lock's 40& bonus to damage as much uptime as possible. Recommended  MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag or damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3103325054&perks=839105230,2420895100,2869569095,365154968

// Fire and Forget PvE first-choice roll
Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Field Prep, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game boss DPS. Shapeable. Veist Stinger is the origin trait to use, as it procs per shot rather than per burst, which means you'll probably never need to reload. F&F is a non-endgame obtainable  boss-killing replacement for Reed's Regret, and a aggressive-frame companion to Stormchaser. Being a stasis LFR, it's easy to get a Font of Might 25% boost to your damage if you have a Warlock putting down a Well and willing to use the Supreme Wellmaker mod, and you're using the Elemental Shards and Elemental Time Dilation mods. You'll need to keep your shots on a boss's crit spot, so maximise your stability with your barrel, and then add in an extra charge with no downsides with Enhanced Battery. For major or boss damage, use Field Prep to boost your ammo reserves which you'll be calling on with Veist Stinger. Frenzy is an easily procced 15% damage boost just for being in combat, or Vorpal Weapon is an uncomplicated 10% boost against Majors and Bosses. Recommended  MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2272041093&perks=1392496348,2680121939,2869569095,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2272041093&perks=1392496348,2680121939,2869569095,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2272041093&perks=1392496348,2680121939,2869569095,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=2272041093&perks=1392496348,2680121939,2869569095,1546637391

// Fire and Forget PvE first-choice roll
Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Headstone, Chill Clip
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game boss DPS. Shapeable. Veist Stinger is the origin trait to use, as it procs per shot rather than per burst, which means you'll probably never need to reload. F&F is a non-endgame obtainable stasis LFR replacement for Reed's Regret, and an aggressive-frame companion to Stormchaser.  You'll need to keep your shots on a major or boss's crit spot, so maximise your stability with your barrel, and then add in an extra charge with no downsides with Enhanced Battery. For major or boss damage, use Field Prep to boost your ammo reserves which you'll be calling on with Veist Stinger. For stasis subclass synergy, Fire and Forget can roll or be crafted with two stasis perks - use Headstone and Chill Clip for stasis crystals and slow stacks to work your Aspects and Fragments on. Recommended  MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Glacioclasm PvE backup roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Enhanced Battery, Particle Repeater, Accelerated Coils, Subsistence, Slideshot, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE backup roll for Void subclass in endgame content. Option of Omolon Fluid Dynamics or the Dawning Surprise origin trait can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. There are no real holes in the stats, but Fluted Barrel or Smallbore provide nice boosts in the barrel. In the battery, Enhanced Battery gets you more shots, Particle Repeater helps keep the burst tight, or if you're a little impatient, Accelerated Coils reduces charge time. For Void subclasses, the second stack of Golden Tricorn should be easy to proc with the melee and grenade toolkit, and Subsistence or Slideshot keeps you putting out damage. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Avalanche PvE first-choice roll
Arrowhead Brake. Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Ambitious Assassin, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for chunkier Minors with a Solar subclass in endgame content. Option of Suros Synergy or the Dawning Surprise origin trait which can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. Balanced stats, so you can use Arrowhead Brake to get straight recoil, or Fluted Barrel for extra Handling and Stability. In the mag slot, we'll be wanting to take full advantage of Ambitious Assassin's 10% bonus mag size per rapid kill after reloading with a size-boosting option. Then use the Target Lock second-column trait to get up to a passive 40% damage boost against a single target just for shooting at it - ideal for Major or Boss damage. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

@title:Season 18 Festival of the Lost weapons

// Mechabre PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Appended Mag, Flared Magwell, Auto-Loading Holster, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for burst damage against Majors. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Direct competitor to Occluded Finality, but with a much more reasonable 45 Zoom. You don't really need to worry about range, so look no further than Fluted Barrel to boost Handling and Stability. It's difficult to get to five in the mag to make Triple Tap proc twice, so go for Appended Mag instead to add an extra round, or Flared Magwell for Reload Speed and Stability boosts. In the first trait column, Auto-Loading Holster lets you swap to another weapon to keep DPS up, and in the second column, Vorpal Weapon adds 15% damage against Majors, Bosses and vehicles. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-God, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

dimwishlist:item=1280894514&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3300816228,1546637391

// Mechabre PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Appended Mag, Clown Cartridge, Vorpal Weapon, High-Impact Reserves
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for burst damage against Majors. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Direct competitor to Occluded Finality, but with a much more reasonable 45 Zoom. You don't really need to worry about range, so look no further than Fluted Barrel to boost Handling and Stability. It's difficult to get to five in the mag to make Triple Tap proc twice, so go for Appended Mag instead to add an extra round. In the first trait column, Clown Cartridge boosts magazine size by a shot or two on reload, and in the second column, Vorpal Weapon adds 15% damage against Majors, Bosses and vehicles or High-Impact Reserves will add up to 25% bonus damage once you get past the second bullet. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-God, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// BrayTech Werewolf PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Pugilist, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for Barrier Champions, when the mod's around. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Excellent, pretty much best-in-class stats, and the precision frame means you don't really have to worry about Recoil Direction, so boost your gunfeel stats with your barrel. Armor-Piercing Rounds adds 5% damage against shields and barriers, and Vorpal Weapon in the second trait column boosts damage against Majors including Champions, Bosses and vehicles by 20%. There's noting much that helps in the first trait column, so just take Pugilist to turn this into a Legendary mini-Monte Carlo. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-God, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-Champion, Controller, MKB tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-major, pve-champion, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2869466318&perks=1840239774,1968497646,691659142,1546637391

// Commemoration PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Subsistence, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits the amount depends on the weapon archetype. Good stats and a stellar PvE perk pool make this an LMG worth chasing. You can choose to sort the recoil with Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel, or improve stability with Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. Most mag choices could have a role - boost your magazine size with Tactical, Appended or Extended Mag. Killing Tally is the easiest to proc damage boosting perk if you're killing adds - 3 kills equals 30% bonus damage until you stow or reload, which you won't have to do much with Subsistence refreshing your magazine, so you could keep firing until you're empty. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// The Militia's Birthright PvE first-choice roll
// Smart Drift Control, Spike Grenades, Slideways, Ambitious Assassin, Frenzy, One For All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 34. PvE first-choice roll for burst damage against Majors and stunned Champions in end-game content. Probably only necessary if you've not already got a good Spike Grenade roll on an Ignition Code or Pardon Our Dust. Handling and Velocity are what you need in your barrel, and Quick Launch delivers both. Spike Grenades adds damage for direct hits, and there's a case for both Slideways for reloading and a Handling boost, or Ambitious Assassin to improve damage output in your first trait column, and Frenzy or One For All in the second. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

Probably only necessary if you've not already got a good solar shotgun that does the same job. // Doom of Chelchis PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Explosive Payload, Vorpal Weapon, Frenzy, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! With a Precision Frame, you won't need to worry too much about recoil direction, and you already have tonnes of range, so focus on Stability and Handling, with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to help further with stability and reload speed. It's rare to be able to roll two damage perks so if you're looking for something that you can use against Minor adds, the occasional Major or Champion, then Explosive Payload or Vorpal Weapon, in combination with Frenzy or Focused Fury should give you pretty much permanent additional damage uptime.  Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1937552980&perks=1392496348,106909392,3038247973,2896038713

// Doom of Chelchis Harrowed PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Explosive Payload, Vorpal Weapon, Frenzy, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! With a Precision Frame, you won't need to worry too much about recoil direction, and you already have tonnes of range, so focus on Stability and Handling, with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to help further with stability and reload speed. It's rare to be able to roll two damage perks so if you're looking for something that you can use against Minor adds, the occasional Major or Champion, then Explosive Payload or Vorpal Weapon, in combination with Frenzy or Focused Fury should give you pretty much permanent additional damage uptime.  Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Adept Big Ones, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Zaouli's Bane PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Explosive Payload, One For All, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! Use the barrel to round out your preferred Range/ Stability/ Handling stat, and then you want as many bullets in the mag as possible with either Tactical Mag or Appended Mag plus a Backup Mag mod, to help with the origin trait boost. For end-game content with a fireteam, Explosive Payload adds flinch and damage and is useful to disrupt Overload Champions with a matching mod, and One For All or Focused Fury are your reliable damage boost sources. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Zaouli's Bane PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Mag, Ensemble, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for Solar subclasses in general content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! Use the barrel to round out your preferred Range/ Stability/ Handling stat, and then you want as many bullets in the mag as possible with Extended Mag using a trait to help with the reload penalty, to help with the origin trait boost. Then, to synergise with Solar subclasses, you can craft a mini-Sunshot by taking Ensemble for the faster reload and handling in a fireteam, together with Incandescent for your scorch and ignite explosion chaining. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Qullim's Terminus PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Stats For All, Heating Up, Unrelenting, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for Stasis builds in end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. The only High-Impact Stasis LMG available as at v6.2.0.6, but comparing to other HIs, the stats are a mixed bunch. It's slow-firing, so you should be able to control the recoil with extra stability from the barrel choice. Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell are both good choices in the mag slot. Treat this as a heavy Scout Rifle for dealing with beefier adds and choose your traits accordingly - Stats For All or Heating Up add significant gunfeel boosts, or Unrelenting helps with health regeneration. For Stasis subclasses, Headstone provides a starting point for boosting abilities, crowd control or gaining damage reduction. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Midha's Reckoning PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Ionised Battery, Enhanced Battery, Field Prep, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Increasing the battery size with Ionised Battery and Reservoir Burst pushes you to the maximum of 8 in the mag with Enhanced RB you only need Enhanced Battery. You can get around the reload penalty from Ionised Battery when crouching with Field Prep and have more ammo in reserve to use in combination with Reservoir Burst. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. RB procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, with a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=3250034553,1483536627,2869569095,1427256713

// Midha's Reckoning PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Ionised Battery, Enhanced Battery, Unrelenting, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Increasing the battery size with Ionised Battery and Reservoir Burst pushes you to the maximum of 8 in the mag with Enhanced RB you only need Enhanced Battery. You should be getting plenty of kills with Reservoir Burst, so you can use Unrelenting to recover your health while in combat. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. RB procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, with a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Midha's Reckoning PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Cornered, Field Prep, Unrelenting, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Any Battery with Backup Mag pushes you up to eight shots in the battery, so why not take advantage of a shorter charge time from Accelerated Coils? Further build into the faster charge time with Cornered, add ammo reserves and faster reloads with Field Prep, or trigger health regeneration on kills with Unrelenting in the first trait column. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. Reservoir Burst procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, giving you a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Midha's Reckoning PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Cornered, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for Arc 3.0 builds in end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Any Battery with Backup Mag pushes you up to eight shots in the battery, so why not take advantage of a shorter charge time from Accelerated Coils? Further build into the faster charge time for burst damage against Majors with Cornered, in the first trait column. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to 13 shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. Golden Tricorn x2 boosts damage by 50% for 10s, to melt Majors and the occasional Boss maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=3250034553,689005463,1799762209,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=1482024992,689005463,1799762209,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=1840239774,689005463,1799762209,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=4090651448,689005463,1799762209,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=839105230,689005463,1799762209,2610012052

// Midha's Reckoning Harrowed PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Ionised Battery, Field Prep, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Increasing the battery size with Ionised Battery and Reservoir Burst pushes you to the maximum of 8 in the mag. You can get around the reload penalty from Ionised Battery when crouching with Field Prep and have more ammo in reserve to use in combination with Reservoir Burst. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. RB procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, with a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Increasing the battery size with Ionised Battery and Reservoir Burst pushes you to the maximum of 8 in the mag. You should be getting plenty of kills with Reservoir Burst, so you can use Unrelenting to recover your health while in combat. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three.
