The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Any Battery with Backup Mag pushes you up to eight shots in the battery, so why not take advantage of a shorter charge time from Accelerated Coils? Further build into the faster charge time with Cornered, add ammo reserves and faster reloads with Field Prep, or trigger health regeneration on kills with Unrelenting in the first trait column. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. Reservoir Burst procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, giving you a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. // Tarnished Mettle PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Fourth Time's The Charm, Rapid Hit, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, and in particular for melee-heavy playstyles, so that's not very useful for a Scout Rifle. Arrowhead Brake cleans up the recoil direction, and either Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell help with both stability and Reload Speed. For endgame, both Fourth Time's The Charm and Rapid Hit help keep the bullets coming, and Explosive Payload helps with damage, flinch and disrupting Overload Champions when the mods around. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// No Reprieve PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Outlaw, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for general content. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, and in particular for melee-heavy playstyles. High-ish stats make this fairly competitive in slot if you don't look too closely at Heritage, anyway. You can never go wrong with a bit more range from your barrel, and faster fire rate, or an extra round in the mag and better reload speed. For endgame content, Outlaw keeps the bullets coming, and Surrounded provides a huge boost to CQC damage, complimenting the origin perk, and will help with damage against champions when the mod is in town. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Sailspy Pitchglass PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Extended Battery, Rapid Hit, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, so won't be much use for a LFR. Struggles in a field dominated by Stormchaser, but it is better than Tarantula, if you're looking to replace a roll. Fluted Barrel should help with ADS speed and landing repeated crit shots, and Enhanced Battery is the only real choice in your second column. For Major damage, Rapid Hit helps with Stability to keep on target and reload speed, and either Frenzy or Vorpal Weapon increase damage over a short timeframe. // Pardon Our Dust PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Blinding Grenades, Auto-Loading Holster, Danger Zone
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 26. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Another opportunity to get a kinetic Blinding Grenade Launcher, if you haven't already - an essential tool in any end-game toolbox. You'll be swapping back and forth, so go for a handling barrel. Obviously Blinding Grenades in the mag, and then Auto-Loading Holster to reload while you're mopping up your blinded enemies with your Energy weapon. There's not that much in the second column of traits, but Danger Zone give you additional damage options when you're in CQC. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-minor, pve-major, controller, mkb

// Wastelander M5 PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Pugilist, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 30. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. The first Tex Mechanica legendary weapon - a lightweight, so it boosts mobility for movement speed. To clear majors, use Full Choke to constrain the pellet spread a little, Tactical Mag for an extra bullet in the magazine or Assault Mag if you miss a pellet. Then, Pugilist and the Hot Swap origin perk help boost handling, and One-Two Punch adds a huge damage boost against majors and bosses. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

This was our first legendary Trace Rifle, and the S18 reissued version new lets you build into scorch and ignite. Use the barrel and battery to improve range, stability, reload speed or battery capacity. Subsistence keeps your battery topped up, and then Incandescent makes this a great choice for Solar 3.0 builds. // Judgment PvE first-choice roll
// Fastdraw HCS, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, 
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 25. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Very stiff competition in-slot from Fatebringer, Eyasluna and DFA, but there are a few trait combinations that help claim a spot in your Vault. Look to boost Handling and Stability with sight and mag, to help gunfeel or maybe add a bullet or two. For end-game content, Ensemble helps speed reloads and Timed Payload adds damage, helps with Overload stuns and can proc Explosive Wellmaker. Drops from the first Phalanx Echo encounter if you're looking to farm it. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 25. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Sidearms are a... brave choice of Primary for endgame content. Handling and Stability could both do with some help from sight and mag, or the Combat Effect mags are always useful. This does drop with the combination of Armor-Piercing Rounds and Disruption Break, which makes it a strong choice for Barrier Champions, when the corresponding mod is in play. Drops from the second Hexahedron Room encounter if you're looking to farm it. // Vouchsafe PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Rapid Hit, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content and anti-Champion mods. Still worth looking at, even without an origin perk, for void burn activities. The Recoil Direction needs some love, so Arrowhead Brake is your top choice, and Tactical Mag gives an extra shot, stability and reload speed. For endgame and anti-Champion use particularly Overloads, Rapid Hit and Explosive Payload are your top choices. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod or a Full Auto Retrofit, to save your trigger finger. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Retold Tale PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Slideshot, Field Prep, Lead From Gold, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for general content. Still worth looking at, even without an origin perk, with the update 4.1.5 buff to pellet shotguns. For boss damage, Full Choke keeps pellets together. Assault Mag helps with a follow-up shot if you miss a pellet, or Tactical Mag, Appended or Extended Mag all give the same +1 to mag size. Slideshot gets you reloads on the fly, Field Prep helps with both inventory or reloads, or Lead From Gold saves you running a finder/scavenger perk. Surrounded and the Spec mod gives a 40% CQC damage boost in a crowd. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Surrounded Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-minor, pve-major, controller, mkb

// Sleepless PvE first-choice roll
// Linear Compensator, Black Powder, Auto-Loading Holster, Field Prep, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for endgame content. Middle of the road for raw damage, but the largest blast radius of any subtype. Maximise the blast radius with barrel and mag, and then Field Prep helps with reloads and inventory or Auto-Loading Holster lets you put the launcher away to focus on other enemies. Chain Reaction can help clear beefier adds in a crowd with minors. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-minor, pve-major, controller, mkb

// Nation of Beasts PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Outlaw, Ambitious Assassin, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for endgame content. Round out the stats with barrel and mag. Both Ambitious Assassin and Outlaw have their place in the first trait column, and then Explosive Rounds adds damage and flinch, and helps with anti-Champion mods. // Tyranny of Heaven PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Compact Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for endgame content. Although suffering by comparison with the Precision bow subtype, if you've got a good roll, it's maybe worth hanging onto in case they ever get a bit of love. Your aim is to maximise damage output by getting as many arrows into opponents as possible, so get the Reload and Draw Speed down as far as possible with your bowstring and arrow. Archer's Tempo helps further speed up your RPM and Explosive Head boosts damage, adds flinch and helps with anti-champion mods. Recommended MW: Reload or Draw Time, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-endgame, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-champion, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2721249463&perks=2801223209,16392701,201365942,3365897133

// Apex Predator PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Linear Compensator, Smart Drift Control, Impact Casing, Ambitious Assassin, Kill CLip
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for endgame content. The highest damage subtype. Improve the Velocity with the barrel, and damage with Impact Casing. Then, if you can get a kill before you need burst damage against a major or champion, you can reload for two shots with +33% damage with the Ambitious Assassin and Kill Clip combination. Recommended MW: Reload, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-endgame, pve-god, pve-major, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Marcato-45 PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Extended Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Alloy Mag, Threat Detector, Triple Tap, Demolitionist, Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content. Marcato-45 stars off with decent stats in comparison to its peers - although it has a small magazine, it compensates by having fairly hefty reserves. You'll need to keep the reticule on target, so choose a barrel perk that improves recoil direction or stability. Reload speed and mag size will also be important, so this is what to look for with the magazine perk choice. In the first trait column, Threat Detector, Triple Tap and Demolitionist are all good for either speeding up reloads or extending your magazine, while Onslaught will mow through minor adds, and be good for occasional burst damage against majors too. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Marcato-45 PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Extended Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Alloy Mag, Slice, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Strand subclass. Marcato-45 stars off with decent stats in comparison to its peers - although it has a small magazine, it compensates by having fairly hefty reserves. You'll need to keep the reticule on target, so choose a barrel perk that improves recoil direction or stability. Reload speed and mag size will also be important, so this is what to look for with the magazine perk choice. Combine Slice, in the first trait column, to reduce damage output by 40% from bulkier adds with Hatchling for additional crowd control, and throw in supportive fragments to augment both, and this could be a fun add-suppressing and add-clearing roll. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

@title:Season 23 Playlist weapons
@description:Season of the Wish drops from Vanguard, Crucible and Gambit activities 

// Undercurrent PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Hard Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Velocity Rounds, Ambitious Assassin, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with an arc subclass. Undercurrent is a decent choice for an arc wave-frame grenade launcher if you don't have access to a Forbearance or maybe even in addition to. The stats are worse - but it's not an end-game weapon so that's to be expected. Blast Radius has no meaningful effect, so maximise velocity, and try to help handling with the barrel perk. High-Velocity Rounds as the mag perk also usefully helps reload speed a bit too. For the first trait perk, Ambitious Assassin sets you up with two in the chamber physics be damned after a kill. With Voltshot as the second trait perk, you can alternate between an add-clearing shot to proc it, and then applying Jolt for crowd control or DoT against a beefier target. It requires the kill to set up, but Voltshot has a wider range of effect than Chain Reaction, so is probably worth a try, especially if you're running an arc subclass and add Sparks of Beacons, Ions and Discharge into the mix. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=3798852852,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=981914802,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=1441682018,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394

// Undercurrent Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Hard Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Velocity Rounds, Ambitious Assassin, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with an arc subclass. Undercurrent is a decent choice for an arc wave-frame grenade launcher if you don't have access to a Forbearance or maybe even in addition to. The stats are worse - but it's not a Raid or Trials weapon so that's to be expected. Blast Radius has no meaningful effect, so maximise velocity, and try to help handling with the barrel perk. High-Velocity Rounds as the mag perk also usefully helps reload speed a bit too. For the first trait perk, Ambitious Assassin sets you up with two in the chamber physics be damned after a kill. With Voltshot as the second trait perk, you can alternate between an add-clearing shot to proc it, and then applying Jolt for crowd control or DoT against a beefier target. It requires the kill to set up, but Voltshot has a wider range of effect than Chain Reaction, so is probably worth a try, especially if you're running an arc subclass and add Sparks of Beacons, Ions and Discharge into the mix. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage boosting Minor, Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=3798852852,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=981914802,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=1441682018,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394

// Double-Edged Answer PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Whirlwind Blade, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss spec enemies in end-game content. Double-Edged Answer has awful base stats and a huge perk pool so, if you are looking for a roll, reset your Vanguard reputation a few times first. This shouldn't be your chase weapon but, if you need a waepon for boss damage, then Jagged Edge provides the most damage as a Blade perk, but decimates your ammo, so Honed Edge and Tempered Edge might be attractive alternatives, and Swordmaster's Guard provides a little bit of everything as the guard perk. For reliable boss damage, if you haven't got anything better, Relentless Strikes in the first trait column as the support perk refunds ammo after three hits, while either Whirlwind Blade provides an escalating 3% damage per hit topping off at +30% or, if you know there are other minor adds about, Surrounded boosts damage by a hefty 40%. Nadir Focus could be an interesting mini-Eager Edge - each light attack increases lunge distance, if you want some fun. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=2827049491,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=2827049491,269888150,1749209109,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3708227201

// Double-Edged Answer PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Honed Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes, Unrelenting, Surrounded, One For All
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content. Double-Edged Answer has awful base stats and a huge perk pool so, if you are looking for a roll, reset your Vanguard reputation a few times first. This shouldn't be your chase weapon but, if you don't have a sword that's rolled for add clear, increase the ammo you're carrying even at the cost of impact - Minor adds will die anyway with your blade perk. Swordmaster's Guard provides an all-round boost to stats in the guard slot. For your support perk in the first trait slot, you could boost ammo reserves with Tireless Blade or Relentless Strikes, or regenerate health with Unrelenting. For your signature perk in the second trait slot. Surrounded or One For All both boost damage, in case you come up against something a bit bulkier. Nadir Focus could be an interesting mini-Eager Edge - each light attack increases lunge distance, if you want some fun, or just take the little bits of health from Vanuard's Vindication. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Double-Edged Answer PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Honed Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a void subclass. Double-Edged Answer has awful base stats and a huge perk pool so, if you are looking for a roll, reset your Vanguard reputation a few times first. This shouldn't be your chase weapon but, if you don't have a sword that's rolled for add clear, increase the ammo you're carrying even at the cost of impact - Minor adds will die anyway with your blade perk. Swordmaster's Guard provides an all-round boost to stats in the guard slot. For your support perk in the first trait slot, Repulsor Brace will provide a very handy void overshield when procced, while in the second, you can either take advantage of void abilities and use Surrounded in CQC or Destabilizing Rounds to apply a cloud of volatility. Either way, subclass fragments like Echo of Persistence, can build into subclass verbs. Nadir Focus could be an interesting mini-Eager Edge - each light attack increases lunge distance, if you want some fun, or just take the little bits of health from Vanuard's Vindication. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Retrofuturist PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Unrelenting, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing beefier Minor spec enemies in general content. Unfortunately, Retrofuturist is distinctly meh, so it's only worth hanging onto a roll if it fills a hole in your vault, and even then you'll have to reset your Crucible rank a few times to stand a decent chance of the roll you're after. As a Lightweight shotgun, you do get the +20 mobility and +6.25% movement speed and, for some reason, it has a base mags size of 7, but that's where the praise ends. If you're hanging onto one, try a barrel perk that adds Handling, although a bit of range and stability doesn't hurt either. Assault Mag and Tactical Mag are the best mag perk choices, but Appended Mag or Light Mag aren't bad. If you're planning to wade into groups of adds, them the trait combination of Unrelenting and Frenzy should keep you alive and killing for as long as you have ammo. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Incisor PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Subsistence, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing beefier Minor spec enemies in general content. Incisor may be the chase playlist activity weapon for S23, being the first legendary strand trace rifle - possibly worth the pain of Trials for! Excellent stats plus the Alacrity origin trait for solo play start us off. Recoil Direction is 94, so you don't need to worry too much. Handling and stability are both useful in a barrel perk. For the battery perk, we want as many charges as we can, so watch for Ionized or Enhanced Battery. For an add clearing weapon, pair Subsistence in the first trait column as the support perk and Killing Tally ini the second as the signature perk. You'll get an untimed +30% damage bonus after three kills, with those kills partially refilling the magazine. This works well for a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to drop heavy ammo for a fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Incisor PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Envious Assassin, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing beefier Minor spec enemies in general content. Incisor may be the chase playlist activity weapon for S23, being the first legendary strand trace rifle - possibly worth the pain of Trials for! Excellent stats plus the Alacrity origin trait for solo play start us off. Recoil Direction is 94, so you don't need to worry too much. Handling and stability are both useful in a barrel perk. For the battery perk, we want as many charges as we can, so watch for Ionized or Enhanced Battery. For a backup weapon to use against bosses, Envious Assassin can load a ridiculous 260 charges in your battery after 15 kills with other weapons, which means you can reach the upper +40% stack of Target Lock's damage boost with sustained fire against a target. This works well for a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to drop heavy ammo for a fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Incisor PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Slice, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Incisor may be the chase playlist activity weapon for S23, being the first legendary strand trace rifle - possibly worth the pain of Trials for! Excellent stats plus the Alacrity origin trait for solo play start us off. Recoil Direction is 94, so you don't need to worry too much. Handling and stability are both useful in a barrel perk. For the battery perk, we want as many charges as we can, so watch for Ionized or Enhanced Battery. For a weapon to use as part of a Bait and Switch rotation against a boss, Slide as the first trait column support perk reduces the target's damage output by 40% when procced by a class ability, while Target Lock provides a progressive damage boost for when you run out of heavy ammo. This works well for a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to drop heavy ammo for a fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Lethal Abundance PvE first-choice roll

First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for Strand subclasses. Lethal Abundance has decent stats, but as a High-Impact frame auto rifle this isn't going to be on too many people's wish list. as a subfamily, they generally have poor handling and reload speed, so that's what to boost in the barrel and mag perk slots. For Strand synergy, Slice and Hatchling in the two trait columns give you the two perks to work with using your aspects and fragments. Slice also makes this a good swap weapon in a Bait and Switch rotation, applying 40% reduction in damage output from affected targets when procced after using your class ability. // Lethal Abundance PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Alloy Mag, Slice, Enlightened Action, Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in general content, particularly for Strand subclasses. Lethal Abundance has decent stats, but as a High-Impact frame auto rifle this isn't going to be on too many people's wish list. as a subfamily, they generally have poor handling and reload speed, so that's what to boost in the barrel and mag perk slots. In the first trait column, Slice is useful when facing tankier enemies, applying 40% reduction in damage output from affected targets when procced after using your class ability, which also makes this a good swap weapon in a Bait and Switch rotation. Alternatively, Enlightened Action boosts both handling and reload speed just for hitting a target. Pairing that with Onslaught in the second trait column should help mow through groups of minor spec adds. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Breakneck PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Subsistence, Enlightened Action, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content. Breakneck is back, and has very solid stats, although it looks like we're never going to see the OG and OP Rampage/ Onslaught version again, As a precision frame AR, you don't need to worry about recoil direction, so if you're considering an alternative roll bumps to any combination of the stats should feel good in choosing barrel perk options. Any of the combat effect magazines add utility and then, in the first trait column, you can choose between Subsistence to keep your magazine topped off and Enlightened Action for better handling and reload speed. In the second column, Kinetic Tremors helps with crowd control around a target. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Range, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

@title:Season 23 Seasonal weapons
@description:Season of the Wish seasonal weapons, with the Dragon's Vengeance origin trait 

// Appetence PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Overflow, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. Appetence which means "a natural craving, desire or affinity", seeing as you're asking is the first legendary Stasis trace rifle. It has decent stats, and some interesting trait combinations. Take your pick of handling and/or stability and maybe a touch of recoil direction, if you need it to be a perfect 100, for the barrel perk. With an eye on Overflow as the support perk in the first trait column, Ionized Battery maximises the battery size. Enhanced Overflow gives you 229 in the battery, and 476 total ammo so 247 in reserve with no Reserve mods, up to 606 with three. Killing Tally is the best of the damage perks here, providing a 30% non-timed damage boost as long as you don't swap weapons. With Overflow topping up the battery, for just picking up an ammo brick, this could mean a pretty-much permanent bonus damage. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=1840239774,1483536627,3643424744,557221067
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=1392496348,1483536627,3643424744,557221067
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=3661387068,1483536627,3643424744,557221067
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=839105230,1483536627,3643424744,557221067
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=4090651448,1483536627,3643424744,557221067

// Scatter Signal PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Enhanced Battery, Overflow, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies, or fallback damage against Boss spec in end-game content. Shapeable. Scatter Signal is perhaps one of the best weapons for burst damage as at v7.3.0.5 - great all-round stats as well as offering excellent trait combinations. Controlling recoil, with nine bolts, is important, as is snappiness - Arrowhead Brake helps tidy up recoil direction, but you might consider Fluted Barrel for the combination of handling and stability instead. Enhanced Battery gives the same number of charges 8 as Ionized so, with one eye on Overflow, maximises the battery size. Enhanced Overflow will take your battery to 18 charges - you'll have one left in reserve. Adding two Reserve mods takes this to three reserve shots, and with Overflow topping up the battery, for just picking up an ammo brick, you might never need to reload. Controlled Burst reduces charge time to 414 and boosts damage by 20% for hitting all your bolts. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=839105230,2680121939,3643424744,2594592626
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=1840239774,2680121939,3643424744,2594592626

// Scatter Signal PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Enhanced Battery, Slice, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for fallback damage against Boss spec in end-game content, particularly with a Strand subclass. Shapeable. Scatter Signal is perhaps one of the best weapons for burst damage as at v7.3.0.5 - great all-round stats as well as offering excellent trait combinations. Controlling recoil, with nine bolts, is important, as is snappiness - Arrowhead Brake helps tidy up recoil direction, but you might consider Fluted Barrel for the combination of handling and stability instead. Enhanced Battery gives the same number of charges 8 as Ionized, without any reload penalty. Slice, as the first trait column perk, when procced after using your class ability reduces outgoing damage from a target by 40% for 8s - increased by 50% with the Thread of Continuity fragment, whether or not they're immune - very useful in boss fights or as part of a Bait and Switch weapon rotation. Controlled Burst as the second trait perk reduces charge time to 414 and boosts damage by 20% for hitting all your bolts. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=839105230,2680121939,923806249,2594592626
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=1840239774,2680121939,923806249,2594592626

// Supercluster PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Slice, Surrounded, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for fallback damage against Boss spec in end-game content, particularly with a Strand subclass. Shapeable. Supercluster is the first Strand pinpoint slug shotgun, and the good news is it has very competitive stats. The bad news is that they're not as great as they were a few years ago for boss DPS. Use the barrel perk to boost range and the mag perk to improve its utility - your preference between Assault Mag or Tactical Mag, or Appended Mag. Slice, as the first trait column perk, when procced after using your class ability reduces outgoing damage from a target by 40%, whether or not they're immune - very useful in boss fights or as part of a Bait and Switch weapon rotation. For a damage boosting perk in the second trait slot, choose between Surrounded, if you're likely to be in CQC with extra adds, or Vorpal Weapon for a reliable 15% boost to damage against Majors and Bosses. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting Boiss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Lethophobia PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Flexible String, Polymer String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Successful Warm-Up, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for Minor spec add clearing in general content. Shapeable. Lethophobia or "fear of forgetting", seeing as you're asking offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed as the Lightweight Frame bonus but, honestly the stats are poor and it's difficult to recommend for PvE. If you do want to try it out, the tactic with Bowstrong and Arrow perks is to reduce the draw time and improve accuracy. As the support perk in the first trait column, Successful Warm up improves draw time further, although you don't have to get a kill first, Explosive Head in the second as the signature perk is the reliable boost to damage and flinch that it always is. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

First-choice PvE pick for bulkier Minor spec add clearing in general content, particularly with an arc subclass. Shapeable. Scalar Potential has decent stats and a nice clean scope, but you're limited by a PvP trait perk pool. Arrowhead Brake is probably the best barrel perk, although you could imrpve handling or range if you can handle the recoil direction. // Doomed Petitioner PvE first-choice roll
// Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Ionized Battery, Envious Assassin, Precision Instrument, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss spec damage in end-game content. Shapeable. Although Doomed Petitioner's stats are on the low side, if you don't already have a LFR for sustained boss damage, this will do nicely. A touch of stability and recoil direction from Chambered Compensator or Arrowhead Brake, and a maximised battery size of 6 with Ionized Battery sets you up nicely for Envious Assassin in the first trait column. Enhanced Envious Assassin will load 18 shots into the battery, leaving you 1 in reserve 2 with one Reserve mod, or 4 with two or three mods. You can choose between Enhanced Precision Instrument for 30% bonus damage after 6 crit hits or Enhanced Surrounded useful against Ir Yut for +47% damage when you're in a crowd. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Boiss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// taken from https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep91-pt2-dreaming-city-weapons.txt

@title:Season 23 Dreaming City weapons
@description:Reprised weapons, with the Advanced Reflexes origin trait

// Tigerspite PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Subsistence, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Tigerspite has fairly middle-of-the-road stats and a more PvP-oriented trait pool but, if you like the subtype then there are a few interesting rolls. As with all precision weapon subtypes, you can start by not worrying too much about recoil direction, so you might as well push out the range with your barrel perk option. Any of the combat effect rounds in the mag perk slot Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber or Ricochet Rounds will add a tiny bit more range and utility in a firefight. In the first trait slot as the support perk, Subsistence really is the best maybe only trait that works for PvE while Frenzy is easy to proc and adds +15% damage, and 100 Handling and Reload, once it's procced. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Waking Vigil PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Subsistence, Kinetic Tremors, Attrition Orbs, Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with an arc subclass. As a former Lightweight HC that's been crowbarred into the Adaptive subfamily, the stats look very weird, with low range and stability but high handling and reload speed. If you haven't already got a decent arc hand cannon, then you could push out the range a bit, even at the cost of a little Handling, and add a little Stability. Any of the combat effect rounds in the mag perk slot Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber or Ricochet Rounds will add a tiny bit more range and utility in a firefight. Rapid Hit is the best support perk choice in the first column traits, although Perpetual Motion isn't bad either. Although you don't need Ionic Traces specifically to use Collective Action as the signature perk in the second trait column, they have the advantage over other elemental pickups in end-game content of tracking to you automatically, rather than having to go out to collect them, for a solid +20% damage boost for 7s. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3723679465&perks=1482024992,1968497646,247725512,3324494224
dimwishlist:item=3723679465&perks=3250034553,1968497646,247725512,3324494224

// Vouchsafe PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Appeneded Mag, Rapid Hit Fourth Time's the Charm, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, with a void subclass. The reprised Vouchsafe has returned with a plethora of PvE possibilities. You get the +20 Mobility from the Lightweight Frame, which is always great but on the downside you also have low Stability and Handling not such a problem with the origin trait and abysmal Recoil Direction. You can handle the wonky recoil with a combination of recoil and/or stability perks in the barrel and mag slots. Then, either Rapid Hit or Fourth Time's The Charm in the first, support, trait slot work well with Golden Tricorn in the second - you should be able to proc the second tier +50% damage with a void grenade to help deal with chunkier minor adds and the occasional major. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Vouchsafe PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Appeneded Mag, Rapid Hit, Explosive Payload, Dragonfly, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a void subclass. The reprised Vouchsafe has returned with a plethora of PvE possibilities. You get the +20 Mobility from the Lightweight Frame, which is always great but on the downside you also have low Stability and Handling not such a problem with the origin trait and abysmal Recoil Direction. You can handle the wonky recoil with a combination of recoil and/or stability perks in the barrel and mag slots. Slot in Rapid Hit for the first trait column's support perk and then in the second you can improve on the curated roll's Explosive Payload, add a little crowd clearance with Dragonfly, or use elemental pickups to proc Collective Action although you might need to travel a fair way to collect them if you're engaging at typical scout rifle distances. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Retold Tale PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Light Mag, Appended Mag, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a void subclass. Retold Tale has okay stats compared to other precision frame shotguns and the trait pool is weighted towards PvP, but there's still some nice combinations here. First, for the barrel perk, Barrel Shroud, Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling all add useful stats and for the mag slot while Assault Mag or Tactical Mag are the top two choices, Light Mag or Appended Mag aren't bad alternatives. For your trait combination, this is the first pellet shotgun that offers the the trait combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds for aggressive CQC add clearing. You don't need a void subclass to make use of them - they'll work perfectly well without - but you can improve the effect with void fragments. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling or +20 charge rate with swords, for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Twilight Oath PvE first-choice roll
// Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Envious Assassin, Precision Instrument, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage to Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Twilight Oath starts in last place for stats amongst its peers, but it has one trick up its sleeve to make it useful for boss damage, if you don't already have a well-rolled special weapon for when you run out of heavy ammo. You'll need to start out by taming the wonky recoil with a Recoil Direction or Stability barrel perk. Tactical Mag, Appended Mag and Extended Mag all get you to the maximum of 7 shots - Tactical Mag adds some useful additional Stability too. You can use this with the trait combination of Envious Assassin, which can get 18 shots after 14 primary/heavy kills and up to 21 if you reproc, together with Precision Instrument, which provides a scaling damage bonus of up to +25% damage on the sixth and every subsequent crit hit. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Abide the Return PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Balanced Guard, Relentless Strikes, Whirlwind Blade
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage to Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you already have a solar boss damage sword, you can pass. If you want to use Abide the Return, then get a blade perk that increases damage and, for a guard perk, Swordmaster's Guard speeds up your heavy attack regeneration or Balanced Guard gives you a little bit of everything to help survive in CQC with a boss. The usual trait combination of Relentless Strikes, returning one ammo for everyth three light hits, and Whirlwind Blade for an escalating +3% bump to damage topping off at +30% for landing light hits makes for a decent, if not top-tier option for boss DPS phases. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +20 charge rate for faster heavy attacks, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Abide the Return PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Balanced Guard, Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a solar subclass. If you already have a solar boss damage sword, you can pass. If you don't, then maybe consider trying to craft a Caretaker from Dares of Eternity before settling. If you want to use Abide the Return, then get a blade perk that increases ammo and reserves adds will die to a single hit anyway and, for a guard perk, Swordmaster's Guard speeds up your heavy attack regeneration or Balanced Guard gives you a little bit of everything to help survive in CQC. The usual trait combination of Tireless Blade or Relentless Strikes to extend your ammo and Incandescent to help with add clear, should make room clearing easy. You don't need to use a solar subclass but you can improve scorch and ignite verbs further with your fragments. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +20 charge rate for faster heavy attacks, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Sleepless PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, Alloy Casing, Field Prep, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. Like other High-Impact Rocket Launchers with their high blast radius, Sleepless really only has one role, and that's add clearing - maybe for Gunsmith bounties. If you're going that way, you could maximise the Blast Radius with Volatile Launch as the barrel perk, and then boost Velocity with High-Velocity Rounds or reload Speed with Alloy Casing in the mag. You might as well have as many rockets to shoots as you can, so Field Prep boosts your reserves by one and reload speed further, as the first trait perk to support Chain Reaction in the second to really make sure that everything in the blast radius is dead. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Velocity or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2140635451&perks=1478423395,2822142346,2869569095,2396489472
dimwishlist:item=2140635451&perks=1478423395,2985827016,2869569095,2396489472

// Sleepless PvE first-choice roll
// Linear Compensator, Black Poweder, Field Prep, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. Like other High-Impact Rocket Launchers with their high blast radius, Sleepless really only has one role, and that's add clearing - maybe for Gunsmith bounties. You might be better off waiting until you can craft a Semiotician with enchanced versions of the traits, but if you can't wait, you could boost Blast Radius and Velocity with Linear Compensator as the barrel perk, and then boost Blast Radius with Black Powder in the mag. You might as well have as many rockets to shoots as you can, so Field Prep boosts your reserves by one and reload speed further, as the first trait perk to support Chain Reaction in the second to really make sure that everything in the blast radius is dead. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Velocity or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2140635451&perks=1441682018,1996142143,2869569095,2396489472

// Sleepless PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, Field Prep, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. Like other High-Impact Rocket Launchers with their high blast radius, Sleepless really only has one role, and that's add clearing - maybe for Gunsmith bounties. You might be better off waiting until you can craft a Semiotician with enchanced versions of the traits, but if you can't wait, and you're lucky enough to get a Blast Radius masterwork, you can boost velocity and reload speed with Quick Launch in the barrel and High-Velocity Rounds in the mag. You might as well have as many rockets to shoots as you can, so Field Prep boosts your reserves by one and reload speed further, as the first trait perk to support Chain Reaction in the second to really make sure that everything in the blast radius is dead. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2140635451&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2869569095,2396489472

// Sleepless PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, Field Prep, Bipod
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. Like other High-Impact Rocket Launchers with their high blast radius, Sleepless really only has one role, and that's add clearing - maybe for Gunsmith bounties. You might be better off waiting until you can craft a Semiotician with enchanced versions of the traits, but if you can't wait, maximise the Blast Radius with Volatile Launch and Black Powder in the barrel and mag, and a Blast Radius Masterwork to start with. You might as well have as many rockets to shoot as you can, so Field Prep boosts your reserves and helps with reload speed, as the first trait perk to support Bipod - with all of this you'll have 15 rockets loading two at a time that still have 90 Blast Radius and a decent reload speed when crouched. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

@title:Season 23 Dawning weapons
@description:New weapons and reprised, with the Dawning Surprise origin trait

// Cold Front PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Stats For All, One For All
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Like most world-drop weapons, Cold Front has pretty poor stats - including a stability of just 7, although excluding Immortal, which is a stat monster, they're average for the frame subtype. Use the barrel and mag perks to help out with this and then the SOFA Stats/ One For All combination of trait perks to round out the stats further and add a chunky 35% bonus damage. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10sand grants energy 10% to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Cold Front PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Perprtual Motion, Unrelenting, Frenzy
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Like most world-drop weapons, Cold Front has pretty poor stats - including a stability of just 7, although excluding Immortal, which is a stat monster, they're average for the frame subtype. Use the barrel and mag perks to help out with this. As the first trait column support perk, Perpetual Motion adds further stat bonuses just for moving, or Unrelenting's bonus health is useful in CQC, while in the second column as the signature perk, Frenzy boosts the handling and reload speed up to 100 and adds 15% bonus damage when procced. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants energy 10% to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Avalanche PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Target Lock
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss Damage in end-game content. The stats are okay overall - there are a could of surprises with 90 Aim Assist and 19 Zoom, which are a lot higher than its peers - but unfortunately Avalanche has the lowest ammo reserves of any adaptive which limits its usefulness. If you already have a decent solar LMG, then you can pass. If you don't, Arrowhead Brake cleans up the recoil direction to 100, or Smallbore or Fluted Barrel boost useful stats as the barrel perk. Then, Extended Mag or Appended Mag both work as mag perks giving you more continuous shots on a single target. In the first trait column, as the support perk, the rounds that Rewind Rounds refills will count towards proccing the highest tiers of Target Lock as the second trait perk for sustained damage against a single target. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Avalanche PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Subsistence, Incandescent
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for chunkier add-clearing against Minor Spec Enemies in general content with a solar subclass. The stats are okay overall - there are a could of surprises with 90 Aim Assist and 19 Zoom, which are a lot higher than its peers - but unfortunately Avalanche has the lowest ammo reserves of any adaptive which limits its usefulness. If you already have a decent solar LMG, then you can pass. If you don't, Arrowhead Brake cleans up the recoil direction to 100, or Smallbore or Fluted Barrel boost useful stats as the barrel perk. Then, Appended Mag, Extended Mag or Flared Magwell both work as mag perks giving you more continuous shots on a single target. To use as a heavy scort rifle for add-clearing, In the first trait column, as the support perk, the rounds that Rewind Rounds or Subsistence refills save time on reloads, while Incandescent helps you tie into solar subclass fragments to assist with add-clearing. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

First-choice PvE pick for chunkier add-clearing against Minor Spec Enemies in general content. The stats are okay overall - there are a could of surprises with 90 Aim Assist and 19 Zoom, which are a lot higher than its peers - but unfortunately Avalanche has the lowest ammo reserves of any adaptive which limits its usefulness. // Vengeful Whisper PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Slice, Collective Action
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Strand Synergy in end-game content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Vengeful Whisper is no exception - even going as far as an extra point of zoom over other precision bows. This also has traits appearing in non-standard columns to make for some unique rolls. As with every bow, the aim is to reduce draw time first, and improve accuracy second - Elastic String does the first job and Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching does the second. The combination of Slice in the first trait column and Collective Action in the second makes this a bit of a Swiss-army knife of weapons. Slice, with Strand of Continuity, Severs an enemy to reduce their damage output by 40% for 15s - you can use this effect on Majors and Bosses, even during an immunity phase to grant an effective 40% damage reduction for your whole fireteam. Or, apply Sever to a minor and kill it to spawn a Tangle that you can use with Collective Action for a 20% damage boost for 7s, then rinse and repeat. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=839344841&perks=2801223209,3827198035,923806249,3324494224
dimwishlist:item=839344841&perks=2801223209,3429800428,923806249,3324494224

// Naeem's Lance PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Reconstruction, Precision Instrument
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Naeem's Lance is no exception - having pretty good overall stats. It's the first Rapid-fire Sniper so, as is common for most snipers, Handling is a crucial stat but, as this is a rapid-fire frame, you'll also need to tidy up the recoil direction, so Arrowhead Brake is the barrel perk choice. As the mag perk, Tactical Mag is the best option, as it boosts stability a bit too, and gives the same rounds in the mag as Appended and Extended Mag. For the first trait, Reconstruction doubles your mag size passively while, if you don't have a good backup sniper for boss damage when you run out of heavy ammo, Precision Instrument boosts your damage output by 25% after six shots, for the rest of the 14-round magazine. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2806569825&perks=839105230,106909392,1523832109,555281244
dimwishlist:item=2806569825&perks=839105230,1087426260,1523832109,555281244
dimwishlist:item=2806569825&perks=839105230,2420895100,1523832109,555281244

// Horror Story PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Accurized Rounds, Demolitionist, Enlightened Action, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Stasis synergy and add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Horror Story has returned and become a stasis precision auto-rifle - the first of its subtype. The stats are unexceptional, as you might expect from an event weapon but there are some trait combinations to save it. Recoil direction doesn't really matter on a precision-frame weapon, and stability is less important with a more reliable recoil direction, so you can choose your pick of Handling, Range and Reload Speed from your barrel and mag perks. Enlightened Action will get you pretty close to maxed out Handling and Reload at 5 stacks, or Demolitionist is difficult to turn down when it shows up in the first trait column as the support perk. In the second as the signature perk, you should be able to proc Collective Action's 20% damage bonus from generating Stasis shards with Hunters and Titans Warlocks may have to work harder, or any other elemental pickup. Both origin traits are more PvP-orientated, but Nadir Focus's extra range and accuracy for free is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Horror Story PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Accurized Rounds, Demolitionist, Enlightened Action, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Horror Story has returned and become a stasis precision auto-rifle - the first of its subtype. The stats are unexceptional, as you might expect from an event weapon but there are some trait combinations to save it. Recoil direction doesn't really matter on a precision-frame weapon, and stability is less important with a more reliable recoil direction, so you can choose your pick of Handling, Range and Reload Speed from your barrel and mag perks. In the second trait slot as the signature perk, you won't ever get to the higher damage tiers of Target Lock, even with the instant reload from throwing a grenade with Demolitionist in the first column support perk slot, but it's still a combination of a decent boost for sustained damage and grenade energy. Or just be happy with the a reliably fast reload and great handling with Enlightened Action at 5 stacks. Both origin traits are more PvP-orientated, but Nadir Focus's extra range and accuracy for free is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Horror Story PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Accurized Rounds, Demolitionist, Frenzy, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Horror Story has returned and become a stasis precision auto-rifle - the first of its subtype. The stats are unexceptional, as you might expect from an event weapon but there are some trait combinations to save it. Recoil direction doesn't really matter on a precision-frame weapon, and stability is less important with a more reliable recoil direction, so you can choose your pick of Handling, Range and Reload Speed from your barrel and mag perks. In the first trait slot as the support perk, it's difficult to look past Demolitionist. To pair with it as the second column signature perk, Frenzy provides +15% damage and maxes out handling and reload speed, or Adrenaline Junkie is a natural pairing - a grenade kill will boost damage by 33%, and the kills you get with refresh your grenade energy. Both origin traits are more PvP-orientated, but Nadir Focus's extra range and accuracy for free is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Jurassic Green PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Accurized Rounds, Heal Clip, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for solar synergy and Minor Spec add-clearing in end-game content. Jurassic Green is a solar rapid-fire pulse, with the intrinsic 20% faster reload when its magazine is empty. It's got a similar stat range to its other world-drop peers, but comes a poor second to end-game drops in the energy slot. The recoil direction is a frankly awful 50 at base. The best even Arrowhead Brake can do is bring it up to a not entirely awful 80. Looking at the traits for this roll, the best option is to just increase the range with Accurized Rounds. The new to season 22 Heal Clip in the first trait column as the support perk will apply one stack of Cure to you and anyone else near on reloading after a kill, while Frenzy in the second column as the signature perk boosts handling and reload speed to 100, and adds 15% damage when procced. The Field Tested origin trait will just work steadily in the background to gradually improve your gunfeel, as long as you don't die! Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3103255595&perks=839105230,3142289711,3017780555,4104185692

// Acosmic PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Confined Launch, High-Explosive Ordnance, Loose Change, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add-clearing in end-game content. Grenade launchers may not be anyone's first choice for add clearing, but Acosmic named after one of the two Hindu aspects of god; to be acosmic is to deny the objective reality of the temporal world - transcendental in a world-negating sense, according to Merriam-Webster is a void rapid-fire frame GL, with the intrinsic 20% faster reload when its magazine is empty, and is a viable option.. Get your blast radius as high as possible with your barrel and mag perks, so you can catch as many adds as possible with your shots. In the first trait column as the support perk, new to season 22 Loose Change boosts reload speed by 50 when you apply an elemental debuff, which is just what Destabilizing Rounds in the second column as the signature perk does. You should be able to clear crowded rooms fast and soften up beefier enemies. The Nadir Focus origin trait boosts your shot velocity further, which is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a Backup Mag or damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=413901114&perks=1478423395,1380253176,1119449540,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=413901114&perks=1844523823,1380253176,1119449540,2048641572

// originally found at https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep79-crota's-end-weapons.txt

@title:Crota's End weapons
@description:Reprised weapons from the Crota's End Raid, with the Cursed Thrall origin trait

// Fang of Ir Yût PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Shoot to Loot, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. This is the first rapid-fire Strand scout rifle so you get an Alloy Mag-like 20% quicker reload animation when the magazine is empty, with best-in-class stats compared to other RFs in the kinetic slot. The recoil direction is a bit shonky, so Arrowhead Brake cleans that up a bit, but if you feel able to control it, Fluted Barrel adds to handling for general snappiness. You can choose from any of the combat effect rounds as the mag perk, depending on your preference, or Flared Magwell for better reload speed. For end-game use, Shoot to Loot as the first trait column support perk lets you gather ammo and orbs of power from a distance and Golden Tricorn can boost damage by 50% when the second stack kicks in - even if Strand is more difficult to proc, especially at the distance you'll be engaging at with a scout rifle. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Rapid Hit, Rewind Rounds, Hatchling
