// Rapacious Appetite PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Perpetual Motion, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Stasis Synergy minor add clear in endgame activities. Shapeable. Rapacious Appetite is one of only two Stasis aggressive SMGs as at S21, so there's not much to compare the stats against. But even so, the stability of 6 might make you pause. On the plus side, the range is the highest in the subfamily. You'll need stability on a controller, so start with a stability barrel and a Stability masterwork. In the mag, Flared Magwell or the Combat Effect perks all provide utility. The easiest way to add the gunfeel stats you need in an end-game roll is through Perpetual Motion in the first trait column as your support perk and then, to synergise with Stasis subclasses, Headstone in the second column as the signature perk, of you don't already have a Headstone Blood Feud SMG, provides a Stasis crystal on crit kills to use with Aspects and Fragments. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Different Times PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Stats For All, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Shapeable. Different Times is the first Strand pulse rifle but has poor base stats when compared with other kinetic slot options. The Recoil Direction is awful, so Arrowhead Brake is pretty much a must have in the barrel. Flared Magwell fills in some gunfeel stats, or the Combat Effect magazine perks are all viable. In the first trait column for the support perk, Stats For All makes the gun feel very usable and, as this is the first primary weapon able to roll Collective Action, in the second column as the signature perk, that's probably the roll to go for for end-game content, proccing 20% bonus damage for any elemental pickup. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Targeted Redaction PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Triple Tap, Explosive Payload, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in end-game content. Shapeable. Unfortunately, Targeted Redaction looks great, but has poor stats by comparison with other void adaptive hand cannons. If you already have a decent Bottom Dollar roll, you can probably give this a pass. If you don't, then fill in the stat gaps as best you can - Fluted Barrel or Smallbore, and Tactical Mag all bump useful gunfeel stats and increase the mag size to 9. For end-game use, Triple Tap as the first trait column support park and Explosive Payload or Frenzy as the second column signature perk are tried-and-true combinations to passively extend your magazine and boost damage. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3890055324&perks=1840239774,106909392,3400784728,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=3890055324&perks=1482024992,106909392,3400784728,3038247973

// Thin Precipice PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Unrelenting, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. Thin Precipice is the first Strand sword, and is the fan-favourite vortex spin-to-win frame to boot. As with all swords, Jagged Edge is the usual choice for the blade for its increased damage. and Swordmaster's Guard bumps charge time for heavy spin attacks. There aren't many swords that can roll both Unrelenting in the first trait column as the support perk, and Chain Reaction in the second column as the signature perk - the combination should mean you can safely wade into crowds of adds, and enjoy the explosions around you that proc your health regeneration. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=4066778670&perks=3666208348,269888150,3108830275,2396489472

// Thin Precipice PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Heavy Guard, Tireless Blade, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. Thin Precipice is the first Strand sword, and is the fan-favourite vortex spin-to-win frame to boot. As with all swords, Jagged Edge is the usual choice for the blade for its increased damage. To pair with your traits, you'll want to go with heavy guard, mainly to slow your charge time. The play here is to use unpowered heavy attacks, which do a bit less damage but only cost 1 ammo, to proc Tireless Blade in the first trait column as the support perk and refund ammo for every other kill - if you're lucky you can return more ammo than you use. In the second column as the signature perk, Golden Tricorn's first stack will easily make up the reduced damage after the first kill, or Chain Reaction's AoE damage should mean you can wade into crowds of adds, while never running out of ammo. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=4066778670&perks=3666208348,2349202967,2590710093,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=4066778670&perks=3666208348,2349202967,2590710093,2396489472

// Jagged Edge, Heavy Guard, Tireless Blade, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. Thin Precipice is the first Strand sword, and is the fan-favourite vortex spin-to-win frame to boot. As with all swords, Jagged Edge is the usual choice for the blade for its increased damage. To pair with your traits, you'll want to go with heavy guard, mainly to slow your charge time. The play here is to use unpowered heavy attacks, which do a bit less damage but only cost 1 ammo, to proc Tireless Blade in the first trait column as the support perk and refund ammo for every other kill - if you're lucky you can return more ammo than you use. In the second column as the signature perk, you should be regularly proccing Hatchling by rapidly defeating targets, to build into the Strand verbs, while never running out of ammo. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=4066778670&perks=3666208348,2349202967,2590710093,831391274

// Spare Rations PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Rapid Hit, Slideshot, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Spare Rations is in a difficult place stats-wise still having the lower stats of the old 150 Lightweight subfamily even though it's been rolled into the Adaptives. However, it's the first hand cannon that can drop with Kinetic Tremors, so it might be worth keeping around in case a rework makes it a bit easier to proc. Fill in some of the stats with the barrel - Fluted Barrel or Smallbore bump your preference between range, stability and handling. In the mag, Flared Magwell bumps stats up a bit more, or Appended Mag gets you to the maximum of 14 shots. For end-game add clearing Rapid Hit is the best choice for the first trait column support park - stacking buffs to stability and reload speed or, if you can run and slide, Slideshot partially reloads and applies passive range and stability bumps. In the second column as the signature perk, Kinetic Tremors does currently v7.1.0.2, S21 take six hits to proc, but if that's ever given a buff, this could be great for AoE damege for a group of adds while collecting ammo and orbs remotely. Recommended MW: any, based on your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Bug-Out Bag PvE first-choice roll
// Extended Barrel, Chambered Compensator, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Threat Detector, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects.  First-choice PvE pick for Solar synergy and Minor add-clearing in end-game content. If you haven't got an Incandescent Calus Mini-Tool, the Bug-Out Bag could be a very acceptable alternative. Decent stats but, if you get Threat Detector as a perk, you can pretty much ignore stability, handling and reload with your barrel choices, so you might as well control the recoil a little instead - Extended Barrel or Chambered Compensator take the Recoil Direction to a near-perfect 98. Any of the Combat Effect magazine perks adds utility, and a little range on top. In the first trait column as the support perk, Threat Detector at two stacks takes stability to around 80 and maxes out handling and reload speed and Incandescent as the second column signature perk is great for add clearing and builds into your scorch and ignite Solar verbs. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Chattering Bone PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Rapid Hit, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for end-game use in general activities. Shapeable. Not a huge selection of Lightweight Pulse Rifles to compare with, but Chattering Bone is still best-in-class stats across the board, and provides a +20 mobility bonus and 6.25% faster movement speed. Even if it's best in class, the recoil direction still needs attention - Arrowhead Break takes it to a controllable 87, and adds a bump to handling. Either Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell in the magazine add reload speed, stability and, for the former, an extra burst. Pair that with Rapid Hit in the first trait column as the support perk, to make successive bursts easier to land and boost reload speed further. Finally, as the second column signature perk, Kinetic Tremors only needs four bursts to land to proc. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=501329015&perks=839105230,106909392,247725512,3891536761

// Transfiguration PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Rewind Rounds, Rampage, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear use in end-game activities. Shapeable. Transfiguration is the only obtainable high-impact scout rifle available as at S21, plus it has a solid set of stats, although reload is a bit slow. The range is pretty good - Fluted Barrel, Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling all add useful bumps to stats, or if you want to push the range out by a few metres more, Hammer-Forged Rifling can also work in the barrel. Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell are the pick of the magazine perks, adding useful reload speed, a bit of stability and an extra shot for Tac Mag. Explosive Payload in the second trait column as the signature perk is a straight boost to damage, with added flinch, and is great against champions. Working back, you could pair it with either Rewind Rounds, to extend the magazine - particularly useful with champions, or look to increasing your damage output with Rampage - Three stacks equates to an impressive extra 44.5% crit damage. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Transfiguration PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Rewind Rounds, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear use in general activities. Shapeable. Transfiguration is the only obtainable high-impact scout rifle available as at S21, plus it has a solid set of stats, although reload is a bit slow. The range is pretty good - Fluted Barrel, Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling all add useful bumps to stats, or if you want to push the range out by a few metres more, Hammer-Forged Rifling can also work in the barrel. Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell are the pick of the magazine perks, adding useful reload speed, a bit of stability and an extra shot for Tac Mag. Kinetic Tremors in the second trait slot as the signature perk needs six shots to proc with a scout rifle, but pairing that with Rewind Rounds in the first slot as the support perk should mean that you can extend the mag and keep firing. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// The Supremacy PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Fourth Times the Charm
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against bosses in end-game activities. Shapeable. The Supremacy has decent in-band stats by comparison with other kinetic slot rapid-fire snipers. Putting out shots at pace needs some additional control with the barrel perk - you could improve the recoil direction, or you can increase the stability. Appended Mag gets you to the maximum of 7 in the mag without needing to use Extended Mag. The roll that's been dubbed "Whisper Lite" combines Enhanced Rewind Rounds in the first trait column as the support perk refunds 70% of the shots that hit from reserves when the magazine's emptied. Fourth Time's the Charm in the second slot as the signature perk magics two bullets out of thin air after hitting four rapid crits. Between the two, it's been reported that with 3x Reserve mods you can hit 42 crits in a row without reloading - very handy to have in your back pocket against a boss if you run out of power ammo, or if you're running Tractor Cannon and need a damage option. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Age-Old Bond PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Repulsor Brace, Destabilising Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for minor add-clear in end-game activities, particularly for Void synergy. Shapeable. There aren't many high-impact auto rifles in the game, even fewer dropping from activities and Age-Old Bond is the only void example. You have to enjoy slower-firing weapons, but if that's the case this has great stats. Being slower firing, the reticule has more time to return to the centre, so a bit of extra stability and/or recoil direction will make it very easy to control. In the magazine, Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell are both great choices - the difference being whether you prefer a couple of extra bullets or a slightly faster reload. This is one of only two primaries that can roll with Repulsor Brace in the first column, as the support perk, and Destabilising Rounds in the second as the signature perk. In a similar way to Incandescent and Voltshot, this means you can enjoy void verb use whether you're sporting a void subclass or not although if you are, you have access to the full 3.0 kit of fragments you can use. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Age-Old Bond PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Dragonfly, Stats For All, Discord, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for minor add-clear in end-game activities, particularly for Void synergy. Shapeable. There aren't many high-impact auto rifles in the game, even fewer dropping from activities and Age-Old Bond is the only void example. You have to enjoy slower-firing weapons, but if that's the case this has great stats. Being slower firing, the reticule has more time to return to the centre, so a bit of extra stability and/or recoil direction will make it very easy to control. In the magazine, Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell are both great choices - the difference being whether you prefer a couple of extra bullets or a slightly faster reload. In the first trait column, as the support perk, you could choose Dragonfly for AoE damage, Stats For All for hefty gunfeel stat boosts, or Discord if you're weapon swapping a lot and like the idea of easier crits. In the second column as the signature perk, Golden Tricorn is great for a reliable 15% refreshable damage bump up that goes up to a chunky 50% with a void ability kill. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Tyranny of Heaven PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Straight Fletching, Explosive Head, Dragonfly, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for minor add-clear in end-game activities, particularly for solar synergy. Shapeable. Okay, it's a Lightweight bow, which isn't ideal but on the bright side, you do get the +20 mobility and 6.25% movement speed increase, and this is the only solar example available. The stats aren't great either but, as a Raid weapon, this can still roll with some spicy trait combinations. As usual, we'll use the combination of Elastic String in the bowstring slot, and Straight Fletching as the arrow to drop the draw time and recover the lost accuracy it's already a pretty awful 27, so get used to using this closer up than a precision bow. The unique rolls available include Explosive Head for a straight 9.4% damage boost and tiny bit of AoE damage or Dragonfly for a more satisfying crit kill explosion in the first trait slot as the support perk, together with Incandescent as the second slot signature perk for scorch and ignite - even better with solar 3.0 verbs if you're running a matching subclass with access to useful fragments. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Tyranny of Heaven PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Straight Fletching, Archer's Tempo, Golden Tricorn, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for minor add-clear in end-game activities, particularly for solar synergy. Shapeable. Okay, it's a Lightweight bow, which isn't ideal but on the bright side, you do get the +20 mobility and 6.25% movement speed increase, and this is the only solar example available. The stats aren't great either but, as a Raid weapon, this can still roll with some spicy trait combinations. As usual, we'll use the combination of Elastic String in the bowstring slot, and Straight Fletching as the arrow to drop the draw time and recover the lost accuracy it's already a pretty awful 27, so get used to using this closer up than a precision bow. Archer's Tempo is the usual play in the first trait slot as the support perk to drop the draw time to 395ms for 4s after a crit hit. In the second slot, Golden Tricorn for the flat 15% damage boost after a kill, jumping to 50% with a solar ability kill, or Incandescent for scorch and ignite - even better with solar 3.0 verbs if you're running a matching subclass with access to useful fragments. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Elastic String, Straight Fletching, Successful Warm-Up, Golden Tricorn, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. Okay, it's a Lightweight bow, which isn't ideal but on the bright side, you do get the +20 mobility and 6.25% movement speed increase, and this is the only solar example available. The stats aren't great either but, as a Raid weapon, this can still roll with some spicy trait combinations. As usual, we'll use the combination of Elastic String in the bowstring slot, and Straight Fletching as the arrow to drop the draw time and recover the lost accuracy it's already a pretty awful 27, so get used to using this closer up than a precision bow. Successful Warm-Up is a rare addition to the first trait column as a support perk option - proccing it will drop the draw time to 330ms for 6s, up to a maximum of 20s. In the second slot, Golden Tricorn for the flat 15% damage boost after a kill, jumping to 50% with a solar ability kill, or Incandescent for scorch and ignite - even better with solar 3.0 verbs if you're running a matching subclass with access to useful fragments. First-choice PvE pick for minor add-clear in end-game activities. Shapeable. National of Beasts has average stats in comparison to its peers, but a spicy Raid perk pool to play with. Take your pick of a little extra range, stability or recoil speed for the barrel perk. In the magazine, Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell are both great choices - the difference being whether you prefer an bullets or a slightly faster reload. Use Dragonfly in the first trait slot as the support perk, as your starting point for the satisfying crit kill explosions. In the second slot, Explosive Payload is a straight 10% damage boost and adds a little additional AoE damage too - the classic arc Fakebringer roll. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. // Nation of Beasts PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Extended Barrel, Chambered Compensator, Flared Magwell, Perpetual Motion, Eddy Current, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for minor add-clear in end-game activities, particularly for arc synergy. Shapeable. National of Beasts has average stats in comparison to its peers, but a spicy Raid perk pool to play with. Take your pick of a little extra range, stability or recoil speed for the barrel perk. In the magazine, Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell are both great choices - the difference being whether you prefer an bullets or a slightly faster reload. If you want to build into Voltshot as your second trait column signature perk, you'll want your first column support perk to boost reload speed as much as possible. The new Eddy Current sounds like it might do the job, but you'll have to sprinting for 3s after a kill to proc it, which gives you a tiny window to reload of 0.8s or less, so good old Perpetual Motion is probably the more reliable option. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

@title:Season 21 Solstice weapons
@description:Season of the Deep new and reprised Solstice weapons with the Dream Work origin trait

// Something New PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Alloy Mag, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Wellspring, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 72 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5vRI9hBynq3jq712XCu7oc?si=c87cbb8036254e4a with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ???  ???: First-choice PvE pick for minor add-clear in end-game activities. Aggressive hand cannons have two main weaknesses - handling and reload speed. Fortunately, there are season 21 perk combinations that can help with that! Start with adding handling or a little extra stability with your barrel perk. You can go one of two ways with the magazine - either look for a perk that helps with reload or enjoy a combat effect perk and let the traits do the heavy lifting. While there are additional reload perks in the first trait column, you shouldn't really need them, so Wellspring offers useful ability energy on kills as your support trait. Then, in the second trait column as your signature perk, Frenzy maxes out handling and reload speed when procced, as well as providing a solid 15% weapon damage boost. The Dream Works origin trait is useful in a fireteam to get the occasional overflowed magazine in a firefight. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Something New PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Alloy, Mag, Rapid Hit, Pugilist, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 72 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5vRI9hBynq3jq712XCu7oc?si=c87cbb8036254e4a with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ???  ???: First-choice PvE pick for minor add-clear in end-game activities with a Stasis probably Hunter subclass. Aggressive hand cannons have two main weaknesses - handling and reload speed. So. start with adding handling or a little extra stability with your barrel perk, and look for a perk that helps with reload in your magazine. In the second trait column, as your signature perk, the second tier of Golden Tricorn can be difficult to proc with Stasis - shattering a target that's frozen with a Glacier Grenade will do it or, if you're a Hunter, your Shurikens will also work. To support that, you could go one of two ways with your first column trait - Rapid Hit, to speed up the reload speed and take full advantage of the 50% damage boost, or Pugilist to get melee energy back so you can proc it again sooner. The Dream Works origin trait is useful in a fireteam to get the occasional overflowed magazine in a firefight. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

@title:Season 21 Nightfall and Trials of Osiris weapons
@description:Season of the Deep new and reprised Vanguard and Crucible end-game weapons

// Buzzard PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Encore, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in end-game activities. Buzzard is a sidearm so it's likely to be less than optimal for end-game content, as you have to be very close to use one. It's got good stats overall, but the subfamily is all quite compressed. We can get pretty much every stat close to 100 with this particular roll, except for range so max that out with Full Bore in the barrel, a range Masterwork and any of the Combat Effect magazine perks. In the first trait column as the support perk, Encore wouldn't normally be under consideration, as it's mainly thought of as a PvP perk, but at four stacks it adds -5% accuracy cone growth for easier crits, 20 Range and 32 Stability. With Frenzy in the second trait slot as the signature perk procced, you end up with range of 86, stability of 89 or 99 depending on the mag, and handling and reload speed at 100, as well as the useful 15% damage boost. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// THE SWARM PvE first-choice roll
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities. It's difficult to love the reprised SWARM for PvE when the best damage perk has been lost, and the PvE options in both trait columns are weak. The only viable use is for minor add-clear as a kind of heavy scout rifle, but if you already have an older Bottomless Grief/One For All roll, just keep that and move on. If you do want to hold on to one, you could make an argument for any barrel perk - Fluted Barrel, for the handling and stability, Polygonal Rifling, for the big stability bump or Full Bore for the range bump, for example. In the mag, Appended Mag adds extra bullets, Flared Magwell adds straight stability and Reload Speed or Tactical Mag does both. In the first trait column as the support perk, Feeding Frenzy and Well Rounded are the best of a limited bunch, while in the second slot as the signature perk, Golden Tricorn is much the only choice - a straight 15% damage boost on kills that can be boosted to 50% with an arc ability kill for occasional burst damage against Majors. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// BrayTech Osprey PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, Cluster Bombs, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities. High-Impact Rocket Launchers are meant for add-clear - they have the highest blast radius stat of the subfamilies and do middling damage - 10% less than Adaptives or Aggressives. And saying that, BrayTech Osprey has the worst stats in its subfamily. So, would you really use a rocket launcher for add clear? If the answer is yes not sure it should be, but you go girl/boy/bot/peep, then use the barrel and mag to get to 100 blast radius without hurting velocity, and add Cluster Bombs and Chain Reaction for as much destruction as possible over as wide an area as possible. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3667553455&perks=1478423395,2822142346,1275731761,2396489472

// The Immortal PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Threat Detector, Surplus, Perpetual Motion, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities, particularly with a Strand subclass. While you've probably been melted a few times in PvP with The Immortal, it's still interesting in PvE as the first aggressive frame Strand SMG the same subfamily as Ikelos.It's an absolute stat monster and the support perks can make it even more so, so we'll start with a range-boosting barrel, and any of the "Rounds" magazines. In the first trait column for the support perk, Threat Detector, Surplus particularly easy to maintain with the extra melee charges from Strand, or Perpetual Motion will bump gunfeel stats up. If you're running solo content, don't forget the Alacrity origin trait to pretty much max out every stat on the board, and add 10 Aim Assist too. In the second column, Hatchling is the natural choice to pair with a Strand subclass to generate Threadlings for add control. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// The Immortal PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Threat Detector, Surplus, Perpetual Motion, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities. While you've probably been melted a few times in PvP with The Immortal, it's still interesting in PvE as the first aggressive frame Strand SMG the same subfamily as Ikelos.It's an absolute stat monster and the support perks can make it even more so, so we'll start with Full Bore in the barrel, and any of the "Rounds" magazines. In the first trait column for the support perk, Threat Detector, Surplus particularly easy to maintain with the extra melee charges from Strand, or Perpetual Motion will bump gunfeel stats up. If you're running solo content, don't forget the Alacrity origin trait to pretty much max out every stat on the board, and add 10 Aim Assist too. In the second column, while you'll never get to the top damage tier with no way to overfill the mag, Target Lock is a decent 25%-ish bump to damage for continuous fire against a single target. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// The Messenger PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear use in end-game activities. The reprised Messenger has a few new tricks for Season 21, which make it worth a look. Good stats across the board, except for recoil direction, which we can help out with Arrowhead Brake in the barrel slot, which takes it to a controllable 90. For the magazine perk, any of the "Rounds" mags or Flared Magwell work well. For your first trait column support perk, Rapid Hit and Perpetual Motion can both layer on addition gunfeel boosts on top. If you're running solo content, don't forget the Alacrity origin trait to pretty much max out every stat on the board, and add 10 Aim Assist too. Finally, in the second slot, the new-for-Lightfall Kinetic Tremors as the signature perk adds bonus AoE damage for 12 hits or four bursts, damaging your target and any adds within 5m. Recommended MW: any will work, depending on your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3796795102&perks=839105230,3230963543,1428297954,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=3796795102&perks=839105230,1968497646,1428297954,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=3796795102&perks=839105230,1561002382,1428297954,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=3796795102&perks=839105230,1885400500,1428297954,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=3796795102&perks=839105230,3230963543,247725512,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=3796795102&perks=839105230,1968497646,247725512,3891536761

// The Messenger Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear use in end-game activities. The reprised Messenger has a few new tricks for Season 21, which make it worth a look. Good stats across the board, except for recoil direction, which we can help out with Arrowhead Brake in the barrel slot, which takes it to a controllable 90. For the magazine perk, any of the "Rounds" mags or Flared Magwell work well. For your first trait column support perk, Rapid Hit and Perpetual Motion can both layer on addition gunfeel boosts on top. If you're running solo content, don't forget the Alacrity origin trait to pretty much max out every stat on the board, and add 10 Aim Assist too. Finally, in the second slot, the new-for-Lightfall Kinetic Tremors as the signature perk adds bonus AoE damage for 12 hits or four bursts, damaging your target and any adds within 5m. Recommended MW: any will work, depending on your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Unexpected Resurgence PvE first-choice roll
// Auxiliary Reserves, Supercooled Accelerator, Appended Mag, Accurized Rounds, Light Mag, Alloy Mag, Replenishing Aegis, Unstoppable Force
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for chunky add-clear use in endgame activities. The stats on Unexpected Resurgence make it the best adaptive glaive in the sandbox as at Season 21. Every Haft choice involves a trade-off but for most, the improved shield from Auxiliary Reserves, or maybe the range which = projectile speed from Supercooled Accelerator, are worth the penalty to reload speed, which we can get around. In the mag, Appended Mag for the extra shot Extended doesn't do anything more for you, or Accurized Rounds for the range are options, and if reload speed is still a worry, Light Mag or Alloy Mag help out. In the first trait column as the support park, the new-to-Lightfall Replenishing Aegis partially refills the mag on shield damage, and Unstoppable Force as the second column signature perk is a natural pairing, boosting damage by 20% for blocking the same damage with your shield. As an arc speacial weapon, you can also build into blinding and Jolting verbs with an arc subclass, and don't forget the Alacrity origin trait for solo content to pretty much max out range and reload speed, and add 10 Aim Assist too. Recommended MW: Range or Shield Duration, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=4005780578&perks=839105230,580685494,1966281507,2224838837

// Unexpected Resurgence PvE first-choice roll
// Auxiliary Reserves, Supercooled Accelerator, Appended Mag, Accurized Rounds, Light Mag, Alloy Mag, Replenishing Aegis, Subsistence, Close to Melee
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for chunky add-clear use in general activities. The stats on Unexpected Resurgence make it the best adaptive glaive in the sandbox as at Season 21. Every Haft choice involves a trade-off but for most, the improved shield from Auxiliary Reserves, or maybe the range which = projectile speed from Supercooled Accelerator, are worth the penalty to reload speed, which we can get around. In the mag, Appended Mag for the extra shot Extended doesn't do anything more for you, or Accurized Rounds for the range are options, and if reload speed is still a worry, Light Mag or Alloy Mag help out. In the first trait column as the support park, the new-to-Lightfall Replenishing Aegis partially refills the mag on shield damage, or Subsistence will do the same on Projectile kills. The other new perk, Close to Melee, as the second column signature perk is great for those who like to wade in and glaive melee, increasing damage by 30% for 10s after a projectile kill. As an arc speacial weapon, you can also build into blinding and Jolting verbs with an arc subclass, and don't forget the Alacrity origin trait for solo content to pretty much max out range and reload speed, and add 10 Aim Assist too. Recommended MW: Range or Shield Duration, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

@title:Season 20 Guardian Games weapons
@description:Lightfall Guardian Games weapons with Classy Contender origin trait

// The Title PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Threat Detector, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons 😉. Season 20 has lost the S-Tier Stats/One for All combination, unfortunately. If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds add a few metres of useful range. In the first trait column as your support perk, if you're not proccing Threat Detector's bonus Stability, Handling and Reload Speed, you're just doing it wrong. Similarly with Surrounded as your second column signature perk - although it's not the Enhanced version, you'll still have 40% bonus damage when procced in CQC. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Taraxippos PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Fourth Time's The Charm, Outlaw, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel will get you to a slightly better 64. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed and an extra shot for Tac Mag. Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, or Outlaw works well for a snappy reload after a crit kill. Then Hatchling in the second column as the signature perk builds into the Strand toolkit - just come to peace that they're likely to be spawned too far away to join you, if you're a Warlock. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

@title:Root of Nightmares weapons
@description:Raid weapons with the Harmonic Resonance origin trait

// Rufus's Fury PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds, Rewind Rounds, Target Lock, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Although, at 56, the recoil is pretty up-and-down, Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk takes the Recoil Direction to an even more controllable 86 and adds Handling. Flared Magwell or Ricochet Rounds add Stability and Reload Speed or Range and Stability in the magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with signature perks like Target Lock, where the refilled magazine allows you to reach the higher damage stacks, for damage against bulkier enemies or Frenzy for a general 15% damage bump. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Rufus's Fury Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds, Rewind Rounds, Target Lock, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Although, at 56, the recoil is pretty up-and-down, Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk takes the Recoil Direction to an even more controllable 86 and adds Handling. Flared Magwell or Ricochet Rounds add Stability and Reload Speed or Range and Stability in the magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with signature perks like Target Lock, where the refilled magazine allows you to reach the higher damage stacks, for damage against bulkier enemies or Frenzy for a general 15% damage bump. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=342514437&perks=839105230,1885400500,3418782618,365154968

Flared Magwell or Ricochet Rounds add Stability and Reload Speed or Range and Stability in the magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with Paracausal Affinity as a signature perk for a 20% boost to damage following a kill from any Darkness damage source. First-choice PvE roll for Strand synergy in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Rewind Rounds or Demolitionist both work as support perks in the first trait column, pairing Hatchling for Strand synergy which should be even better when the additional fragments arrive. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. // Mykel's Reverence PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag, Rewind Rounds, Paracasual Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Darkness subclass synergy for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Mykel's Reverence is no different - this is the best rapid-fire sidearm. With a Recoil Direction of 96, you can spec into your preference of Range, Stability and/or Reload Speed in the barrel and magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with Paracausal Affinity for a 20% damage boost following a kill from any Darkness damage source. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Reload Speed, Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Acasia's Dejection PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Particle Repeater, Field Prep, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. You can use this as a pseudo primary weapon with Field Prep as your first trait column support perk boosting your reserves, and Frenzy as your second column signature perk not only boosting damage by 15%, but capping out Handling and Reload Speed at 100. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range or Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1471212226&perks=1482024992,2680121939,2869569095,4104185692

// Acasia's Dejection PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Solar subclass synergy for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against crowds of adds, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk both give you greater uptime for Incandescent's scorch and ignition solar-subclass verbs for crowd control as the second column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Koraxis's Distress PvE first-choice roll
// Linear Compensator, Quick Launch, Spike Grenades, Chain Reactions, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, Linear Compensator adds a little extra Blast Radius let's face it, you'll want to catch as many adds as possible in an explosion, or Quick Launch just goes all in for velocity in the barrel. If you do catch a chunkier enemy, Spike Grenades is nice for a little extra impact damage, and then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius or Velocity - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2972949637&perks=3525010810,3301904089,2396489472,831391274

// Koraxis's Distress PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, High-Explosive Ordnance, Chain Reaction, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, you'll want the Blast Radius as large as possible - Volatile Launch and High-Explosive Ordnance add 25 and a masterwork adds another 10. Then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a Backup Mag or damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Koraxis's Distress Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, High-Explosive Ordnance, Chain Reaction, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, you'll want the Blast Radius as large as possible - Volatile Launch and High-Explosive Ordnance add 25 and a masterwork adds another 10. Then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a Backup Mag or damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=495442100&perks=1478423395,1380253176,2396489472,831391274

First-choice PvE roll for sustained DPS against bosses in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by 10%, and damage against Tormentors and Lucent Hive by 25%, so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. For boss damage, both Rewind Rounds and Reconstruction, as your first trait column support perk, overfill or refill the magazine to keep get as many shots with Focused Fury's damage boost as possible, as your second trait column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. // Briar's Contempt PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Enhanced Battery, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Demolitionist, Frenzy 
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for sustained DPS against bosses in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by up to 10%, and damage against Tormentors and Lucent Hive by 25%, so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. For boss damage, both Rewind Rounds and Reconstruction, as your first trait column support perk, overfill or refill the magazine, or alternatively Demolitionist provides an instant reload to keep damage uptime for Frenzy's 15% damage boost as your second trait column signature perk. The additional 50 Reload Speed from Frenzy is handy, once you do need to reload, too. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Briar's Contempt PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Enhanced Battery, Incandescent, Paracausal Affinity 
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by 10% so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. Unusually, you can roll Incandescent in the first trait column as your support perk, to synergise with solar subclasses to improve scorch and ignition, and proc Paracausal Affinity in the second column as your signature park. Paracausal Affinity then buffs ignition damage to keep the loop going. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. @title:Season of Defiance Devrim Kay VIII and Foundry weapons
@description:Season 20 new and reprised weapons with the Field Tested or Foundry origin trait

// Battle Scar PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Accurized Rounds, Shoot to Loot, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Not a lot of current competition for lightweight pulse rifles as at v7.0.0.7, anyway but they add a very useful +20 mobility useful when buildcrafting and +6.25% movement speed. Unfortunately, the stats on the reprised Battle Scar are low across the board - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers five stacks would take 1001 hits to achieve!. You'd really be looking for Arrowhead Brake in the barrel ideally, to help clean up the low recoil direction and, if you prefer stability and reload speed go for Tactical Mag, or for range go for Accurized Rounds. Battle Scar is one of the first kinetic weapons that can roll with Kinetic Tremors as your signature perk in the second trait column - for end-game activities this pairs nicely with Shoot to Loot as, as well as the passive damage boost just for repeated hits you will also pick up ammo from anywhere in the shockwave area and reload all of your guns too. Recommended MW: TBH anything will work - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor, Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2099894368&perks=839105230,106909392,3700496672,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2099894368&perks=839105230,3142289711,3700496672,3891536761

// Battle Scar PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Accurized Rounds, Perpetual Motion, Keep Away, Osmosis
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Not a lot of current competition for lightweight pulse rifles as at v7.0.0.7, anyway but they add a very useful +20 mobility useful when buildcrafting and +6.25% movement speed. Unfortunately, the stats on the reprised Battle Scar are low across the board - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers five stacks would take 1001 hits to achieve!. You'd really be looking for Arrowhead Brake in the barrel ideally, to help clean up the low recoil direction and, if you prefer stability and reload speed go for Tactical Mag, or for range go for Accurized Rounds. To improve your gunfeel, in the first trait slot as you r support perk, Perpetual Motion adds a decent bump to handling, stability and reload speed, or if you want extra range then Keep Away boosts that, reload speed and accuracy. Osmosis, as your signature perk in the second trait column is fairly rare and will pick up any of the energy synergies from your subclass say, volatile rounds when that's procced by a void ability - if you haven't already got a pulse rifle with the perk, then this would be worth hanging on to. Recommended MW: TBH anything will work - just go with your preferece, with a damage-boosting Minor, Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Harsh Language PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, High-Velocity Rounds, Envious Assassin, Destabilizing Rounds, Repulsor Brace
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy and Minor add clear in end-game content. The reprised Harsh Language is only the second void wave-frame grenade launcher. Lower stats that Deafening Whisper although the range of stats is pretty compressed - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. You start out with 100 blast radius - not that it makes any difference as it's the dump stat for wave frame GLs - so you can use the barrel and mag perks for velocity and handling. Quick Launch is ideal, and Smart Drift Control works as a good alternate, and out of the two choices, High-Velocity Rounds is the mag perk to choose. the standout support perk in the first trait column is Envious Assassin - you can get up to three shots in the barrel for killing adds with your primary or power weapon. You have a choice of two signature perks in the second trait column to help with add clear - Destabilising Rounds is the more offensive option for add clear or Repulsor Brace for tanking damage in a crowd. Recommended MW: Handling or Velocity, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=3525010810,2822142346,968510818,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=3798852852,2822142346,968510818,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=3525010810,2822142346,968510818,776531651
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=3798852852,2822142346,968510818,776531651

// Senuna SI6 PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Feeding Frenzy, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Season 20 Omolon weapon named after Celtic godess worshipped in Roman Britain, if you're asking is an Adaptive Stasis Sidearm. First thing to say is that, if you already have a decent stasis sidearm, this really doesn't offer anything much new so you can probably give it a miss. For newer Guardians, controlling the recoil on sidearms, through recoil direction and stability, is the job of your barrel and mag although additional reload speed for the Senuna is also useful. If you're a serial reloaded, the Omolon origin trait will help with both in the top half of the magazine. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk brings the Recoil Direction to 100 and adds handling to make the gun feel snappier. In the mag, Flared Magwell or maybe Appended Mag are probably the best picks - Light Mag isn't bad either. Feeding Frenzy as your support perk in the first trait column will speed up reloads still further after kills, while Headstone as your signature perk in the second trait column generates your Stasis crystal on a crit kill to use your subclass fragments with. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,1087426260,2779035018,124408337
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,3230963543,2779035018,124408337
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,679225683,2779035018,124408337

// Senuna SI6 PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Feeding Frenzy, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Season 20 Omolon weapon named after Celtic godess worshipped in Roman Britain, if you're asking is an Adaptive Stasis Sidearm. First thing to say is that, if you already have a decent stasis sidearm, this really doesn't offer anything much new so you can probably give it a miss. For newer Guardians, controlling the recoil on sidearms, through recoil direction and stability, is the job of your barrel and mag although additional reload speed for the Senuna is also useful. If you're a serial reloaded, the Omolon origin trait will help with both in the top half of the magazine. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk brings the Recoil Direction to 100 and adds handling to make the gun feel snappier. In the mag, Flared Magwell or maybe Appended Mag are probably the best picks - Light Mag isn't bad either. Feeding Frenzy as your support perk in the first trait column will speed up reloads still further after kills, while the first stack of Golden Tricorn as your signature perk in the second trait column is a reliable 15% damage boost, even if the second stack is tougher to proc with Stasis abilities. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec oe Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Senuna SI6 PvE first-choice roll
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Season 20 Omolon weapon named after Celtic godess worshipped in Roman Britain, if you're asking is an Adaptive Stasis Sidearm. First thing to say is that, if you already have a decent stasis sidearm, this really doesn't offer anything much new so you can probably give it a miss. For newer Guardians, controlling the recoil on sidearms, through recoil direction and stability, is the job of your barrel and mag although additional reload speed for the Senuna is also useful. If you're a serial reloaded, the Omolon origin trait will help with both in the top half of the magazine. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk brings the Recoil Direction to 100 and adds handling to make the gun feel snappier. In the mag, you can take your pick of any combat effect perk - High-Caliber, Armor-Piercing or Ricochet Rounds. Grave Robber as your support perk in the first trait column bypasses reloads just for melee kills on adds and, if that's what you're doing, Pugilist synergises well as your signature perk in the second trait column, by returning melee energy on kills. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,1561002382,1631667848,691659142
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,1968497646,1631667848,691659142
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,1885400500,1631667848,691659142

// Irukandji PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling, Steady Rounds, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Envious Assassing, Fourth Time's The Charm, Rapid Hit, Firing Line, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in a fireteam in end-game content. The Season 20 Veist weapon is a rapid-fire sniper rifle with as-expected lowish stats, as a World drop weapon. Irukandji a small, rare, highly venomous jellyfish from Australia, because of course it would be does benefit from the Veist Stinger origin trait which is occasionally useful even in its nerfed state. Remember that as at Season 20, this will do less base damage than an equivalent kinetic weapon so, to be competitive, you'll need the parks to fall your way. The main issue you'll find is with keeping the reticule on a boss's crit spot - you'll need to boost Recoil Direction and Stability to make this easier, so Arrowhead Brake or Polygonal Rifling are your barrel perk choices, and Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag or even Steady Rounds you're not likely to be outside of the damage falloff distance, even with the range penalty should be your mag perk options. As your first trait column support perk, Envious Assassin overflows your magazine passively with primary and power weapon kills, Fourth Time's The Charm works extends the magazine if you hit crits consistently, or Rapid Hit improves stability and reload speed as you fire to keep your reticule steadier. In the signature perk, second column trait, Firing Line is more forgiving of an occasional missed shot when you're in a fireteam but, if you're flying solo, Focused Fury will boost damage in the bottom half of your magazine if you can hit your crits consistently. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Marsilion-C PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Augmented Drum, Field Prep, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in end-game content. Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking, a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. For major or boss damage, if you look build into Explosive Light as your signature perk in the second trait column then, as your blast radius is already set to 100, you can concentrate on Velocity in your Barrel - Quick Launch or Smart Drift Control. With 100 Blast Radius, Spike Grenades will be much less effective, so Augmented Drum is the better mag perk, as this synergises with Field Prep as your support perk in the first trait column, for more ammo reserves and faster reloads. The Enhanced Explosive Light perk grants an extra stack of damage over the standard version, so you'll have a magazine capable of using all seven stacks before reloading! Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=867154247&perks=3525010810,1771897777,2869569095,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=867154247&perks=3798852852,1771897777,2869569095,3194351027

// Perpetualis PvE first-choice roll
// Extended Barrel, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Keep Away, Zen Moment, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. Shapeable. This is the easier to get Strand adaptive auto-rifle for Season of Defiance, if you're unable to get into the Root of Nightmares Raid. The stats are decent, although both stability and handling are a little below par, and the recoil direction could maybe do with a little help, although the Noble Deeds origin perk can help out with the handling and boost reload speed too. Extended Barrel or Smallbore are your best barrel choices, and Tactical Mag is the best of the mag perks. In the first trait column, there aren't many support perks that help in PvE - Keep Away is the pick of a limited budget, or possibly the reworked Zen Moment. For your second trait column signature perk, Golden Tricorn is unique as at v7.0.0.6, anyway on a Strand auto rifle and the second stack isn't too difficult to proc by either using a grapple melee or shooting a Tangle, for a massive 50% damage boost for 10s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb
