// Raconteur PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Compact Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. Shapeable. Our first Stasis Precision Bow, with competitive stats by comparison with the other kinetic slot options, although Accuracy is the lowest of all the Precisions. Your aim with the Bowstring and Arrow, as ever, is to reduce the draw time, while not harming your accuracy or handling. Elastic String is the best for as low a draw time as possible and helps Handling too, at the cost of Accuracy, which you can recover with an Accuracy Masterwork, while Compact Arrow Shaft boosts handling and reload speed. Don't forget, the Noble Deeds origin perk will also boost both as well. If you ever see Archer's Tempo as the support perk in the first trait column then you don't need to look much further. Similarly, Explosive Head adds damage and flinch for free so is the best signature perk in the second trait column. Recommended MW: Accuracy or Draw Time, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=45643573&perks=2801223209,16392701,201365942,3365897133

// Royal Executioner PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Envious Assassin, Threat Detector, Lead from Gold, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Solar synergy in end-game activities. Shapeable. Season 20's solar adaptive fusion rifle has okayish stats, with the Noble Deeds origin perk helping with a boost to handling and reload speed when procced. Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk makes the recoil much easier to control, taking the Recoil Direction from 58 to 88. Particle Repeater is an option, but Accelerated Coils is the better play - you'll be killing red bars even with the slight reduction in damage and you'll appreciate the faster charge time. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling, for more snappiness and Reload Speed, so fits in really well. Envious Assassin is a stand out support perk in the first trait column, overflowing the magazine as you get primary and power weapon kills, but Threat Detector and Lead From Gold are right up there too. This is the first solar FR to give the option of Incandescent as the signature perk in the second column, which plays into the subclass verbs for end-game add clear. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1720503118&perks=839105230,689005463,968510818,4293542123

// Prodigal Return PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Disorienting Grenades, Envious Assassin, Disruption Break
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add suppression in end-game activities. Shapeable. This drops into a very competitive field of arc lightweight grenade launchers, although it does have decent stats except for handling. The usual play is to look for velocity, to get the grenade to its target as fast as possible, and handling, for speedy swaps, and it'll be no different this time. Fortunately, the Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling and Reload Speed, so fits in really well. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. For add control, Disorienting Grenades give you breathing space in a firefight. Pair that with Envious Assassin, which can give you up to three in the barrel! as your support perk in the first trait column, and Disruption Break, for 50% bonus kinetic damage to burst down chunkier red bar Minors and the occasional Major while they stumble around as the signature perk, and you probably have the perfect add control breach-loading GL. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a Quick Access Sling for faster swaps or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Prodigal Return PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, High-Velocity Rounds, Threadt Detector, Field Prep, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Arc Synergy in general activities. Shapeable. This drops into a very competitive field of arc lightweight grenade launchers, although it does have decent stats except for handling. The usual play is to look for velocity, to get the grenade to its target as fast as possible, and handling, for speedy swaps, and it'll be no different this time. Fortunately, the Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling and Reload Speed, so fits in really well. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. With one eye towards building a weapon around Voltshot this is the first GL with Voltshot as an option, although the jury is still out on whether that's a good idea or not as the signature perk in the second trait column, we'll need to make the reload as fast as possible. High Velocity Rounds boosts reload speed as well as velocity. Then Threat Detector or Field Prep as your support perk in the first trait column helps too. Using Spark of Beacons gives you arc Blinding on a kill, which should make the follow-up shot after a kill, to get your Jolt damage tick, easier to hit. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Regnant PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Spike Grenades, Auto-Loading Holster, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for sustained boss DPS in end-game activities. Shapeable. Essentially a void Wendigo with poorer stats, but with access to enhanced traits. As is usual for grenade launchers, look to increase velocity to get the grenade on target as fast as possible, and handling, for general snappiness. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with handling, and reload speed too, so works well. In the magazine, Spike Grenade adds direct impact damage to a target. In the first trait column as your pick of the support perks, Auto-Loading Holster lets you empty the magazine and reload while you're swapped to your DPS special weapon to rinse and repeat, while Explosive Light is by far the best damage boost for your signature perk in the second - and the enhanced version adds an extra stack on top. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Regnant PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Spike Grenades, Envious Assassin, Explosive Light

First-choice PvE roll for burst DPS against majors in end-game activities. Shapeable. Essentially a void Wendigo with poorer stats, but with access to enhanced traits. As is usual for grenade launchers, look to increase velocity to get the grenade on target as fast as possible, and handling, for general snappiness. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with handling, and reload speed too, so works well. In the magazine, Spike Grenade adds direct impact damage to a target. In the first trait column as your support perk, Envious Assassin overflows the magazine or the most quick shots to finish off a major or stunned Champion quickly, while Explosive Light is by far the best damage boost for your signature perk in the second - and the enhanced version adds an extra stack on top. // Regnant PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Explosive Ordnance, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy. Shapeable. Essentially a void Wendigo with poorer stats, but with access to enhanced traits. You'll be using this roll for add clearing, so you'll want to crank up the blast radius with your barrel with Volatile Launch, High Explosive Ordnance in the magazine, and a Blast Radious Masterwork. Repulsor Brace as your support perk in the first trait column gives you a void overshield for void-debuffed kills, which is exactly what Destabilizing Rounds sets you up for, as your signature perk in the second trait column, making targets near a kill volatile, including chunkier ones for easier clean-up with the next shot. This combination should make you a bit of a walking tank in add-dense areas, as long as you have ammo. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Caretaker PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and minor add clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. This is maybe our first non-Raid sword with significantly different stats - the Charge Rate is 60, by comparison with every other adaptive sword's 20 except DSC's Bequest, and the Noble Deeds origin perk boosts the charge rate further for buffing Guardians around you. As with most swords, go for as much impact damage as possible, so Jagged Edge as your blade plus the inevitable Impact Masterwork. Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. For your support perk in the first trait column, both Tireless Blade and Relentless Strikes work but, once you get Incandescent working and Ember of Ashes helps as your signature perk in the second trait column, the ignite kills among adds count towards Tireless Blade kills, so that will be the more efficient way to regain ammo. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Synchronic Roulette PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Pulse Monitor, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Precision frame SMG, so you don't have to worry about recoil direction and range is pretty compressed, so go for handling and stability with your barrel. In the mag, High-Caliber Rounds is always good for extra flinch on a bullet hose, but Armor-Piercing is also decent for damaging multiple adds in CQC, Ricochet Rounds can be run or just get extra stability and Reload speed with Flared Magwell. There's not much PvE-wise in the first trait column but Pulse Monitor could be useful if you're out of cover to use Target Lock and are taking damage, to reload you magazine to keep your damage output up, and the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Basso Ostinato PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shround, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - maybe not the play for end-game activities where you're probably in trouble if you're close enough to use it, but useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. The ranges on shotguns are compressed, to look for a handling or stability barrel, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too. In the last column, Destabilizing Rounds spreads volatility to surrounding adds on a kill to synergise with Void subclass verbs. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Basso Ostinato PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shround, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion, Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - you'll need to be careful to to be in a vulnerable position when using one, but they're useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. The ranges on shotguns are compressed, to look for a handling or stability barrel, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too. In the last column, Trench Barrel is reliable for fast burst damage in CQC and works well on a rapid-fire frame. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE although you'll probably not be seeing them often on a Boss-damaging weapon. // Basso Ostinato PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Grave Robber, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage for Lethal Current/Liar's Handshake Hunters. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - you'll need to be careful to to be in a vulnerable position when using one, but they're useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. With one eye on One-Two Punch in the second trait column, Full Choke gives you the best chance of hitting your target with every pellet, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. You should be getting melee kills as you're rolling around and punching so Grave Robber should keep your mag filled, and One-Two Punch adds additional multiplicative melee damage even if it's been nerfed somewhat. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE although you'll probably not be seeing them often on a Boss-damaging weapon. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=1047830412,106909392,1631667848,2679249093

// Basso Ostinato PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - you'll need to be careful to to be in a vulnerable position when using one, but they're useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. With one eye on One-Two Punch in the second trait column, Full Choke gives you the best chance of hitting your target with every pellet, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too, and One-Two Punch adds additional multiplicative melee damage even if it's been nerfed somewhat to burst down a major, or even a boss. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE although you'll probably not be seeing them often on a Boss-damaging weapon. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Iterative Loop PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Particle Repeater, Accelerated Coils, Compulsive Reloader, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for Arc synergy and burst damage. Seeing as fusion rifles apply the highest Jolt tick damage of any special weapon, it would be rude not to pick or shape a roll. Rapid fire fusions need a fair bit of control with nine bolts being fired, so Arrowhead Break takes the recoil direction to 77, or up the stability through Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. In the battery, there's nothing to help speed up reloading, so Particle Repeater adds more stability, or Accelerated Coils speeds up charge time. Compulsive Reloader and a Reload Speed Masterwork boosts reload to 100 at the top half of the mag, so your reloads after a kill to proc Voltshot should be as snappy as it's possible to get. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them with rapid kills - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Volta Bracket PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Envious Assassin, Explosive Payload, Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage in end-game activities. Sniper rifles are in a bit of a tough spot as v7.0.0.3, but it's worth holding on to a good roll or two in the Vault, just in case. If you're shaping one, Fluted Barrel makes it snappier, and you can bypass the reload speed penalty of Extended Barrel with Backup Mag and Envious Assassin, to overload your magazine of 5 to 8. In the second trait column, Explosive Payload adds a flat 15% bonus damage or, in a fireteam, Firing Line adds 20% crit damage. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them with multiple hits - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Aurvandil FR6 PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Stats For All, One For All
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and end-game content. The first kinetic slot high-impact fusion rifle - it needs handling and stability to improve gunfeel, but it might be worth hanging onto in case the archetype gets a little love. Fusion Rifle range is very constrained, so look for handling with your barrel, and Ionized or Enhanced Battery adds extra shots. If you spray with your first shot, then the SOFA Stats/One For All roll will more than offset any reload penalty, along with other gunfeel boosts, as well as increasing damage by a chunky 35%. The Omolon origin trait is useful in the top half of the mag, to help with reloads and a touch of extra stability too. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability, Reload Speed or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Aurvandil FR6 PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Reconstruction, Subsistence, Slideways, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and end-game content. The first kinetic slot high-impact fusion rifle - it needs handling and stability to improve gunfeel, but it might be worth hanging onto in case the archetype gets a little love. Fusion Rifle range is very constrained, so look for handling with your barrel, and Ionized or Enhanced Battery adds extra shots. Reconstruction, Subsistence or Slideways all help you keep your magazine topped up so you can take advantage of the damage boost from Golden Tricorn. With this being a stasis weapon, the second stack is tough to proc, but the 15% extra damage from one stack is reliable and refreshable. The Omolon origin trait is useful in the top half of the mag, to help with reloads and a bit of extra stability too. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability, Reload Speed or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Fioritura-59 PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Pugilist, Repulsor Brace
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for void subclasses in general content. Decent stats by comparison with its peers but, at the end of the day, this is still a sidearm looking for an in-game role. Spec into stability with your barrel, and High-Cal Rounds for extra flinch, or Armor-Piercing Rounds you're likely to be in a crowd in CQC, so APR can be useful to damage more than one enemy at a time, or Ricochet Rounds or Flared Magwell will add additional stability to help control the recoil. Pugilist can help recharge your melee to add a void verb to your target to proc Repulsor Brace on a kill and generate a void overshield to help tank damage in a crowd. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Jararaca-3sr PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for stasis subclasses in end-game content. Even nerfed, the Veist Stinger origin trait will still be useful occasionally. Jararaca has poor stats, unfortunately, by comparison with other rapid-fire and Veist rapid-fire scout rifles, but it does offer Stasis synergy. First, ou'll need Arrowhead Brake to sort out the recoil direction. Any of the combat effect rounds will help - if you keep firing until the end of the magazine, the frame perk will help reloads, so you can live without a reload speed-boosting magazine perk, especially with Rapid Hit or Perpetual Motion in the first trait column. Finally, for Stasis synergy, in the second trait column Headstone's crystals work with your aspects and fragments. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Lodbrok-C PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Fourth Time's The Charm, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Pretty decent, in-bands stats, so Smallbore offers a little extra range and stability, both of which are useful boosts. To take full advantage of Target Lock, to burst down beefier minors, look for as large a magazine as you can and combine with Fourth Time's the Charm. This could be a little niche, but this roll with Lodbrok could be a useful tool to have in your loadout if you're facing constructs and vehicles, with the Hakke Breach Armaments' 15% damage boost on top of Target Lock. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Lodbrok-C PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Osmosis, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Pretty decent, in-bands stats, so Smallbore offers a little extra range and stability, both of which are useful boosts. Any of the combat effect magazines can help you - High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing or Ricochet Rounds - so that's down to your preference. Even though match game is less of an issue from Season 20, you can take advantage of any ability verbs from the grenade you throw - so, for example, a void grenade can proc Volatile Rounds which your now void energy Lodbrok will apply. Unfortunately Demolitionist rolls in the same trait column, but Adrenaline Junkie will trigger on a grenade kill for 33% boost to damage on top in the second column instead. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

Demolitionist with Adrenaline Junkie is a natural pairing - get the grenade kill to proc 33% extra damage and then clean up to regenerate your grenade energy to keep the loop going. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Judgment of Kelgorath PvE first-choice roll
// Auxilliary Reserves, Appended Mag, Overflow, Close to Melee
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts but will be more use for a glaive than Hakke Breach Armaments. JoK is a new subtype for Season 19 - a slower, but harder hitting slashy shooty stick than we're used to. You're going to be in CQC, where projectile speed governed by range isn't quite as important, so the shield can be quite useful to survive in a crowd. Use your haft to improve charge time and shield duration, and take the extra shot from Appended Mag Extended Mag gives you no more shots so isn't worth it. In the first trait column, Overflow on a Special or Power weapon is just so good - more than double your magazine size and it bypasses the low reload speed just for picking up a brick! Close to Melee was just built for glaives - projectile kills improve melee damage by 30%, and more kills with either projectile or melee extend the timer. Proc and go have fun. MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Retrofit Escapade PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Stats for All, One for All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, although Suros Synergy's flinch reduction in reload is useful in a firefight too so take your pick. This is better in every stat than the only other rapid fire LMG - Shattered Cypher - and there are a few ways you can go with a weapon build. You'll need to control your fire with short bursts - so, to make it easier, tighten up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake. Tactical Mag adds a few extra shots, plus stability and reload speed. Rapid-fires have plenty of rounds to proc the SOFA Stats/One for All trait combination. Bonus handling, stability, range and reload speed, plus a 35% boost to damage just for hitting three different enemies. Recommended  MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag or damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Fire and Forget PvE first-choice roll
Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Field Prep, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game boss DPS. Shapeable. Veist Stinger is the origin trait to use, as it procs per shot rather than per burst, which means you'll probably never need to reload. F&F is a non-endgame obtainable  boss-killing replacement for Reed's Regret, and a aggressive-frame companion to Stormchaser. Being a stasis LFR, it's easy to get a Font of Might 25% boost to your damage if you have a Warlock putting down a Well and willing to use the Supreme Wellmaker mod, and you're using the Elemental Shards and Elemental Time Dilation mods. You'll need to keep your shots on a boss's crit spot, so maximise your stability with your barrel, and then add in an extra charge with no downsides with Enhanced Battery. For boss damage, use Field Prep to boost your ammo reserves which you'll be calling on with Veist Stinger, and you'll get plenty of opportunity to proc the 20% damage boost from Focused Fury once you hit six individual crits the trait procs on individual shots rather than on bursts. Recommended  MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// IKELOS_HC_v1.0.3 PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Seraph Rounds, Stats for All, One for All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game add clear. Shapeable. The Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Precisions aren't the strongest choice for PvE as at Season 19 v6.3.0.2, and the Ikelos HC's stats are pretty bad across the board, but there are a few combinations that are still interesting. Fill in some of the stat gaps in Handling and Range with your barrel, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. Even though you're using about 25% of your magazine to proc SOFA Stats/One for All, the stat boosts to round everything out and 35% damage boost are well worth it for add-clear. Recommended  MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// IKELOS_HC_v1.0.3 PvE backup roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Seraph Rounds, Stats for All, Rapid Hit, Triple Tap, Well Rounded, Triple Tap, Rapid Hit, Stats for All, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. Backup PvE roll for end-game add clear. Shapeable. The Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Precisions aren't the strongest choice for PvE as at Season 19 v6.3.0.2, and the Ikelos HC's stats are pretty bad across the board, but there are a few combinations that are still interesting. Fill in some of the stat gaps in Handling and Range with your barrel, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. To make the most of your Void 3.0 toolkit, use Golden Tricorn in the second column to get a 50% damage boost at two stacks one stack is not bad - it's still as good a Frenzy. Back in the first column, Well Rounded provides stat boosts as you gain the second GT stack, or any of the other magazine extending/reload speed boosting traits keep you firing. Recommended  MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// taken from https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep44-ikelos-smg-correction.txt

// IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3 PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Seraph Rounds, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general add clear. Shapeable. Voltshot SMG anyone? It's already an S-Tier stat monster, but is anyone actually reading past the word Voltshot? The Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Stability is the play for controller, to help keep your barrel pointed at what you're shooting at, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. To pair with Voltshot, forget Feeding Frenzy as it doesn't pair well so, instead, Threat Detector will speed up your reloads and boost your stability while you're in CQC or Perpetual Motion will do the same just for moving about a bit. Recommended  MW: Reload or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2149683300&perks=1392496348,1140096971,4071163871,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=2149683300&perks=1840239774,1140096971,4071163871,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=2149683300&perks=1392496348,1140096971,1428297954,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=2149683300&perks=1840239774,1140096971,1428297954,2173046394

// IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3 PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general add clear. Shapeable. Voltshot SMG anyone? It's already an S-Tier stat monster, but is anyone actually reading past the word Voltshot? The Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Stability is the play for controller, to help keep your barrel pointed at what you're shooting at, and then to help with Voltshot you want your reload to be as fast as possible - Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both help out. To pair with Voltshot, forget Feeding Frenzy as it doesn't pair well so, instead, Threat Detector  will speed up your reloads and boost your stability while you're in CQC or Perpetual Motion will do the same just for moving about a bit. Recommended  MW: Reload or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3 PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Seraph Rounds, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game add clear. Shapeable. It's already an S-Tier stat monster and the Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Stability is the play for controller, to help keep your barrel pointed at what you're shooting at, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. If you're looking at end-game add-clearing, Threat Detector will speed up your reloads and boost your stability while you're in CQC or Perpetual Motion will do the same just for moving about a bit and Surrounded boosts damage by 36.5% and the enhanced version by 47%. But, even though this is a great roll, you'll still know in your heart that you really wanted Voltshot... Recommended  MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

title:Season 19 Dawning weapons
description:New and reprised Dawning weapons with the Dawning Surprise origin perk

// Cold Front PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Stats for All, One for All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for end-game Minor clearing. The only easily available Aggressive SMG in the game other than Xur selling an Extraordinary Rendition - you have a good one, you probably won't need a Cold Front. Option of Hakke Breach Armaments or the Dawning Surprise origin trait can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. Very poor stability, so for controller Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel or Smallbore is a must, together with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to get it as high as possible. For end-game add clear, the reliable SOFA combination of Stats for All and One for All rounds out the stats and adds 35% bonus damage just for hitting three different enemies. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2814093983&perks=1392496348,106909392,1583705720,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=2814093983&perks=1840239774,106909392,1583705720,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=2814093983&perks=1482024992,106909392,1583705720,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=2814093983&perks=1392496348,3230963543,1583705720,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=2814093983&perks=1840239774,3230963543,1583705720,4049631843

// Stay Frosty PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Thresh, Adaptive Munitions
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for end-game match game activities and anti-Barrier Champions when the mod's around. Option of Omolon Fluid Dynamics or the Dawning Surprise origin trait can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. This is the first Stasis Lightweight frame Pulse Rifle, the frame providing +20 mobility and 6.25% boost to movement, and the first to roll with Adaptive Munitions to provide a shield-busting primary in the kinetic slot. Has decent stats compared to kinetic Lightweights. Sort out the wonky recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake. To maximise damage against shields, look for Armor-Piercing Rounds and, in the absence of a complementary column 1 trait, Thresh provides a nice little boost to super regeneration. But the real gold is Adaptive Munitions in trait column 2 for primary ammo shield busting in the kinetic slot for the first time. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2812100428&perks=839105230,1968497646,2726471870,1048183818

// Glacioclasm PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Particle Repeater, Accelerated Coils, Subsistence, Slideshot, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for crowd clearing. Option of Omolon Fluid Dynamics for the faster top-up reloads or the Dawning Surprise origin trait which helps you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. There are no real holes in the stats, but Fluted Barrel or Smallbore provide nice boosts in the barrel. In the battery, Particle Repeater helps keep the burst tight, or if you're a little impatient, Accelerated Coils reduces charge time. The big draw here is Reservoir Burst with either Subsistence or Slideshot to keep the magazine full. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Glacioclasm PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Enhanced Battery, Particle Repeater, Accelerated Coils, Repulsor Brace, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for Void subclass in endgame content. Option of Omolon Fluid Dynamics or the Dawning Surprise origin trait can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. There are no real holes in the stats, but Fluted Barrel or Smallbore provide nice boosts in the barrel. In the battery, Enhanced Battery gets you more shots, Particle Repeater helps keep the burst tight, or if you're a little impatient, Accelerated Coils reduces charge time. For Void subclasses, Repulsor Brace works with your void debuffs to give you a damage resistant overshield and the second stack of Golden Tricorn should be easy to proc with the melee and grenade toolkit. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Avalanche PvE first-choice roll

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for chunkier Minors and Bosses with a Solar subclass in endgame content. Option of Suros Synergy or the Dawning Surprise origin trait which can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. Balanced stats, so you can use Arrowhead Brake to get straight recoil, or Fluted Barrel for extra Handling and Stability with any combat effect or reload speed-boosting mag to round out to your preference. Even in end-game content, you should be getting add kills regularly to proc Subsistence, and then build into solar scorch and ignite with Incandescent. //notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for chunkier Minors with a Solar subclass in endgame content. // Avalanche PvE first-choice roll
Arrowhead Brake. Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Ambitious Assassin, Incandescent, Adrenaline Junkie, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for chunkier Minors with a Solar subclass in endgame content. Option of Suros Synergy or the Dawning Surprise origin trait which can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. Balanced stats, so you can use Arrowhead Brake to get straight recoil, or Fluted Barrel for extra Handling and Stability. In the mag slot, we'll be wanting to take full advantage of Ambitious Assassin's 110% bonus mag size per rapid kill after reloading  with a size-boosting option. Then take your pick of damage-boosting magazine traits against Minors or Majors to make the most of a huge magazine. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strike, Unrelenting, Cold Steel
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for Stasis subclass synergy. No second origin trait, but Dawning Surprise helps you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so - ideal in keeping you alive in CQC. In the blade slot, Jagged Edge to maximises damage or Tempered Edge balances a bit of extra damage and ammo, for all-round utility. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation in the guard slot, to get your heavy attack up as quickly as possible. Cold Steel is Zephyr's signature trait - ideal for synergising with Stasis subclasses by adding slow stacks and freezing opponents. Relentless Strikes works well against both groups of adds or a single target, or Unrelenting works for add-clear, recovering your health from both the perk itself and the origin trait. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=396910433&perks=3666208348,269888150,3108830275,3650930298
dimwishlist:item=396910433&perks=938542991,269888150,3108830275,3650930298
dimwishlist:item=396910433&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3650930298
dimwishlist:item=396910433&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3650930298

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Unrelenting, Chain Reaction, Surrounded, Whirlwind Blade
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for Minor add clear. No second origin trait, but Dawning Surprise helps you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so - ideal in keeping you alive in CQC. In the blade slot, Jagged Edge to maximises damage or Tempered Edge balances a bit of extra damage and ammo, for all-round utility. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation in the guard slot, to get your heavy attack up as quickly as possible. Unrelenting works for an add-clear weapon build, recovering your health from both the perk itself and the origin trait. In the second trait column, Chain Reaction, Surrounded and Whirlwind Blade all help with Minors and the occasional chunky Major. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Mechabre PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Clown Cartridge, Triple Tap, Vorpal Weapon, High-Impact Reserves
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for sustained damage against Bosses. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Direct competitor to Occluded Finality, but with a much more reasonable 45 Zoom. You don't really need to worry about range, so look no further than Fluted Barrel to boost Handling and Stability. You want to go all in to the magazine size, so use Extended Barrel and Backup Mag to get to five in the mag. In the first trait column, Clown Cartridge boosts magazine size by up to three on reload or Triple Tap gets you seven crit shots without reloading. In the second column, Vorpal Weapon adds 15% damage against Majors, Bosses and vehicles or High-Impact Reserves will add up to 25% bonus damage once you get past the second bullet. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-God, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// BrayTech Werewolf PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Appended Mag, Pugilist, Osmosis
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice utility roll for endgame content, particularly soloing. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Excellent, pretty much best-in-class stats, and the precision frame means you don't really have to worry about Recoil Direction, so boost your gunfeel stats with your barrel and mag. You can turn this into a Legendary mini-Monte Carlo with Pugilist in the first trait column and pair this with Osmosis in the second for an additional primary energy weapon option when you use your grenade - useful as a utility roll, and for soloing activities in particular. This won't replace a Demolitionist/Osmosis The Last Breath, and you only really need one Osmosis auto rifle in your Vault, but you never know - Bungie might just add melee kills to proc... Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. // Jurassic Green PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Perpetual Motion, Adaptive Munitions
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for Barrier Champions and match game endgame content. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Dreadful stats compared to any other energy rapid-fire pulse rifle as at v6.2.5.1, but it's the only solar one currently available. Wonky recoil direction of 50, so you'll need to straighten that out as much as possible with a Recoil Direction barrel, Stability Barrel or a bit of both. Armor-Piercing Rounds adds 5% damage to shields in your mag slot. Perpetual Motion boosts gunfeel stats passively and, if you don't already have a better solar pulse rifle with Adaptive Munitions, then you should always have one in your vault to both deal with Barrier Champions, when the mod's around, or for dealing with shields in match game activities. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. // Trustee PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and end-game content. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits the amount depends on the weapon archetype. Good stats by comparison with other rapid-fire scouts, and there are a couple of ways to go with your roll. The first thing to do is sort out the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, which also helps handling a bit. Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell add stability and reload speed and an extra bullet for Tac Mag. Rapid Hit or Perpetual Motion layers more stability and reload speed - stability is good to help stay on a crit spot. Incandescent is great for add clear and hits your solar verbs. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Succession PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Extended Mag, Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag, Reconstruction, Firing Line, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits the amount depends on the weapon archetype. Pretty much best in-subfamily stats, but any kinetic sniper has to offer a lot to stand out from the crowd. If you decide this is for you, the best rolls are more for burst damage against majors and stunned Champions. Fluted Barrel adds handling and stability, or go all-in to stability with Polygonal Rifling. You can use Tactical Mag to add stability and reload speed, Alloy Mag to help with reloads on an empty mag, or maximise your magazine size with Extended Mag. For Majors, Reconstruction will double your magazine size so you can get up to 10 in the mag with Extended Mag and a Backup Mag mod. If you're in a group, Firing Line provides a passive 20% bonus crit damage in a fireteam or, if you're running solo, Focused Fury can proc after three crit his, so your remaining shots have 20% bonus damage. Recommended MW: Handling or stability, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Heritage PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Reconstruction, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Majors in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits the amount depends on the weapon archetype. Great kinetic slug shotgun - good stats across the board. While they're no longer the pillar for majors and boss damage they once were, they still work well as a weapon to swap to for burst or sustained damage. Fluted Barrel or Smallbore are your barrel choices for extra stability with a side order of handling or range depending on your preference. Assault Mag's increased fire rate is effectively a 7.7% boost to DPS, or Tactical Mag lets you get to the maximum of 8 in the mag with a Backup Mag mod. Reconstruction overfills your magazine to double size which means you only need to hit three or four crits, depending on how close you get to the magazine limit, for 11s 12s with the Enhanced Perk for a 20% damage boost for the remainder of the magazine with Focused Fury. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Pugilist, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for melee builds in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits the amount depends on the weapon archetype. Great kinetic slug shotgun - good stats across the board. While they're no longer the pillar for majors and boss damage they once were, they still work well as a weapon to swap to for burst or sustained damage. Fluted Barrel or Smallbore are your barrel choices for extra stability with a side order of handling or range depending on your preference. Assault Mag's increased fire rate is effectively a 7.7% boost to DPS, or Tactical Mag lets you get to the maximum of 8 in the mag with a Backup Mag mod. or melee builds, Pugilist and Swashbuckler are the natural choice - get a melee kill for a refreshable 33% damage boost, and then each hit regenerates a little melee energy from the origin trait, while each kill regenerates a full 20%. // Commemoration PvE first-choice roll
// // Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag, Reconstruction, Fourth Time's the Charm, Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for burst or sustained majors or boss damage in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits the amount depends on the weapon archetype. Good stats and a stellar PvE perk pool make this an LMG worth chasing. You can choose to sort the recoil with Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel, or improve stability with Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. Most mag choices could have a role - boost your magazine size with Appended or Extended Mag, reload speed with Flared Magwell or Alloy Mag, or both with Tactical Mag. If you're focusing on one target for damage, Reconstruction overflows your mag to doble size, or Fourth Time's the Charm can keep you topped up against a big boss crit, while Firing Line boosts damage by 20% when you're in a fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Bequest PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for major or boss damage in end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits the amount depends on the weapon archetype. The standout stat here is impact, which is 10 points higher than for any other adaptive sword, which makes it competitive in end-game content for chunkier adds. Jagged Edge adds more damage and Swordmaster's Guard increases you heavy attack charge rate. For major or boss damage in a crowd - think Duality - Relentless Strikes returns ammo for every three hits, and Surrounded boosts damage by 36.5% 47% for the Enhanced Park. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Bequest PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Thresh, Unrelenting, Demolitionist
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for melee or grenade builds. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits the amount depends on the weapon archetype. The standout stat here is impact, which is 10 points higher than for any other adaptive sword, which makes it competitive in end-game content for chunkier adds. Jagged Edge adds more damage and Swordmaster's Guard increases you heavy attack charge rate. You can build into the origin perk benefits - 2% to all abilities on a hit, with either Thresh or Wellspring in the first trait column and Demolitionist in the second. Recommended MW: Impact, with a Backup Mag or damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Midha's Reckoning PvP first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore, Projection Fuse, Accelerated Coils, Backup Plan, Successful Warm-Up
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 277 with @illPhysics and thanks to @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick - one of those rare weapons that works for both duelling and kill-chaining. Shapeable. Definitely not meta out of the box as at v6.2.0.7 with a base TTK of 1.09s with four bolts, but there's a perk combination that helps with that. Most stats are okayish, with Aim Assistance a standout highest in class - add in some targeting mods on the weapon and helmet if you want to build into this weapon. You're only firing five bolts, so you can spec into range with your barrel, as controlling the recoil should be easier. With the battery perk, you might be tempted by Accelerated Coils for an even faster charge time, but you'll probably get more use from Projection Fuse's extra range for consistency. The real fun is in the two trait columns - Backup Plan gets you to 100 Handling on swapping, and brings the TTK for your first shot down to 0.81s. After your first kill, Successful Warm-Up kicks into reduce it still further to 0.73s. You still need to hit 4 out of 5 bolts, but the targeting mods make that much easier to achieve, and the TTK is faster than an out-of-the-box Rapid Fire Fusion Rifle. Recommended MW: Range, with a Targeting Adjustor mod. tags:pvp, pvp-duel, pvp-chain, pvp-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=3250034553,2969185026,1600092898,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=1467527085,2969185026,1600092898,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=202670084,2969185026,1600092898,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=3250034553,689005463,1600092898,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=1467527085,689005463,1600092898,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=202670084,689005463,1600092898,2652708987

// Midha's Reckoning Harrowed PvP first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore, Projection Fuse, Accelerated Coils, Backup Plan, Successful Warm-Up
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 277 with @illPhysics and thanks to @Legoleflash. First-choice PvP pick - one of those rare weapons that works for both duelling and kill-chaining. Shapeable. Definitely not meta out of the box as at v6.2.0.7 with a base TTK of 1.09s with four bolts, but there's a perk combination that helps with that. Most stats are okayish, with Aim Assistance a standout highest in class - add in some targeting mods on the weapon and helmet if you want to build into this weapon. You're only firing five bolts, so you can spec into range with your barrel, as controlling the recoil should be easier. With the battery perk, you might be tempted by Accelerated Coils for an even faster charge time, but you'll probably get more use from Projection Fuse's extra range for consistency. The real fun is in the two trait columns - Backup Plan gets you to 100 Handling on swapping, and brings the TTK for your first shot down to 0.81s. After your first kill, Successful Warm-Up kicks into reduce it still further to 0.73s. You still need to hit 4 out of 5 bolts, but the targeting mods make that much easier to achieve, and the TTK is faster than an out-of-the-box Rapid Fire Fusion Rifle. Recommended MW: Range, with a Targeting Adjustor mod. tags:pvp, pvp-duel, pvp-chain, pvp-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3904516037&perks=3250034553,2969185026,1600092898,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=3904516037&perks=1467527085,2969185026,1600092898,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=3904516037&perks=202670084,2969185026,1600092898,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=3904516037&perks=3250034553,689005463,1600092898,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=3904516037&perks=1467527085,689005463,1600092898,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=3904516037&perks=202670084,689005463,1600092898,2652708987

// Defiance of Yasmin PvP first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Accurized Rounds, Snapshot Sights, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 277 with @illPhysics. First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Decent stats and a very open 40 Zoom sight - you could almost imagine you're firing a Scout Rifle. As with most snipers, you're looking for snappy handling and as much crit stickiness as possible - Fluted Barrel and Accurized Rounds, and then Snapshot Sights even after the nerf and Opening Shot tick all the boxes. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Radar Tuner to help you stay aware of your surroundings if hardscoping, Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod depending on your preference. tags:pvp, pvp-duel, pvp-chain, pvp-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3228096719&perks=1840239774,3142289711,957782887,47981717

// originally found at https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep34-s18-nightfall-weapons.txt

title:Season 18 Nightfall weapons
description:Newly reprised weapons dropping from Season of Plunder Nightfalls

// The Militia's Birthright PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Blinding Grenades, Quickdraw, Lead From Gold, Auto-Loading Holster
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 34. PvE first-choice roll for minor add control in end-game content. Probably only necessary if you've not already got a Blinding Grenade roll on an Ignition Code or Pardon Our Dust. Handling and Velocity are what you need in your barrel, and Quick Launch delivers both. Blinding Grenades is always great for easier add control, particularly in crowds, and there's a case for both Quickdraw or Lead From Gold in your first trait column, paired with Auto-Loading Holster in the second so that you always have a shot ready. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling - there's really nothing much a mod can add directly as you're not aiming for kills, so maybe Backup Mag mod's increase ammo reserves is the best option, but feel free to plug in what works for you. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Out of Bounds PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, High-Calibre Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Demolitionist, Golden Tricorn, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for Arc subclasses in end-game content. Drops from Crucible activities, so reset your reputation as many times as you have patience for first, to maximise the trait options from decrypting engrams. Stability is helpful with the bullet output, but a little extra Range or Handling is useful too. For end-game content with Arc subclasses Demolitionist with either Golden Tricorn or Adrenaline Junkie makes the most of your grenade options with hefty damage boosts, with the kills recharging grenade energy. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Boudica-C PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Threat Detector, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. Sidearms aren't first choice for end-game activities but, if you're forced to use one there because of an anti-Champion mod, the you do have some options here. Range is highly constrained maximising it only gets you another 0.7m when ADS, so you'll get more value out of Handling or Stability from your barrel, and any of the combat effect mods Armor-Piercing, High Caliber or Riochet Rounds will work. For end-game stuff, you'll have to get close up, so use that to your advantage with Threat Detector and then Surrounded provides a hefty 46% damage boots with the spec mod once that's rolled in to the perk by Bungie, go for a damage-boosting mod or Backup Mag. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Surrounded Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Boudica-C PvE backup roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Appended Mag, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Stats For All, One For All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE backup roll for endgame content. Sidearms aren't first choice for end-game activities but, if you're forced to use one there because of an anti-Champion mod, the you do have some options here. Range is highly constrained maximising it only gets you another 0.7m when ADS, so you'll get more value out of Handling or Stability from your barrel. Looking at using a SOFA Stats/One For All roll, you might want to prioritise the number of bullets or reload speed with your mag, with SOFA taking 3 shots or 25% of your magazine to proc, so Appended Mag, Flared Magwell or Light Mag would help keep the bullets coming. Stats For All boosts your gunfeel stats, and One For All adds a useful 35% damage boost just for hitting three different targets. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Pizzicato-22 PvE first-choice roll
// Extended Barrel, Ricochel Rounds, Perpetual Motion, Ensemble, Osmosis
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Good overall stats, but has 1 less point of Zoom than its competitors, so you might need to add a little extra range to make up for that with the barrel and mag choices - Extended Barrel does this and take the Recoil Direction to a maximum 100. Ricochet Rounds then pushes Range out by a total of about 1.25m, and smooths things with a dab of Stability too. Perpetual Motion anywhere or Ensemble in a fireteam both help with gunfeel stats and, if you haven't already got an Osmosis SMG you really only need one in your Vault, it'll give you another option for weapon energy type, which can be useful in solo endgame content. Recommended MW: Range or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Ammit AR2 PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Turnabout, Adaptive Munitions
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content, particularly for Barrier Champions or solar burn activities. Shapeable. Good stats by comparison with other energy Precision frame ARs. Focus on Handling or Stability in the barrel, as with the Precision Frame you don't need to worry about Recoil Direction,  and Armor-Piercing Rounds adds 5% damage against shields. For end-game content, especially when the relevant anti-Barrier Champion mod's around or in solar burn activities, Adaptive Munitions will quickly take down barriers and shields, and Turnabout gives you an overshield. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Taipan-4fr PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Triple Tap, Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for sustained damage against bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. An end-game LFR that you don't need to complete a Raid, Dungeon or Trials for, which works for both burst and sustained damage, especially with the Veist Stinger origin trait throwing in extra shots for free at random. A Handling barrel just makes using it snappier, and Enhanced Battery with Backup Mag gets you to the magic seven shots in your battery, to give the origin trait ten shots with Triple Tap to proc if you hit crits. For Raid bosses or static bosses, where you'll be in a fireteam as a group, Firing Line adds a solid 20% bonus damage. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Smite of Merain PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Stats For All, One For All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Excellent in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! Arrowhead Brake will straighten up the recoil direction, but to be honest you could go with boosts to stability or handling instead. Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell help with stability and reload speed. For endgame content, you'll have plenty of bullets to proc a SOFA Stats for All/One for All roll for boosts to gunfeel stats and a chunky damage bonus. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32.  PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Excellent in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! Arrowhead Brake will straighten up the recoil direction, but to be honest you could go with boosts to stability or handling instead. Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell help with stability and reload speed. For endgame content, it's unusual to be able to have two damage perks on a weapon, but Focused Fury can pair well with Firefly for dealing with groups of Minor adds and the occasional Major. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32.  PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Excellent in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! Arrowhead Brake will straighten up the recoil direction, but to be honest you could go with boosts to stability or handling instead. Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell help with stability and reload speed. For endgame content, it's unusual to be able to have two damage perks on a weapon, but Focused Fury can pair well with Vorpal Weapon for dealing with chunkier Minors, the occasional Major, and with Champions, when there's a matching mod around. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-champion, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Doom of Chelchis PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Stats For All, One For All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! With a Precision Frame, you won't need to worry too much about recoil direction, and you already have tonnes of range, so focus on Stability and Handling, with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to help further with stability and reload speed. Although less useful with precision weapons although reloading in a fireteam with the origin perk should give you plenty of shots to use to proc, your SOFA Stats/ One For All roll is a good as ever for gunfeel stat and damage boosts. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Doom of Chelchis PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Adaptive Munitions, Frenzy, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! With a Precision Frame, you won't need to worry too much about recoil direction, and you already have tonnes of range, so focus on Stability and Handling, with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to help further with stability and reload speed. Adaptive Munitions is S-Tier in endgame, match game, content and when paired with a damage-boosting trait like Frenzy or Focused Fury, you have everything you need for enemies shileded or not in end-game content. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Zaouli's Bane PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Mag, Ensemble, One For All, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! Use the barrel to round out your preferred Range/ Stability/ Handling stat, and then you want as many bullets in the mag as possible with Extended Mag using a trait to help with the reload penalty, to help with the origin trait boost. For end-game content with a fireteam, Ensemble helps with your reloads and handling, and One For All or Focused Fury are your reliable damage boost sources. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Zaouli's Bane PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Explosive Payload, Firefly
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for general content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! Use the barrel to round out your preferred Range/ Stability/ Handling stat, and then you want as many bullets in the mag as possible with Tactical Mag or Appended Mag plus the Backup Mag mod, to help with the origin trait boost. Then shape your own solar Fatebringer with Explosive Payload in the first trait slot which, adds flinch and damage, and is useful to disrupt Overload Champions with a matching mod, and Firefly which should have the spec mod effects rolled in soon by Bungie in the second. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Defiance of Yasmin PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Barrel, Ensemble, Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats, plus the lowest Zoom in class. Add Handling with the barrel, and then maximise your mag size with Extended Mag and Backup Mag together. Ensemble builds into the Origin Perk, which gives you up to 14 in the mag with a fireteam of six, and also offsets the Reload Speed penalty, and then Firing Line adds 20% crit damage in a fireteam see all that synergy! for sustained Boss damage. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
