// Qullim's Terminus PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Stats For All, Heating Up, Unrelenting, Firefly
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. The only High-Impact Stasis LMG available as at v6.2.0.6, but comparing to other HIs, the stats are a mixed bunch. It's slow-firing, so you should be able to control the recoil with extra stability from the barrel choice. Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell are both good choices in the mag slot. Treat this as a heavy Scout Rifle for dealing with beefier adds and choose your traits accordingly - Stats For All or Heating Up add significant gunfeel boosts, or Unrelenting helps with health regeneration. To boost Minor add-clear potential, Firefly should be proccing a lot on headshots to thin out crowds. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Qullim's Terminus Harrowed PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Stats For All, Heating Up, Unrelenting, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for Stasis builds in end-game content. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. The only High-Impact Stasis LMG available as at v6.2.0.6, but comparing to other HIs, the stats are a mixed bunch. It's slow-firing, so you should be able to control the recoil with extra stability from the barrel choice. Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell are both good choices in the mag slot. Treat this as a heavy Scout Rifle for dealing with beefier adds and choose your traits accordingly - Stats For All or Heating Up add significant gunfeel boosts, or Unrelenting helps with health regeneration. For Stasis subclasses, Headstone provides a starting point for boosting abilities, crowd control or gaining damage reduction. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Brigand's Law PvE first-choice roll
// Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Extended Barrel, Appended Mag, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content assuming you're brave!. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, and in particular for melee-heavy playstyles. Any of the recoil direction barrels will get you to the maximum 100, and Appended Mag gets you to the maximum base size of 18, with no penalties. Threat Detector or Perpetual Motion both add to useful stats Threat Detector, in particular, works with the Origin Trait's CQC focus, and in the final trait column, Surrounded gives a huge passive boost to CQC damage. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Sailspy Pitchglass PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Extended Battery, Clown Cartridge, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, so won't be much use for a LFR. Struggles in a field dominated by Stormchaser, but it is better than Tarantula, if you're looking to replace a roll. Arrowhead Brake should help with landing repeated crit shots, and Enhanced Battery is the only real choice in your second column. For Boss damage, Clown Cartridge and Focused Fury are you best sustained damage combination - get three crits, and then the rest of the magazine does 20% bonus damage. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Planck's Stride PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Extended Magazine, Killing Wind, Perpetual Motion, One For All, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, so you might find it some use if you're lucky. Arrowhead Brake helps tidy up the recoil direction, and Extended Magazine keeps you firing for as long as possible, even with a reload penalty. Then Killing Wind helps with a bit of Range and mobility, or Perpetual Motion adds useful gunfeel stats, and One For All or Swashbuckler improve your damage output for beefier add clear.  Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-boss, controller, mkb

Then Heating Up corrects for Recoil Direction and adds more stability, and One For All or Swashbuckler improve your damage output for beefier add clear.  Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-boss, controller, mkb

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for general content. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, so you might find it some use if you're lucky. // Wastelander M5 PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Slideshot, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 26. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. The first Tex Mechanica legendary weapon - a lightweight, so it boosts mobility for movement speed. To clear majors, use Full Choke to constrain the pellet spread a little, Tactical Mag for an extra bullet in the magazine or Assault Mag if you miss a pellet. Then, Slideshot lets you take advantage of your extra mobility to reload while sliding, and One-Two Punch lets you take advantage of the many great melee options out there. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// The Last Breath PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Demolitionist, Osmosis
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 25. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Adaptive auto-rifles are still pretty competitive as at S17 v4.1.5.2. In the same slot as Duty Bound or Scathelocke, which both have better Zoom, so you might need a touch of either range or stability, depending on preference, to compensate. Arrowhead Brake helps tidy up the wonky recoil and one of the Combat Effect magazines adds a little range and some utility effect. For end-game, particularly solo, content, it's difficult to top Demolitionist and Osmosis to give you an additional element to help break shields. Drops from the second Hexahedron Room encounter if you're looking to farm it. Recommended MW: Stability, Range or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-minor, controller, mkb

// The Last Breath PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Ensemble, Subsistence, One For All, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 25. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Adaptive auto-rifles are still pretty competitive as at S17 v4.1.5.2. In the same slot as Duty Bound or Scathelocke, which both have better Zoom, so you might need a touch of either range or stability, depending on preference, to compensate. Arrowhead Brake helps tidy up the wonky recoil and one of the Combat Effect magazines adds a little range and some utility effect. For end-game content, Ensemble works well to assist reloads in a fireteam, or Subsistence helps top up your mag if you're isolated. Frenzy or One For All are good passive damage boosts. Drops from the second Hexahedron Room encounter if you're looking to farm it. Recommended MW: Stability, Range or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-minor, controller, mkb

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 25. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Stiff competition in the slot from Found Verdict, and suffers by comparison from having no adept version. If you're looking for a good One-Two Punch shotgun for use against Majors and the occasional Boss, Full Choke keeps the pellet spread tight, Tactical Mag increases mag size to maximum, and Slideshot gives you an instant reload between shots and punches/ slaps/ knifings. // A Sudden Death PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Threat Detector, Slideshot Field Prep, Grave Robber, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 25. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Stiff competition in the slot from Found Verdict, and suffers by comparison from having no adept version. For clearing heftier minors or groups of majors, choose a barrel that helps with handling or stability, then Assault Mag increases firing rate, or Tactical Mag/ Appended Mag increases mag size to maximum. Then Threat Detector, Grave Robber, Field Prep or Slideshot help to keep you shooting, and Frenzy provides a solid damage boost when in combat. Worth pairing with the Heavy Handed Charged With Light Mod for free ammo regeneration on CQC kills. Drops from the final Emissary chest if you're looking to farm it. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Vouchsafe PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Fourth Time's the Charm, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content and anti-Champion mods. Still worth looking at, even without an origin perk, for void burn activities. The Recoil Direction needs some love, so Arrowhead Brake is your top choice, and Tactical Mag gives an extra shot, stability and reload speed. For endgame and anti-Champion use particularly Overloads, Fourth Time's the Charm and Explosive Payload are your top choices for the two trait slots on mouse and keyboard. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod or a Full Auto Retrofit, to save your trigger finger. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, mkb

// Confined Launch, Impact Casing, Tracking Module, Auto-Loading Holster
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for endgame content. The highest damage subtype. Reduce the velocity with the barrel to improve the performance of Tracking Module, and improve damage with Impact Casing in the mag. Then pair with a boss damage special weapon, and let Auto-Loading Holster do its job after firing while you continue with a sustained damage phase. Crafting with a Surrounded Enhanced and Spec mod gives a 47% CQC damage boost which means that, if you're radiant, you can 1-tap. . // Ros Arago IV PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Rewind Rounds, Subsistence, Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. There aren't that many void auto-rifles obtainable in S23 and, while Ros Arago IV stats aren't great, there are still a couple of fun rolls worth looking out for. The Recoil Direction could probably do with some taming - Arrowhead Brake takes it to a much better looking 77. Otherwise, if you can control the shots, Smallbore adds a decent bump to range and stability as the barrel perk. In the magazine per slot, you could make an argument for Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell or Accurized Rounds to round out the stats a little further. Looking at Onslaught in the second trait column, the obvious pairings to keep the magazine topped off in the first column are Rewind Rounds or Subsistence. Finally, the submunitions generated by the Wild Card origin trait are great for helping soften up crowds. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Range, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Ros Arago IV PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Permeability, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. There aren't that many void auto-rifles obtainable in S23 and, while Ros Arago IV stats aren't great, there are still a couple of fun rolls worth looking out for. The Recoil Direction could probably do with some taming - Arrowhead Brake takes it to a much better looking 77. Otherwise, if you can control the shots, Smallbore adds a decent bump to range and stability as the barrel perk. In the magazine per slot, you could make an argument for Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell or Accurized Rounds to round out the stats a little further. In the first trait column, this is the only current as at v7.3.0.6 auto rifle with Permeability, which is a great pairing for Golden Tricorn in the second column, so you can match damage to any subclass to proc the second damage stack. Finally, the submunitions generated by the Wild Card origin trait are great for helping soften up crowds. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Range, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Belisarius-D PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Alloy Mag, Vorpal Weapon, Deconstruct
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for damage against vehicles and constructs in end-game content. Belisarius-D Belisarius isn't a dinosaur, but rather a 5th Century Byzantine general has strong stats but, like all Aggressive Burst pulse rifles, suffers poor handling and reload speed. Arrowhead Brake adds handling and corrects the recoil direction to 100 or Fluted Barrel gives the highest handling bump as the barrel perk. Flared Magwell, or as an alternative, Light Mag or Alloy Mag help out with reload in the magazine slot. For a unique roll - something to add to a collection, just in case you ever need it - Vorpal Weapon is in the first trait column!, so if you pair it with Deconstruct in the second and Hakke Breach Armaments as the origin trait, with a Boss Spec mod, and that's every perk available that provides additional damage against vehicles and constructs. Now all you've got to do is decide where to use it... Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Boss Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=839105230,3230963543,1546637391,3993379141,1607056502
dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=1840239774,3230963543,1546637391,3993379141,1607056502
dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=4090651448,3230963543,1546637391,3993379141,1607056502
dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=839105230,679225683,1546637391,3993379141,1607056502
dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=1840239774,679225683,1546637391,3993379141,1607056502
dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=4090651448,679225683,1546637391,3993379141,1607056502

// Belisarius-D PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Alloy Mag, Slice, Rapid Hit, Keep Away, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for Strand subclasses. Belisarius-D Belisarius isn't a dinosaur, but rather a 5th Century Byzantine general has strong stats but, like all Aggressive Burst pulse rifles, suffers poor handling and reload speed. Arrowhead Brake adds handling and corrects the recoil direction to 100 or Fluted Barrel gives the highest handling bump as the barrel perk. Flared Magwell, or as an alternative, Light Mag or Alloy Mag help out with reload in the magazine slot. The traits are mostly PvP flavoured but Slice and Hatchling in the first and second trait columns work together as a weapon to synergise with Strand subclass fragments - this could make it a good option as part of a Bait and Switch rotation with Slice reducing outgong damage from a major boss by 40% when procced - or alternatively, Rapid Hit and Keep Away, again in the first column bump up gunfeel stats. Short Action Stock is the stock of choice, for another +15 to handling. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Boss Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Breakneck PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Subsistence, Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. Breakneck is back, and has very solid stats, although it looks like we're never going to see the OG and OP Rampage/ Onslaught version again. As a precision frame AR, you don't need to worry about recoil direction, so if you want a variation on the curated version, you might prefer Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling as your barrel park, but Extended Magazine or Appended Magazine are definitely the top two options for the magazine. For your general content add-clearing, the combination of Subsistence and Onslaught in the first and second trait columns should minimise your need to reloads while you're working your way through crowds of adds. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Appetence PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Overflow, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. Shapeable. Appetence which means "a natural craving, desire or affinity", seeing as you're asking is the first legendary Stasis trace rifle. It has decent stats, and some interesting trait combinations. Take your pick of handling and/or stability and maybe a touch of recoil direction, if you need it to be a perfect 100, for the barrel perk. With an eye on Overflow as the support perk in the first trait column, Ionized Battery maximises the battery size. Enhanced Overflow gives you 229 in the battery, and 476 total ammo so 247 in reserve with no Reserve mods, up to 606 with three, and with it topping up the battery, for just picking up an ammo brick, you might never need to reload. Headstone generates Stasis crystals on crit kills, so lets you build into Stasis verbs and fragments. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Appetence PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Demolitionist, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. Shapeable. Appetence which means "a natural craving, desire or affinity", seeing as you're asking is the first legendary Stasis trace rifle. It has decent stats, and some interesting trait combinations. Take your pick of handling and/or stability and maybe a touch of recoil direction, if you need it to be a perfect 100, for the barrel perk. Enhanced Battery increases the magazine without a reload penalty and, while Demolitionist on a trace rifle only returns the same grenade energy as a primary weapon, you should be getting enough kills to make the payoff worth it. Headstone generates Stasis crystals on crit kills, so lets you build into Stasis verbs and fragments - Whisper of Shards will further improve grenade recharge rates. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Waking Vigil PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Subsistence, Kinetic Tremors, Attrition Orbs, Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with an arc subclass. As a former Lightweight HC that's been crowbarred into the Adaptive subfamily, the stats look very weird, with low range and stability but high handling and reload speed. If you haven't already got a decent arc hand cannon, then you could push out the range a bit, even at the cost of a little Handling, and add a little Stability. Any of the combat effect rounds in the mag perk slot Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber or Ricochet Rounds will add a tiny bit more range and utility in a firefight. Rapid Hit is the best support perk choice in the first column traits, although Perpetual Motion isn't bad either. If you don't already have a Voltshot hand cannon, this gives you access to one - jolting enemies lets you play into arc subclass verbs, and is great for crowd control and chunking down bulkier adds and the occasional major. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Vouchsafe PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Appeneded Mag, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a void subclass. The reprised Vouchsafe has returned with a plethora of PvE possibilities. You get the +20 Mobility from the Lightweight Frame, which is always great but on the downside you also have low Stability and Handling not such a problem with the origin trait and abysmal Recoil Direction. You can handle the wonky recoil with a combination of recoil and/or stability perks in the barrel and mag slots. You don't need a void subclass to make use of the trait combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds - they'll work perfectly well without - but you can improve the effect with void fragments. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Stay Frosty PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Accurized Rounds, Appended Mag, Enlightened Action, Collective Action
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. Like most world-drop weapons, Stay Frosty has pretty low stats by comparison to its subtype peers, so only keep a roll if it fills a gap in your vault. The recoil direction is directly up, but could do with tightening - Arrowhead Brake takes it to a controllable 85. For the mag perk, choose between Tactical Mag, Accurized Rounds and Appended Mag for additional stat boosts. There's not much for PvE in the first trait column - Enlightened Action provides some nice reload speed and handling boosts is the best support perk available. If you're running a Stasis subclass, Stasis shards should be pretty easy to generate for Collective Action to use for a 20% damage boost for 7s although you can interact with any elemental drop. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Vengeful Whisper PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Explosive Head, Hatchling
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy Minor Spec add-clearing in general content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Vengeful Whisper is no exception - even going as far as an extra point of zoom over other precision bows. This also has traits appearing in non-standard columns to make for some unique rolls. As with every bow, the aim is to reduce draw time first, and improve accuracy second - Elastic String does the first job and Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching does the second. With Explosive Head appearing in the first trait column as the support perk for a change, you have the option to go double-damage with Hatchling unfortunately Precision Instrument only boosts precision damage so is a bit of a trap perk with Explosive Head, particularly when paired with Thread of Evolution. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Vengeful Whisper PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Archer's Tempo, Hatchling
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy Minor Spec add-clearing in general content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Vengeful Whisper is no exception - even going as far as an extra point of zoom over other precision bows. This also has traits appearing in non-standard columns to make for some unique rolls. As with every bow, the aim is to reduce draw time first, and improve accuracy second - Elastic String does the first job and Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching does the second. The combination of Archer's Tempo in the first train column and Hatchling in the second will increase damage output through both increased rate-of-fire and Threadling damage, particularly when paired with Thread of Evolution. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add-clearing in general content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Vengeful Whisper is no exception - even going as far as an extra point of zoom over other precision bows. This also has traits appearing in non-standard columns to make for some unique rolls. As with every bow, the aim is to reduce draw time first, and improve accuracy second - Elastic String does the first job and Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching does the second. The combination of Archer's Tempo or Explosive Head in the first train column and Successful Warm-Up in the second will increase damage output either directly or through increased rate-of-fire. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. // Dragoncult Sickle PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Unrelenting, Tireless Blade, Chain Reaction, Hatchling
//notes: Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. This is the first new Caster-Frame sword we've seen in some time, and the first Strand one. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Dragoncult Sickle is no exception, having pretty good overall stats - both Impact and Ammo Capacity are higher than its peers. The advantage you have with caster frames is that you can hit from range with the heavy attack, but the ammo cost as at v7.3.0.3 is still a little high. If you're using this for add-clearing, one hit will equal one kill consistently so you might as well go for increased ammo with the blade perk. Swordmaster's Guard as the Guard perk improves regeneration of the heavy attack and then either Unrelenting or Tireless Blade provides health regeneration or ammo from thin air in the first trait column, and Chain Reaction or Hatchling particularly with Thread of Evolution help with add clearing in the second. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// originally found at https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep83-s22-festival-of-the-lost-weapons.txt

@title:Season 22 Festival of the Lost weapons
@description:New and reprised weapons from Festival of the Lost, with the Search Party origin trait

// Horror Story PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Accurized Rounds, Demolitionist, Enlightened Action, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Stasis synergy and add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Horror Story has returned and become a stasis precision auto-rifle - the first of its subtype. The stats are unexceptional, as you might expect from an event weapon but there are some trait combinations to save it. Recoil direction doesn't really matter on a precision-frame weapon, and stability is less important with a more reliable recoil direction, so you can choose your pick of Handling, Range and Reload Speed from your barrel and mag perks. Enlightened Action will get you pretty close to maxed out Handling and Reload at 5 stacks, or Demolitionist is difficult to turn down when it shows up in the first trait column as the support perk. In the second as the signature perk, Headstone is the main Stasis synergy trait, giving you crystals to work with your fragment, or burst and get even more grenade energy back with Demolitionist. Both origin traits are more PvP-orientated, but Nadir Focus's extra range and accuracy for free is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Jurassic Green PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for solar synergy and Minor Spec add-clearing in general content. Jurassic Green is a solar rapid-fire pulse, with the intrinsic 20% faster reload when its magazine is empty. It's got a similar stat range to its other world-drop peers, but comes a poor second to end-game drops in the energy slot. The recoil direction is a frankly awful 50 at base. The best even Arrowhead Brake can do is bring it up to a not entirely awful 80. Looking at the traits, you'll need to prioritise reload speed with the mag perk - Flared Magwell or Tactical Mag, together with the Masterwork. The new to season 22 Heal Clip in the first trait column as the support perk will apply one stack of Cure to you and anyone else near on reloading after a kill, while Incandescent spreads scorch and ignite to help clear adds - two solar verbs in a single package to enhance with your fragments. The Field Tested origin trait will just work steadily in the background to gradually improve your gunfeel, as long as you don't die! Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3103255595&perks=839105230,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3103255595&perks=839105230,106909392,3017780555,4293542123

// Jurassic Green PvE backup roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Accurized Rounds, Keep Away, Loose Changce, Perpetual Motion, Subsistence, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. Backup PvE pick for solar synergy and Minor Spec add-clearing in general content, if you don't already have a decent Incandescent pulse rifle, and haven't got around to shaping a BXR-55 Battler yet. Jurassic Green is a solar rapid-fire pulse, with the intrinsic 20% faster reload when its magazine is empty. It's got a similar stat range to its other world-drop peers, but comes a poor second to end-game drops in the energy slot. The recoil direction is a frankly awful 50 at base. The best even Arrowhead Brake can do is bring it up to a not entirely awful 80, and you can choose a little extra range, stability or reload speed with your mag slot perk. Then, in the first trait column as the support perk there are a few decent options to help with reload and gunfeel - Keep Away, Loose Change, Perpetual Motion and Subsistence. Incandescent in the second column as the signature perk is great for add clear, as you spread solar scorch and ignite around. The Field Tested origin trait is probably the better PvE trait of the two - it'll just work steadily in the background to gradually improve your gunfeel, as long as you don't die! Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Jurassic Green PvE backup roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Accurized Rounds, Keep Away, Loose Changce, Perpetual Motion, Subsistence, Golden Tricorn, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. Backup PvE pick for solar synergy and Minor Spec add-clearing in general content. Jurassic Green is a solar rapid-fire pulse, with the intrinsic 20% faster reload when its magazine is empty. It's got a similar stat range to its other world-drop peers, but comes a poor second to end-game drops in the energy slot. The recoil direction is a frankly awful 50 at base. The best even Arrowhead Brake can do is bring it up to a not entirely awful 80, and you can choose a little extra range, stability or reload speed with your mag slot perk. Then, in the first trait column as the support perk there are a few decent options to help with reload and gunfeel - Keep Away, Perpetual Motion and Subsistence. For damage, in the second column as the signature trait perk Golden Tricorn is an easy choice - you have plenty of tools in the solar kit to proc the second stack of +50% damage for 10s. Alternatively, you can generate plenty of firesprites or other elemental pickups for a regular +20% damage boost. The Field Tested origin trait is probably the better PvE trait of the two - it'll just work steadily in the background to gradually improve your gunfeel, as long as you don't die! Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Fang of Ir Yût Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Rapid Hit, Rewind Rounds, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy and add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Barrel and Mag re-shapeable. This is the first rapid-fire Strand scout rifle so you get an Alloy Mag-like 20% quicker reload animation when the magazine is empty, with best-in-class stats compared to other RFs in the kinetic slot. The recoil direction is a bit shonky, so Arrowhead Brake cleans that up a bit, but if you feel able to control it, Fluted Barrel adds to handling for general snappiness. You can choose from any of the combat effect rounds as the mag perk, depending on your preference. For your Strand Synergy, Rapid Hit helps with reload speed and stability, or Rewind Rounds extends your magazine in the first trait column as the support park, while Hatchling is the Strand option-de-jour in the second column as the signature perk. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Abyss Defiant PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Solar synergy add-clear against Minor Spec enemies in general content. Shapeable. High Impact Auto-Rifles aren't really first choice for PvE - they do have good range, and the frame intrinsic provides more accuracy when stationary or slow-moving, but Abyss Defiant has great stats and trait combinations, so may be worth a try. Handling is always low on HIs, so Fluted Barrel is your top barrel perk choice, although Arrowhead Brake does take recoil direction to 100, so is a decent option as well. In the mag perk slot, Flared Magwell offers the biggest boost to reload speed. The fun solar combination when you're not too underlevelled is the new-to-season-22 Heal Clip in the first trait column as the support perk, for a burst of Cure for you and anyone nearby when reloading after a kill, and Incandescent in the second column as the signature perk for add control and working with the scorth and ignite verbs. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=1840239774,1885400500,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1885400500,3017780555,4293542123

FFirst-choice PvE pick for Solar synergy add-clear against Minor Spec enemies in general content. Barrel and Mag re-shapeable. High Impact Auto-Rifles aren't really first choice for PvE - they do have good range, and the frame intrinsic provides more accuracy when stationary or slow-moving, but Abyss Defiant has great stats and trait combinations, so may be worth a try. Handling is always low on HIs, so Fluted Barrel is your top barrel perk choice, although Arrowhead Brake does take recoil direction to 100, so is a decent option as well. // Word of Crota PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Accurized Rounds, DRepulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. First-choice PvE pick for void synergy and add-clear against Minor Spec enemies in general content. Shapeable. Word of Crota drops with perfect recoil direction made even more perfect, if that's possible, by the intrinsic frame trait and best-in-slot stats so is definitely worth a look. You can use the barrel and mag perks to fill out gunfeel stats to your liking. For void synergy, you can use both current void traits - Repulsor Brace in the first column as the support perk, and Destabilizing Rounds in the second as the signature perk. Get your first kill, to spread volatility in groups of adds, and kill one to get a void overshield, and sync with void subclass verbs. Maybe not so useful with this roll, but the Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Showrunner PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Well Rounded, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The only other current lightweight SMG is Submission which is a stat monster, so Showrunner's stats look a bit poor by comparison, but there are still some interesting PvE rolls worth considering. Lightweights give you +20 Mobility and +6.25% to movement speed as the frame bonus to start. You can push out the range with the barrel perk - on M&KB, Full Bore provides an extra 1.36m of ADS range, and any of the combat effect rounds pushes that out an additional 0.45m. There are plenty of ways to proc the gunfeel boosts you get from Well Rounded and, once you've done that you can collect any generated elemental pickups to proc Collective Action which is unusual to see on a Kinetic weapon for a 20% damage boost. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1999754402&perks=202670084,1885400500,744594675,3324494224
dimwishlist:item=1999754402&perks=202670084,1561002382,744594675,3324494224
dimwishlist:item=1999754402&perks=202670084,1968497646,744594675,3324494224

// The Showrunner PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Well Rounded, Grave Robber, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The only other current lightweight SMG is Submission which is a stat monster, so Showrunner's stats look a bit poor by comparison, but there are still some interesting PvE rolls worth considering. Lightweights give you +20 Mobility and +6.25% to movement speed as the frame bonus to start. You can push out the range with the barrel perk - on M&KB, Full Bore provides an extra 1.36m of ADS range, and any of the combat effect rounds pushes that out an additional 0.45m. For melee-focussed builds, in the first trait column as the support perk, there are plenty of ways to proc the gunfeel boosts you get from Well Rounded or you can use Grave Robber to keep your mag topped up to make the most of Swashbuckler in the second, signature perk slot for 33% bonus damage. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb

// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Overflow, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The only other current lightweight SMG is Submission which is a stat monster, so Showrunner's stats look a bit poor by comparison, but there are still some interesting PvE rolls worth considering. Lightweights give you +20 Mobility and +6.25% to movement speed as the frame bonus to start. You can push out the range with the barrel perk - on M&KB, Full Bore provides an extra 1.36m of ADS range, and any of the combat effect rounds pushes that out an additional 0.45m. In the first trait column, as the support perk, Overflow lets you get to the highest stacks of single-target damage from Target Lock in the second column as the signature perk, for beefier Minor Spec adds. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. // Nightshade PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Enlightened Action, Outlaw, Collective Action, Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Nightshade is back - the same lightweight frame as in vanilla D2, which now gives you +20 Mobility and +6.25% to movement speed, but this time as a Strand weapon. The stats are solid by comparison with other kinetic options. Start by straightening up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, and then add one of the combat effect rounds - Ricochet also adds stability, but they are all useful. In the first trait column as the support park, either Enlightened Action boosts reload speed and handling to maximum in two 3-round bursts, or Outlaw maximises reload and applies a scalar. To pair with this in the second column signature slot, Collective Action boosts damage by 20% for 7s on an Elemental Pickup, or Kill Clip adds 25% damage for 5s after a precision kill. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Nightshade PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Keep Away, Enlightened Action, Outlaw, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy and add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Nightshade is back - the same lightweight frame as in vanilla D2, which now gives you +20 Mobility and +6.25% to movement speed, but this time as a Strand weapon. The stats are solid by comparison with other kinetic options. Start by straightening up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, and then add one of the combat effect rounds - Ricochet also adds stability, but they are all useful. In the first trait column as the support park, either Keep Away adds range reload speed and accuracy if you're keeping your distance, Enlightened Action boosts reload speed and handling to maximum in two 3-round bursts, or Outlaw maximises reload and applies an animation scalar too. To pair with this in the second column signature slot Hatchling, particularly with Threads of Evolution and Rebirth, is a natural choice for Strand subclasses. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Heliocentric QSc PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Alloy Mag, Heal Clip, Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Heliocentric translation "sun-centred" has great base stats, so you can go for a little extra range, stability or handling with your barrel park - that's pretty much down to your preference. Reload will be the most important magazine perk stat boosts, so Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag or even Alloy May are good picks. The unique trait combination that the chase is on for is Heal Clip as the first column support perk, and Kill Clip as the second column signature perk. Proccing both with a reload after a kill gives you and anyone near a burst of Cure, while adding 25% damage for 5s. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Heliocentric QSc PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Alloy Mag, Heal Clip, Demolitionist, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Solar synergy and add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Heliocentric translation "sun-centred" has great base stats, so you can go for a little extra range, stability or handling with your barrel park - that's pretty much down to your preference. Reload will be the most important magazine perk stat boosts, so Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag or even Alloy May are good picks. The new to S22 Heal Clip as the first column support perk provides you and any one nearby with a burst of Cure when you reload after a kill, or Demolitionist refunds grenade energy - pair either with Incandescent in the second column as the signature perk, for Solar synergy, with scorch and ignite kills adding to the grenade energy tally too. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Unending Tempest PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Accurized Rounds, Demolitionist, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. For M+KB, focus on range with your barrel and mag perks - stability is less useful and you can use trait perks to help boost handling and reload speed. Working backwards, Frenzy as the signature perk maxes out handling and reload speed, as well as adding 15% to damage. It's always great to see Demolitionist in the first trait column as your support perk for more grenades, and who doesn't love that, and the occasional instant refill when you throw one. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2510526114&perks=202670084,3142289711,3523296417,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2510526114&perks=3250034553,3142289711,3523296417,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2510526114&perks=1467527085,3142289711,3523296417,4104185692

First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. For M+KB, focus on range with your barrel and mag perks - stability is less useful and you can use trait perks to help boost handling and reload speed. Working backwards, Frenzy as the signature perk maxes out handling and reload speed, as well as adding 15% to damage. In the first trait column as your support perk, Subsistence will help keep your magazine topped up on kills, inbetween reloads. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. // Unending Tempest PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, Gutshot Straight, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. For M+KB, focus on range with your barrel and mag perks - stability is less useful and you can use trait perks to help boost handling and reload speed. Working backwards, Frenzy as the signature perk maxes out handling and reload speed, as well as adding 15% to damage. It's rare to get double damage perks outside of raid weapons, but Gutshot Straight in the first trait column boosts bodyshot damage by a further 10% - with a spray and pray weapon like an SMG, this could be the unique perk combination to chase. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb

// Unending Tempest PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, Demolitionist, Adrenaline Junkie, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. For M+KB, focus on range with your barrel and mag perks - stability is less useful and you can use trait perks to help with reloads. It's always great to see Demolitionist in the first trait column as a support perk for more grenades, and who doesn't love that, and the occasional instant refill when you throw one. In the second trait column as the signature perk, Adrenaline Junkie is a natural pairing, as is Collective Action from the elemental pickups you can generate from grenades. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb

// Unending Tempest PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Demolitionist, Enlightened Action, Perpetual Motion, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. For M+KB, focus on range with your barrel and mag perks - stability is less useful and you can use trait perks to help boost reload speed. It's always great to see Demolitionist in the first trait column as a support perk for more grenades, and who doesn't love that, and the occasional instant refill when you throw one, but Enlightened Action or Perpetual Motion are also great for the gunfeel boosts. In the second trait column as the signature perk, Headstone synergises with Stasis subclasses to generate a large crystal to proc fragment perk effects. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb

dimwishlist:item=2510526114&perks=3250034553,3142289711,1428297954,124408337
dimwishlist:item=2510526114&perks=1467527085,3142289711,1428297954,124408337

// Unending Tempest PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, Subsistence, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. For M+KB, focus on range with your barrel and mag perks - stability is less useful and you can use trait perks to help boost reload speed. For the trait combination, Subsistence as the support perk and Surrounded as the signature perk can work, even in end-game activity - the 40% damage boost from Surrounded should proc the partial mag refill from Subsistence fairly frequently to keep you in the fight for longer. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb

dimwishlist:item=2510526114&perks=3250034553,3142289711,1820235745,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=2510526114&perks=1467527085,3142289711,1820235745,3708227201

// Unending Tempest PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, Enlightened Action, Perpetual Motion Collective Action, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. For M+KB, focus on range with your barrel and mag perks - stability is less useful and you can use trait perks to help boost reload speed. In the first trait column as a support perk, both Enlightened Action and Perpetual Motion boost gunfeel stats, while in the second as the signature perk, Collective Action or Surrounded are both solid damage boosting options. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb

// The Guiding Sight PvE first-choice roll
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy and Minor Spec enemies in general content. The good news is that reprised Guiding Sight is now a Strand Scout Rifle. the bad news is that it's still a high-Impact frame, so it's the least competitive subtype. The stats are decent, so this might be an easier to obtain option, if you've not got a Strand scout already. With the barrel, you can buff some of the low stats - Handling and Stability, and then the mag can help with the reload speed, or just choose from one of the combat effect mags. For Strand synergy, Hatchling as the second trait column signature perk generates Threadlings on a crit kill - make sure you have the Thread of Generation fragment to make the most of them. As the first column support column perk to work with Hatchling, you could choose from Demolitionist and even more Threadlings for Warlocks, or Enlightened Action or Perpetual Motion add nice bumps to gunfeel stats. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Greasy Luck PvE first-choice roll
// Supercooled Accelerator, Auxiliary Reserves, Light Mag, Appended Mag, Drop Mag, Accurized Rounds, Swap Mag, Disruption Break, Close to Melee
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 67 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3wGaXiUGMNodLkPkGFdBd3?si=42e0db2e63a443b7 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in general activities. The first rapid-fire legendary glaive, which looks like it offers high rate-of-fire, handling and reload speed, but lower range, impact and shield duration. Supercooled Accelerator seems like the best of the haft perks to boost the range, or Auxiliary Reserves helps shore up the Shield Duration, both at the cost of one or both of handling and reload. There's not really a top pick for your mag, except to avoid Extended Mag. For glaive melee fans, the combination of Disruption Break in the first trait slot as the support perk weakens targets by 50% to kinetic damage for 5.5s once you've broken their shield with a glaive bolt and guess what? Glaive melees are kinetic, so you can slash away to your heart's content. If enemies don't have a shield, Close to Melee in the second column as the signature perk boosts your glaive melee damage by 30% for 10s for getting a projectile kill, with the timer being refreshed by 5s after another melee kill. The Restoration Ritual origin trait is also occasionally useful for an instant reload after proccing. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Rapacious Appetite PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Light Mag, Flared Magwell, Perpetual Motion, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Shapeable. Rapacious Appetite is one of only two Stasis aggressive SMGs as at S21, so there's not much to compare the stats against. But even so, the stability of 6 might make you pause. On the plus side, the range is the highest in the subfamily. Fortunately, for mouse and keyboard, you can ignore the stability and just go for range with the barrel choice and masterwork. In the mag, the Combat Effect perks all provide utility, you can boost Reload Speed through Light Mag or Flared Magwell. The easiest way to add the gunfeel stats you need in an end-game roll is through Perpetual Motion in the first trait column as your support perk or, alternatively you can extend the useful magazine through Fourth Time's The Charm. Then, to synergise with Stasis subclasses, Headstone in the second column as the signature perk, of you don't already have a Headstone Blood Feud SMG, provides a Stasis crystal on crit kills to use with Aspects and Fragments. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb

// Different Times PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Outlaw, Subsistence, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ??? 1840239774 1482024992 ???: First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in general content. Shapeable. Different Times is the first Strand pulse rifle but has poor base stats when compared with other kinetic slot options. The Recoil Direction is awful, so Arrowhead Brake is pretty much a must have in the barrel. Flared Magwell fills in some gunfeel stats, or the Combat Effect magazine perks are all viable. In general, non-endgame content Outlaw and Subsistence are both great for weapon uptime in the first trait column as your signature perk while, in the second column as the signature perk, the first stack of Golden Tricorn is easy to proc for 15% bonus damage, even if the second stack is more difficult to proc with a Strand subclass. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Different Times PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Outlaw, Subsistence, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ??? 1840239774 1482024992 ???: First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy and minor add clear in general content. Shapeable. Different Times is the first Strand pulse rifle but has poor base stats when compared with other kinetic slot options. The Recoil Direction is awful, so Arrowhead Brake is pretty much a must have in the barrel. Flared Magwell fills in some gunfeel stats, or the Combat Effect magazine perks are all viable. In general, non-endgame content Outlaw and Subsistence are both great for weapon uptime in the first trait column as your signature perk, and pair will with Hatchling in the second column as the signature perk, for Strand subclass synergy. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Different Times PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Heating Up, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clear in general content. Shapeable. Different Times is the first Strand pulse rifle but has poor base stats when compared with other kinetic slot options. While the Recoil Direction is terrible, we'll control that with one of the traits. Fluted Barrel or Smallbore help fill in a combination of handling, stability or range. Flared Magwell further fills in some gunfeel stats, or the Combat Effect magazine perks are all viable. To help control the recoil, Heating Up adds both stability and recoil direction after a kill to make this very easy to use, and, as this is the first primary weapon able to roll Collective Action, in the second column as the signature perk, that's probably the roll to go for, proccing 20% bonus damage for any elemental pickup. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Different Times PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Heating Up, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in general content. Shapeable. Different Times is the first Strand pulse rifle but has poor base stats when compared with other kinetic slot options. While the Recoil Direction is terrible, we'll control that with one of the traits. Fluted Barrel or Smallbore help fill in a combination of handling, stability or range. Flared Magwell further fills in some gunfeel stats, or the Combat Effect magazine perks are all viable. To help control the recoil, Heating Up adds both stability and recoil direction after a kill to make this very easy to use, and in the second column as the signature perk, the first stack of Golden Tricorn is easy to proc for 15% bonus damage, even if the second stack is more difficult to proc with a Strand subclass. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Targeted Redaction PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Triple Tap, Outlaw, Explosive Payload, Frenzy, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in general content. Unfortunately, Targeted Redaction looks great, but has poor stats by comparison with other void adaptive hand cannons. If you already have a decent Bottom Dollar roll, you can probably give this a pass. If you don't, then fill in the stat gaps as best you can - Fluted Barrel or Smallbore, and Tactical Mag all bump useful gunfeel stats and increase the mag size to 9. For general use, Triple Tap or Outlaw as the first trait column support park and Explosive Payload, Frenzy or Collective Action as the second column signature perk are reliable combinations to improve your gunfight uptime and boost damage. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3890055324&perks=1840239774,106909392,3400784728,3324494224
dimwishlist:item=3890055324&perks=1482024992,106909392,3400784728,3324494224

// Targeted Redaction PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Triple Tap, Outlaw, Destabilising Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Void synergy and minor add clear in general content. Unfortunately, Targeted Redaction looks great, but has poor stats by comparison with other void adaptive hand cannons. If you already have a decent Bottom Dollar roll, you can probably give this a pass. If you don't, then fill in the stat gaps as best you can - Fluted Barrel or Smallbore, and Tactical Mag all bump useful gunfeel stats and increase the mag size to 9. For general use, Triple Tap or Outlaw as the first trait column support park and Destabilising Rounds as the second column signature perk are reliable combinations to improve your gunfight uptime and clear groups of adds, building into Void 3.0 subclass verbs. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3890055324&perks=1840239774,106909392,3400784728,2048641572

// Spare Rations PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Subsistence, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor add-clearing in general content. Spare Rations is in a difficult place stats-wise still having the lower stats of the old 150 Lightweight subfamily even though it's been rolled into the Adaptives. However, it's the first hand cannon that can drop with Kinetic Tremors, so it might be worth keeping around in case a rework makes it a bit easier to proc. Fill in some of the stats with the barrel - Fluted Barrel or Smallbore bump your preference between range, stability and handling. In the mag, Flared Magwell bumps stats up a bit more, or Appended Mag gets you to the maximum of 14 shots. For general add clearing Subsistence in the first trait column as the support park keeps your magazine topped up as you get kills. In the second column as the signature perk, Kinetic Tremors does currently v7.1.0.2, S21 take six hits to proc, but if that's ever given a buff, this could be great for AoE damege for a group of adds while collecting ammo and orbs remotely. Recommended MW: any, based on your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3236112986&perks=1840239774,3230963543,1820235745,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=3236112986&perks=1482024992,3230963543,1820235745,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=3236112986&perks=1840239774,1087426260,1820235745,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=3236112986&perks=1482024992,1087426260,1820235745,3891536761

// Bug-Out Bag PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Flared Magwell, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Subsistence, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Solar synergy and Minor add-clearing in general content. If you haven't got an Incandescent Calus Mini-Tool, the Bug-Out Bag could be a very acceptable alternative. Decent stats, but Fluted Barrel or Smallbore layer on useful gunfeel stat bumps. Flared Magwell adds further stability and reload speed bumps, or any of the Combat Effect magazine perks adds utility, and a little range on top. In the first trait column as the support perk, Subsistence keeps your magazine topped up after a kill, and Incandescent as the second column signature perk is great for add clearing and builds into your scorch and ignite Solar verbs. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, mkb, controller
